{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"The best holiday lights","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-christmas-lights","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Holiday lights bring feelings of warmth and cheer even in the darkest and coldest days of the year.&#160;</li><li>The <a href=\"https://amzn.to/3mXXnyv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">KooPower Waterproof Battery Fairy Lights</a> are a great choice if you prefer white lights because they are controlled by a remote and powered by batteries.</li><li>If you prefer colorful lights, go with the <a href=\"https://amzn.to/2S7RqAQ\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Brizled LED Mini String Lights</a>, which come in 66-foot strands so you can decorate large areas with ease.&#160;<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B073F8HTC7/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B073F8HTC7&linkId=fd9a017b08773c0afdf0a15a0c35447508773c0afdf0a15a0c354475\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"></a></li></ul><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><p>I'm someone who likes their holiday lights and decorations. I spend hours and hours every November climbing up and down ladders and scrambling around on the roof stringing up dozens of feet of lights on every peak and roofline of the house.</p><p>With all those hours spent decorating come a fair share of frustrations, though, from blown bulbs to overloaded circuits and even the occasional ladder-related mishap. With those unhappy memories in mind, I've worked to assemble a buying guide filled with holiday lights that not only look great, but that also make your life easier.</p><p>Included with a couple of classic plug-in options, this guide features lights that are both solar- and battery-powered. We have lights controlled via a handheld remote or app and those that are beamed out of a projector.</p><p>Sure, those old strands of tiny incandescent bulbs you have tangled up in boxes on the garage shelves are probably fine, but these lights are definitely better. Upgrade your light game this season with these shining examples of great holiday lights.</p><h2><strong>Here are the best holiday lights:</strong></h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Best classic holiday lights: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B073F8HTC7/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B073F8HTC7&linkId=fd9a017b08773c0afdf0a15a0c35447508773c0afdf0a15a0c354475\" href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B014STP6I4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B014STP6I4&linkId=5dd9fedfbdad7b24f4901706202be88ebdad7b24f4901706202be88e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">KooPower Waterproof Battery Fairy Lights</a>&#160;</li><li>Best large-bulb lights: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00466IGCS/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00466IGCS&linkId=97446270f510d3b6303d1e5626523c34f510d3b6303d1e5626523c34\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Twinkly Smart LED String Lights</a></li><li>Best light projector: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">VMANOO Solar Powered String Lights</a></li></ul><p><em>Prices and links are current as of 12/10/20. We added a set of smart lights based on testing.&#160;</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best classic lights\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f72117c0ab50d00184accad?format=jpeg\" alt=\"brizled LED lights\" height=\"750\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>One 66-foot strand of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B073F8HTC7/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B073F8HTC7&#38;linkId=fd9a017b08773c0afdf0a15a0c354475\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Brizled LED Mini String&#160;Lights</a> features 200 LEDs and should provide enough colorful bulbs to decorate an entire tree.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Warm and bright light quality, durable lights last for years, spare bulbs and fuse included</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>No built-in timer</p><p>Just one 66-foot strand of these bright, colorful Brizled LED Lights, you should be able to decorate even an 8- or 9-foot tree. Each strand holds 200 individual bulbs in the classic blue, red, yellow, green, and orange assortment.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B073F8HTC7/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B073F8HTC7&#38;linkId=fd9a017b08773c0afdf0a15a0c354475\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Brizled LED Mini String&#160;Lights</a> are rated to last for 25,000 hours, so you probably won't have to replace the strand &#8212; possibly ever. Even if you leave your lights illuminated for a month straight every year, you can still expect about 35 years out of them.</p><p>The best thing about the Brizled LED Mini String Lights isn't their longevity, though, it's their looks. These bulbs approximate the same look as those beloved incandescent mini bulbs you'll remember from holiday seasons past, yet they use about 88% less power than traditional lights and never get hot enough to pose a risk of injury or fire. Plus, they're much brighter than incandescent bulbs, so you'll get much more pop from just one strand.</p><p>If colorful lights don't match the look you're going for, Brizled also makes them in both warm and cool white. And should you want to go full Griswold on your holiday decorations, you can safely connect up to 10 strands of these things.</p><p>These lights are perfect for indoor use thanks to their cool physical temperature and warm light quality. They are perfectly safe for outdoor use in all sorts of weather conditions.</p>\n\tThe best battery-powered lights\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a2034fbf914c329008b708a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"lights\" height=\"751\" width=\"1001\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">KooPower</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B014STP6I4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B014STP6I4&#38;linkId=5dd9fedfbdad7b24f4901706202be88e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">KooPower Waterproof Battery Fairy Lights</a>&#160;are battery powered and operated via remote control, so once they're in place, you can look forward to weeks of effortless enjoyment.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Battery power lasts many days, controlled by remote, tiny but bright bulbs, great price</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>36-foot strand too short for some applications, only come in warm white, batteries must be changed after 60 hours of use</p><p>One of the worst things about holiday lights is the fact that you have to plug them in every time you want them to light up and unplug them when you want them to go dark &#8212; unless you have a timer. But even with a timer, you still need the lights to end up near an outlet, or at least be close enough to the outlet that an extension cord can connect the two. With the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B014STP6I4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B014STP6I4&#38;linkId=5dd9fedfbdad7b24f4901706202be88e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">KooPower Waterproof Battery Fairy Lights with Remote and Timer</a>, both of those situations are things of the past.</p><p>The KooPower lights are powered by three AA batteries, and when only lit for a few hours each night, these three batteries will keep the lights aglow for days. With good quality batteries, the lights will shine for 60 hours before needing a change, so even if you left the lights on for four hours every night, that's more than two weeks per set, or likely only one battery change per holiday season. And what's more, you could set these lights up miles from the nearest power outlet if you really wanted to.</p><p>The remote control eliminates the need for ready access to the lights and for use of an external timer. With the remote, the lights can be programmed for an on/off cycle, set to twinkle, fade in and out, do a chasing flash pattern, and more. The lights stay cool, thus are safe for use on an indoor tree, and are water-resistant, thus suitable for outdoor hanging.</p>\n\tThe best large-bulb lights\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a203525f914c353018b7019?format=jpeg\" alt=\"classic lights\" height=\"1125\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Good Tidings</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The large, softly glowing colorful bulbs of the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00466IGCS/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00466IGCS&#38;linkId=97446270f510d3b6303d1e5626523c34\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Good Tidings Ceramic Multi-Colored Holiday Lights</a> look just like something out of a classic film.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Classic vintage charm, bright lights visible from a distance, easy bulb changes</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Short strand length, glow much warmer than LEDs</p><p>Sure, LED bulbs are bright, energy-efficient, cool to the touch, and last for years. But you have to admit, there's something so warm and comforting about classic incandescent bulb holiday&#160;lights &#8212; especially those oversized bulbs known \"in the business\" as C9 bulbs.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00466IGCS/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00466IGCS&#38;linkId=97446270f510d3b6303d1e5626523c34\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Good Tidings Ceramic Multi-Colored Holiday Light Set</a> comes with 25 big, colorful bulbs that shine with a light both bright and soft at once. They will light up your&#160;tree, they look great framing a window or doorway, and they're hard to beat when strung across the roofline of the home, especially when a blanket of snow rests around them.</p><p>The strand measures 24 feet long, a great length for an indoor tree though a bit short for use outdoors unless you're willing to buy a few strands. They will last for years, though, albeit with an occasional bulb swap needed. Doing so is easy, though. It's just like changing a standard light bulb.</p><p>The Good Tidings Ceramic Multi-Colored Holiday Lights are UL listed for indoor and outdoor use and they connect to any standard socket or extension cord. If the soft frosted bulb look isn't to your liking, they also come in a transparent variation.&#160;</p>\n\tThe best smart lights\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd2728530f2740018b0f242?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Twinkly smart string lights\" height=\"2274\" width=\"3024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Malarie Gokey/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Ftwinkly-tws100stp-gus-100-led-rgb-multicolor-26-ft-decorative-string-lights-bluetooth-wifi-and-app-controlled-for-home-bedroom-and-dorm-room-use%2F-%2FA-81498665%23lnk%3Dsametab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Twinkly's smart LED string lights</a> connect with an app so you can control the color scheme and turn them on and off with your phone or your voice.</h3><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Easy to set up and use, well-designed app, voice control supported by Alexa and Google Assistant, programmable lights, fun to make your own designs</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>Significantly more expensive than regular LED string lights</p><p>Twinkly's LED string lights are fully customizable, thanks to an easy-to-use app that lets you program your lights. You can choose between a wide range of pre-made light effects so your tree will twinkle like stars, display a heart, look like a glittery candy cane, or show off a pulsing rainbow. There's even a dongle you can add to synchronize your lights to music.</p><p>You can also go simple and choose solid colors or make your own mix in the app. The options are basically endless with more than 16 million colors to choose from. The LED lights are bright and vibrant, too, making any color combination look gorgeous.</p><p>The lights were easy to set up in our tests. It's as easy as plugging the lights in, downloading the app, and following the on-screen directions to connect your lights via Bluetooth or Wi-Fi.</p><p>I set the lights up with my home's Wi-Fi network so that I can control them remotely and with my voice. To enable voice control, I followed the instructions in the Alexa app to connect the lights to my Echo in just a few minutes. Now I can turn them on or off in the app or with my voice. Overall, the smart lights are easy to use, mainly because the app is so user friendly.&#160;</p><p>In terms of length, the 250-light strand perfectly covered my 7.5-foot tree, but depending on how densely packed you want the lights to be, you may need more lights. Twinkly sells several different smart light strands, so you can choose whichever ones are best for your needs.</p><p>The 100-light strand linked here is also on sale, making it a good deal. Under normal circumstances, and even when on sale, these lights are more expensive than ordinary lights, but if you want full customizability, voice control, and all the smart features included here, it'll be worth it. If not, grab a strand of normal lights and a smart outlet, <a href=\"https://api.narrativ.com/api/v0/client_redirect/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbestbuy.7tiv.net%2Fc%2F376373%2F633495%2F10014%3Fprodsku%3D5711458%26u%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Fwww.bestbuy.com%252Fsite%252F-%252F5711458.p%253Fcmp%253DRMX%26nrtv_cid%3D.nrtv_plchldr.%26subId2%3Dbusinessinsider%26subId3%3D1726169582535364916%26subId1%3Dgeneral&#38;a=1722832272892343781&#38;uuid=5340bb7f-0558-416f-92a2-a87ddb729616&#38;uid_bam=1716420010770730669&#38;ar=1726169582535364916\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">like this one from Belkin</a>.&#160;<em>&#8212; Malarie Gokey</em></p>\n\tThe best solar-powered holiday lights\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7218af0ab50d00184acce0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"VMANOO solar christmas lights\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Once you have your <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B074M2V2BK/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B074M2V2BK&#38;linkId=bf9ea35f7216f030d0d0759167b2e47f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">VMANOO Solar Powered String Lights</a> set up where you want them, they are 100% hands-off until it's time to take the lights down again at the end of the holiday season.</h3><p><strong>Pros</strong>:&#160;No outlet or batteries needed, sensor turns lights on or off, available in multiple colors</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>Limited shine duration per charge</p><p>Once you have the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B074M2V2BK/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B074M2V2BK&#38;linkId=bf9ea35f7216f030d0d0759167b2e47f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">VMANOO Solar Powered String Lights</a>&#160;where you want them, you don't have to think about these lights again until it's time to put them away after the holidays. That is, except when you admire them or get compliments from others.&#160;</p><p>The lights are 100% solar-powered, requiring no proximity to an outlet, no battery swaps, and no programming with a timer or searching for a remote control, either. The lights have a sensor that automatically turns them on once the ambient light is low enough and that will switch them back off once the sun is again filling the sky.</p><p>Though to be honest, they will probably have dimmed or switched off entirely before that happens, as they have an approximate eight-hour run-time per charge. Don't worry, though, that's plenty long enough. Even with a dead of winter 4:30 p.m. sunset, the lights will still be aglow well after midnight.&#160;</p><p>The&#160;VMANOO Solar Powered String Lights come in a 72-foot strand, so you will be able to decorate a smaller tree or bush, an entire roofline, or to frame a number of windows and/or doors with a single strand.&#160;As they come in pale white, warm white, multicolored, and blue, you can choose the exact look you want for your holiday illumination.</p><p>The one major drawback to these lights is that they're hardly suitable for indoor use, as they need access to the sun to power up and need it to be dark in order to power on.&#160;</p>\n\tThe best holiday light projector\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7216a70ab50d00184accc0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"yinuo christmas light projector\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The remote-controlled <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07RP5ZR8M/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07RP5ZR8M&#38;linkId=3368dc21206e5c731c4e8cacbaeaa688\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Yinuo Christmas Laser Lights Outdoor Projector</a> shines a swirling pattern of red and green stars or other holiday patterns on your home with a simple point and click. It's currently out of stock.</h3><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Amazingly easy setup, remote control operation, good price point</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>Lacks charm of actual strands of lights</p><p>Holiday laser light decorations aren't for everyone, I get that. But falling off of ladders, searching for that one burnt out bulb, and realizing you don't have a long enough extension cord to connect the light strands to the outlet? That stuff isn't for everyone, either. A gently swirling, twinkling display of red and green stars, Christmas trees, Santas, and snowflakes is quite the attractive alternative.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07RP5ZR8M/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_120417_best-christmas-lights-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07RP5ZR8M&#38;linkId=3368dc21206e5c731c4e8cacbaeaa688\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Yinuo Christmas Laser Lights Outdoor Projector</a> makes decorating your house for the holidays easier than ever. You simply plant the projector in the ground using its included stake and aim it at your house. It was out of stock at the time of writing.</p><p>Plug it in, and then turn it on, that's all there is to it.&#160;More or less, anyway. You might need to move the projector closer to or farther from the walls a few times as you work to find the perfect coverage. But it's easy stuff overall.</p><p>The projector creates rotating or flashing patterns of light, which can be set to green, red, or green and red. You can opt for a pinpoint starfield or choose images including snowflakes, bells, trees, or Santas. Project one, combine them, have them rotate, or leave them static &#8212; you can achieve whatever combination you prefer. The lights cover up to 3500 square feet of surface, and the projector can be controlled by a remote that is reliable within 40 feet.</p><p>Don't worry about rain, snow, or freezing temperatures, either &#8212; this little guy is waterproof and rated to work even when the mercury hits 4 degrees below zero. Also, it's safe to use in temperatures up to 104&#186;F, in case you happen to be in warmer climes this holiday season.</p>\n\tCheck out our other great holiday decorating guides\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a0f38d7f914c359018b4b6d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"garland\" height=\"750\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Home Accents</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-christmas-decorations\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"0f2a930787f41ec18c41a5036e3fadef\">The best holiday decorations&#160;</a></h3><p>A beautifully decorated home is part of the wonder of the holiday season. We've rounded up the best decorating essentials for your home to make it easier for you.</p><hr /><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-tree-skirt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"9bd63b807ff9aedf415330d0ae6e88e7\">The best tree skirts</a></h3><p>Tree skirts add a dash of color and style to your holiday decor while hiding away that unsightly tree stand and all the holiday light cords. Here are our top picks.</p><hr /><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-artificial-christmas-tree\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best artificial Christmas trees</a></h3><p>Artificial Christmas trees have come a long way. They have a more realistic and festive look during the holiday season than their predecessors. Even better, quality artificial trees are available in a variety of sizes, shapes, and styles. These are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-artificial-christmas-tree\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best artificial Christmas trees</a>.</p><hr /><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-christmas-stockings\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best Christmas stockings</a></h3><p>Whether you're young or old, there's something magical about the sight of an overflowing stocking awaiting you on Christmas morning. No matter the style you prefer, we have a wide variety of wonderful Christmas stockings.</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/plMWvwyOdSk\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Dec 2020 20:59:30 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f72138f0ab50d00184accb6?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"288097ddd4da746fbfb19d4a89021e31","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn66@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-20-586_a8faa8726246c596.webp","destWidth":1000,"destHeight":750,"sourceBytes":47836,"destBytes":47836,"author":"stevenjohn23@gmail.com (Steven John)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f72117c0ab50d00184accad?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn28@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-26-313_e06b6a70422f9fa6.webp","https://i.insider.com/5a2034fbf914c329008b708a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn27@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-22-172_215104e1cf9091d5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5a203525f914c353018b7019?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn31@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-23-009_a5caf14b147cef6b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fd2728530f2740018b0f242?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn27@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-30-029_60bcf0a3e7fdaade.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7218af0ab50d00184acce0?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn82@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-34-152_5c88585a0928ca63.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f7216a70ab50d00184accc0?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5a0f38d7f914c359018b4b6d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn36@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-26-269_6124d9375e00e32f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=plMWvwyOdSk:BtGyq3xpVuQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn4@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-24-820_12a590419de38949.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=plMWvwyOdSk:BtGyq3xpVuQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn27@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-29-077_1f76d9bfae93bb7d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=plMWvwyOdSk:BtGyq3xpVuQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn83@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-27-366_52a5d900bfeb98ad.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/plMWvwyOdSk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn39@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-23-628_a4958022e88caaed.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712074},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"'Too dangerous': Here are 6 reasons investors gave for passing on Airbnb more than a decade ago","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/too-dangerous-6-reasons-investors-gave-for-passing-on-airbnb-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd267b430f2740018b0f21a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Brian Chesky Airbnb CEO\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Mike Segar</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Investors see strong long-term potential in Airbnb, as evidenced by its eye-popping IPO spike of 115% in its Thursday trading debut.</strong></li><li><strong>The company now sports a valuation of more than $100 billion, which is bigger than the 7 largest publicly traded US hotel chains combined.</strong></li><li><strong>But not all investors saw the potential in Airbnb over a decade ago when it was looking for early-stage seed money.</strong></li><li><strong>Here are 6 reasons why prominent investors passed on investing in Airbnb over a decade ago.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>Enthusiasm for <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/abnb-stock\">Airbnb</a> surged on Thursday <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/airbnb-stock-price-ipo-trading-debut-valuation-past-100-billion-2020-12-1029882956\">after it spiked as much as 143% in its IPO trading debut,</a> illustrating that investors are confident in the long-term prospects for the home sharing company.</p><p>But this wasn't always the case for Airbnb, as prominent investors who were pitched on the company more than a decade ago weren't sold on the idea of renting out one's home to strangers.</p><p><a href=\"https://medium.com/@bchesky/7-rejections-7d894cbaa084\">In a 2015 blog post,</a> Airbnb co-founder and CEO Brian Chesky outlined the reasoning behind 5 investors who turned down the opportunity to buy 10% of Airbnb for $150,000 in the summer of 2008.&#160;</p><p>That 10% stake would have been worth as much as $11.5 billion based on Airbnb's intra-day high of $165 in Thursday trades, representing a gain of 7,651,371% if the stake was held through Thursday's trading debut.</p><p>Here are five e-mail responses Chesky received from \"prominent\" investors who turned down the opportunity to invest in Airbnb in 2008.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/top-wall-street-investors-of-2020-stock-picks-2021-outlook-2020-12?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">We spoke with Wall Street's 9 best-performing fund managers of 2020 to learn how they crushed the chaotic market - and compile the biggest bets they're making for 2021</a></em></p><p>1. \"Thank you for the introduction. Brian good to meet you -- while this sounds interesting it is not something we would do here -- not in our area of focus, do wish you best of luck.\"</p><p>2. \"Hi Brian, Apologies for the delayed response. We've had a chance to discuss internally, and unfortunately don't think that it's the right opportunity for [identification omitted] from an investment perspective. The potential market opportunity did not seem large enough for our required model.\"</p><p>3. \"Brian: I ran this by my partner. First, it's not in one of our prime 5 target markets so it's a long shot for our involvement. Also, since it's not an area where we are currently investing, getting us involved doesn't give you the expertise that would be best for your company. My recommendation is to keep us posted. If you get to the point of a Series A investment please let us know and we'll take a look.\"</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cathie-wood-market-outlook-tesla-salesforce-slack-merger-bitcoin-webinar-2020-12?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Cathie Wood is beating 99% of fund managers this year. The ARK CEO and her team share their outlooks for 2021 - including thoughts on Tesla's $5 billion stock sale, the Salesforce-Slack tie-up, and bitcoin's meteoric rise.</a></em></p><p>4. \"Brian: Thanks for the follow up. I was unavailable to get on the call today as I'll be out of town through end of day Thursday. I really like the progress you guys have made, but between issues outstanding with ABB and my current time commitments to other projects, specifically existing investments, I'm not going to be able to proceed with an investment at this point. My biggest remaining concerns are: significant ramp up in traction post the DNC and RNC, technical staffing, investment syndicate.\"</p><p>5. \"Brian: We've decided yesterday to not take this to the next level. We've always struggled with travel as a category. We recognize its one of the top e-commerce categories but for some reason, we've not been able to get excited about travel related businesses.\"</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-advice-economic-recovery-priced-in-cyclical-stocks-mike-wilson-2020-12?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Morgan Stanley is warning that the stock market's economic recovery trade may soon be over. Here are 4 strategies they recommend for finding the returns that still exist.</a></em></p><p>Former Shark Tank host and early-stage investor Chris Sacca also chimed in on why he (regretfully) didn't invest in a seed round of Airbnb.</p><p>In response to Chesky's 2015 blog post, Sacca <a href=\"https://twitter.com/sacca/status/620338837051473920\">tweeted</a>: \"I passed on @Airbnb because renting a room in a house while owners were still home was \"too dangerous\".\"</p><p>On Thursday, Sacca congratulated Airbnb's founders <a href=\"https://twitter.com/sacca/status/1337074303867604992\">via tweet</a> and said: \"I feel extreme FOMO because I passed on their seed deal telling them 'someone will get murdered and the blood will be on your hands.'\"</p><p><a href=\"https://twitter.com/sacca/status/1337074305796952065\">Sacca added,</a> \"I let the worse case keep me from seeing the likely case. Every platform will have some bad actors, but most humans are good people. They knew that. I didn't listen. I've admired the company for a long time and I'm looking forward to finally being a shareholder.\"</p><p>But hindsight is always 20/20, as there was no telling over a decade ago that Airbnb would be the major success it is today.&#160;</p><p>\"The investors that rejected us were smart people, and I am sure we didn't look very impressive at the time,\" Chesky said.</p><div +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5faafaf11df1d5001821a050?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"e96082b4a954bd9e375a1e268e428769","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn54@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-20-715_1d154ff9f808b06f.webp","destWidth":2664,"destHeight":1998,"sourceBytes":78014,"destBytes":78014,"author":"mfox@businessinsider.com (Matthew Fox)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd267b430f2740018b0f21a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn59@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-33-885_c4984107a38baa53.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=kindyIh5pSo:yaK2dbYfSl4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn13@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-32-763_ba16e4457613cd1d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=kindyIh5pSo:yaK2dbYfSl4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn42@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-29-327_8b96725ae4e007ea.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=kindyIh5pSo:yaK2dbYfSl4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn72@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-33-424_21598c5d65449b60.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/kindyIh5pSo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-31-879_5b33ad2681c5afd7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712068},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"Airbnb is worth more than the 3 largest hotel chains combined after its stock popped 143% on its first day of trading","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-ipo-valuation-tops-three-hotel-chains-combined-opening-day-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd2b66a9cf1420018d2eaf6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Airbnb IPO\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Airbnb logo is displayed on the Nasdaq digital billboard in Times Square in New York on December 10, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo by Kena Betancur/AFP/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Airbnb was worth more than the three largest hotel chains globally after its trading debut on Thursday.</li>\n<li>Airbnb's share price closed at $144.71, giving it a valuation of $86.5 billion &#8212; Marriott, Hilton, and Intercontinental were worth $84.1 billion combined when the markets closed Thursday.</li>\n<li>After a long awaited and uncertain road to its IPO, Airbnb's stock on Thursday traded as high as <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/airbnb-stock-price-ipo-trading-debut-valuation-past-100-billion-2020-12?r=ts-sub\">143% of its initial asking price</a> of $68 per share.</li>\n<li>But some strategists warned the massive debut rallies of Airbnb and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/doordash-stock-price-ipo-public-trading-debut-nyse-dash-offering-2020-12?r=ts-sub\">DoorDash</a> this week suggest the IPO market is approaching <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/airbnb-doordash-ipo-rallies-market-euphoria-greed-strategists-abnb-dash-2020-12?r=ts-sub\">dot-com era levels of \"euphoria and greed.\"</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Airbnb's stock soared on Thursday in its highly anticipated public market debut, closing at $144.71 per share, more than double its initial offering of $68 per share.</p><p>That price also gives the short-term rental giant an approximately $86.5 billion valuation. Or, more than the combined market capitalization of the top three hotel chains globally: Hilton Worldwide Holdings, Marriott International, and Intercontinental Hotels Group, which were together worth $84.1 billion when the markets closed Thursday.</p><p>Airbnb also surpassed its largest rival among online travel agencies, or OTAs: Booking.com closed at $86.2 billion on Thursday.</p><p>Airbnb's private valuation fluctuated dramatically this year,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-paying-10-percent-interest-debt-valuation-cut-18-billion-2020-4?r=ts-sub\">dropping from $31 billion to $18 billion</a> as the COVID-19 pandemic devastated its business, forcing the company to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-layoffs-cutting-1900-jobs-25-percent-staff-coronavirus-2020-5\">lay off 25% of its workforce</a> and raise more than $2 billion in debt and equity financing, and even calling the timing of its IPO into question.</p><p>But after announcing a surprise $219.3 million Q3 profit when it <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-files-s1-public-ipo-paperwork-revenue-losses-covid-19-2020-11?r=ts-sub\">publicly revealed its IPO filing</a> earlier this month and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/airbnb-ipo-stock-offering-price-filing-abnb-trading-debut-nasdaq-2020-12?r=ts-sub\">initially hoping to raise $3.5 billion</a>, Airbnb's stock traded as high as $165, roughly 143% of its initial asking price of $68.</p><p><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-ipo-filing-covid-uncertainty-google-regulation-tax-losses-2020-11?r=ts-sub\"><em>Airbnb has navigated the pandemic better than its rivals - but the company's uncertain future depends heavily on forces beyond its control</em></a><strong><br></strong></p><p>Airbnb's successful opening day comes amid a broader tech IPO frenzy this year despite massive economic fallout from the pandemic. On Wednesday, DoorDash&#160;and&#160;C3.ai posted <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/doordash-stock-price-ipo-public-trading-debut-nyse-dash-offering-2020-12?r=ts-sub\">substantial gains of 78%</a> and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/c3ai-stock-price-public-trading-debut-ipo-siebel-software-ai-2020-12?r=ts-sub\">174%</a>, respectively. And in September, Snowflake completed the largest software-technology IPO in history with a 258% surge and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/snowflake-stock-price-more-valuable-ibm-after-post-ipo-rally-2020-12?r=ts-sub\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">has been on a tear since its debut</a>.</p><p>But top strategists said the massive debut rallies of Airbnb and DoorDash revealed an unsustainable optimism in the markets.</p><p>Paul Schatz, president and chief investment officer of Heritage Capital, told <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/airbnb-doordash-ipo-rallies-market-euphoria-greed-strategists-abnb-dash-2020-12?r=ts-sub\">Business Insider's Ben Winck</a>&#160;the rallies showed \"euphoria and greed\" that's likely not been seen in the stock market since the dot-com bubble of the late 1990s.</p><p>\"It's silly season,\" Rich Steinberg, chief market strategist at The Colony Group, told Winck. \"Investors need to distinguish the difference between a great company and a great price or value.\"</p><p>Still, Airbnb's IPO was a huge boon for its three cofounders, who are now <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investors-employees-benefit-when-airbnb-goes-public-2020-11?r=ts-sub\">worth $10 billion to $11 billion each</a>, as well <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-ipo-filing-what-executives-make-ceo-salary-compensation-2020-11?r=ts-sub\">early employees, executives</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investors-employees-benefit-when-airbnb-goes-public-2020-11#sequoia-capital-investor-119-billion-1?r=ts-sub\">investors</a>.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-ipo-valuation-tops-three-hotel-chains-combined-opening-day-2020-12'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 2020 01:03:55 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fd2b66a9cf1420018d2eaf6?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"3c48c555919b8990c4456eace8143b27","destWidth":2222,"destHeight":1666,"sourceBytes":347058,"destBytes":347058,"author":"tsonnemaker@businessinsider.com (Tyler Sonnemaker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd2b66a9cf1420018d2eaf6?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=oGNl4rOyFKg:gPp_XKFbZ14:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn39@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-33-728_43e6c388004d54b2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=oGNl4rOyFKg:gPp_XKFbZ14:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn28@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-24-335_f38d7f30be556e7b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=oGNl4rOyFKg:gPp_XKFbZ14:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn82@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-25-972_8b3c416915eb37d6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/oGNl4rOyFKg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn39@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-26-375_96052009d319fa16.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712047},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"Jeff Bezos just issued a rare compliment to his chief space rival, Elon Musk. It's the latest development in a 15-year feud between 2 of the world's most powerful CEOs.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/jeff-bezos-elon-musk-rivalry-history-timeline-2020-7","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2317a524381776a3548de7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BI Graphics Jeff Bezos vs Elon Musk\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Elon Musk, left, and Jeff Bezos.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Samantha Lee/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Two of the world's most powerful CEOs, Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos, have been locked in a rivalry for the past 15 years.&#160;</li>\n<li>While the two mainly feud over their respective space ambitions &#8212; Musk runs SpaceX, while Bezos launched Blue Origin &#8212; they also compete for talent, and Musk has taken public issue with Bezos on several occasions.&#160;</li>\n<li>Musk called Bezos a copycat over some of Amazon's business ventures, said Amazon is a monopoly that should be broken up, and appeared to make digs about Bezos' age.</li>\n<li>For his part, Bezos has made veiled critiques of Musk's main goal, which is to send humans to Mars.&#160;</li>\n<li>Recently, their rivalry extended to their respective wealth: Musk has surpassed Mark Zuckerberg and Bill Gates to become <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/elon-musk-net-worth-bill-gates-second-richest-tesla-2020-11-1029832827\">the second-richest person in the world</a>, second only to Bezos.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Over the last 15 years, two of the world's most high-profile CEOs, Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos, have been engaged in a simmering rivalry.&#160;</p><p>The two execs have sparred over their respective space ambitions - Musk runs SpaceX, while Bezos owns Blue Origin - but it hasn't stopped there: Musk has called out Bezos for running what he deemed a monopoly, and has called Bezos a copycat for his self-driving car interests.&#160;</p><p>Musk and Bezos are two of the most powerful CEOs in the world. Bezos is currently the wealthiest living person and runs Amazon's sprawling empire while also involving himself in Blue Origin's quest to send people to the moon. Musk is a dual CEO, manning the ship at both Tesla and SpaceX. Over the years, their not-so-subtle rivalry has even given way to Twitter spats and name-calling.&#160;</p><p>Recently, their rivalry heated up in a new way: Musk's wealth has <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/elon-musk-net-worth-bill-gates-second-richest-tesla-2020-11-1029832827\">surged in recent weeks to $128 billion</a>, meaning he's the one of the richest people in the world - second only to Bezos. Bezos seems unbothered, however. After SpaceX conducted a test of its prototype Starship spacecraft this month, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jeff-bezos-compliments-elon-musk-spacex-starship-rocket-launch-explosion-2020-12\">Bezos complimented SpaceX</a> in an Instagram post.&#160;</p><p>Here's how Musk's and Bezos' rivalry began and everything that's happened since.&#160;</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tBack in the early 2000s, Jeff Bezos wasn't yet the titan he is today.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c8a7aaa401d5834333970ef?format=jpeg\" alt=\"jeff bezos young 2000\" height=\"1992\" width=\"1310\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Stevan Morgain</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Bezos had launched Amazon five years prior, and the company had gone public in 1997. But Amazon wasn't yet the powerhouse it would become &#8212; it was years before the company would launch Prime, start its own streaming service, or create its cloud infrastructure service, Amazon Web Services.</p><p>But Bezos had always been interested in space. He told the Miami Herald in 1982, after he graduated high school as valedictorian, that <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/economy/for-bezos-the-post-represents-new-frontier/2013/08/10/ba7cfeb6-013c-11e3-9a3e-916de805f65d_story.html\">he wanted to create outer space colonies</a> for millions of people.</p><p>As a result of that long-held interest in leaving Earth, Bezos launched Blue Origin in 2000, a new startup focused on human spaceflight.&#160;</p>\n\tElon Musk was already a millionaire several times over, but he hadn't become CEO of Tesla yet.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2459e4988ee35ced106061?format=jpeg\" alt=\"peter thiel elon musk early paypal\" height=\"1254\" width=\"1672\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Peter Thiel, left, and Elon Musk, right, pose for a 1999 story about their company, PayPal.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Around the time Bezos was launching Blue Origin, Musk had already sold Zip2, a startup he launched with his brother, Kimbal, to Compaq for <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB919181288287063500\">roughly $300 million</a>. Musk was in the process of building PayPal, while would later be sold to eBay for $1.5 billion.&#160;</p><p>Musk <a href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2020/05/26/spacex-how-elon-musk-took-idea-cusp-history/5257977002/\">made about $160 million</a> off the PayPal sale and used that money to launch SpaceX in 2002.&#160;</p><p>\"In the beginning, I actually wouldn't even let my friends invest because everyone would lose their money,\" Musk <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kzlUyrccbos\">said during an interview at South by Southwest in 2018</a>. \"I thought I'd rather lose my own money.\"</p>\n\tThe Musk-Bezos rivalry appears to date back to 2004 when the two CEOs met for dinner.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f241971aee6a8263c7e33d6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"jeff bezos 2000\" height=\"2038\" width=\"2718\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Toshiyuki Aizawa/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>By 2004, both Blue Origin and SpaceX were still in their infancy &#8212; neither company had completed any launches yet.</p><p>But that didn't stop a rivalry from heating up: when the two met to discuss their respective reusable rocket ambitions it apparently did not go well.&#160;</p><p>\"I actually did my best to give good advice, which he largely ignored,\"&#160;Musk said after the meeting, according to Christian Davenport's book, <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Space-Barons-Bezos-Colonize-Cosmos/dp/1610398297?tag=bisafetynet2-20\">\"The Space Barons.\"</a></p>\n\tFrom 2004 onward, Musk and Bezos appeared to keep to themselves. But their rivalry continued in 2013 when things became contentious over leasing a NASA launchpad.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f241f1958c24d2240231b2a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"elon musk ignition conference 2013\" height=\"1215\" width=\"1620\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Michael Seto</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>In 2013, SpaceX tried to get exclusive use of a NASA launchpad. Blue Origin (along with SpaceX rival United Launch Alliance) filed a formal protest with the government to prevent SpaceX from using the pad &#8212; <a href=\"https://spacenews.com/37389musk-calls-out-blue-origin-ula-for-phony-blocking-tactic-on-shuttle-pad/\">Bezos proposed</a> converting it \"into a commercial spaceport available to all launch companies.\"</p><p>Musk called the move a \"phony blocking tactic\" and took another swipe at Blue Origin.</p><p>\"[Blue Origin] has not yet succeeded in creating a reliable suborbital spacecraft, despite spending over 10 years in development,\" Musk <a href=\"https://spacenews.com/37389musk-calls-out-blue-origin-ula-for-phony-blocking-tactic-on-shuttle-pad/\">told Space News</a> at the time. \"If they do somehow show up in the next five years with a vehicle qualified to NASA's human rating standards that can dock with the Space Station, which is what Pad 39A is meant to do, we will gladly accommodate their needs.\"</p><p>\"Frankly, I think we are more likely to discover unicorns dancing in the flame duct,\" he added.</p><p>SpaceX eventually&#160;<a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/sciencemain/spacex-wins-nasas-nod-take-over-historic-launch-pad-39a-2D11741834\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\">won the right to take over the pad</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tIn 2014, the two companies got into a patent battle when Blue Origin was granted a patent for drone ships, which are used for landing rocket boosters. SpaceX petitioned to invalidate the patent.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2425794dca6829cc13ad93?format=jpeg\" alt=\"SpaceX drone ship\" height=\"1993\" width=\"2657\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Space X&#39;s Falcon 9 aboard its landing platform ship.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BRUCE WEAVER/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Blue Origin's ownership of the patent would mean SpaceX would need to pay to use the technology. <a href=\"https://www.geekwire.com/2014/elon-musks-spacex-challenges-patent/\">SpaceX argued</a> that the science in the patent was \"old hat,\" given that the concept of drone ships has been around for decades.</p><p>A judge sided with SpaceX, leading to Blue Origin <a href=\"https://www.geekwire.com/2015/blue-origins-rocket-landing-patent-canceled-in-victory-for-spacex/\">withdrawing most of the claims in the patent.</a></p>\n\tIn recent years, Musk and Bezos have been more public about their feud, taking their rivalry to Twitter.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2428264e52b71bc93db611?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jeff Bezos Blue Origin\" height=\"2000\" width=\"2667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Isaiah J. Downing/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Both execs have seized on opportunities to take shots at the other, most often sniping at each other over reusable rockets. After Blue Origin successfully landed its New Shepard rocket in 2015, Bezos tweeted a video calling it \"the rarest of beasts &#8212; a used rocket.\"&#160;</p><p>Musk responded, saying SpaceX had performed the feat three years prior.&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Elon Musk  (@elonmusk) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/669194136248041472?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 24, 2015</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>When SpaceX landed its Falcon 9 spacecraft, Bezos took the opportunity to needle Musk on Twitter.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Jeff Bezos  (@JeffBezos) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/679116636310360067?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">December 22, 2015</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p>\n\tThe feud isn't just about space ambitions, however. Musk has taken issue with Blue Origin's hiring practices and has taunted Bezos in interviews.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f242a115fa9a420f3487922?format=jpeg\" alt=\"elon musk spacex\" height=\"1467\" width=\"1956\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">John Raoux / AP Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Musk told his biographer, Ashlee Vance, that Blue Origin has repeatedly tried to snag talent away from SpaceX.</p><p>\"Blue Origin does these surgical strikes on specialized talent offering like double their salaries,\" Musk said in Vance's 2015 biography. \"I think it's unnecessary and a bit rude.\"</p><p>Musk also revealed that SpaceX set up an email filter for the words \"blue\" and \"origin,\" according to <a href=\"https://spacenews.com/bezos-congratulates-spacex-for-landing-falcon-9s-suborbital-booster-stage/\">Space News</a>.</p><p>When the <a href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-35285321\">BBC</a>&#160;asked Musk about Bezos in 2016, he responded, \"Jeff who?\"</p>\n\tMusk is known for being outspoken on Twitter, an that has included jabs at Bezos.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f242eadf0f4192bfe271128?format=jpeg\" alt=\"elon musk\" height=\"2000\" width=\"2667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Elon Musk.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Steve Nesius</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Musk has repeatedly and publicly called Bezos a \"copycat\" &#8212; once after Amazon announced its <a href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1115764921482919937\">plan to launch internet-beaming satellites</a>, and again when <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-jeff-bezos-copy-cat-amazon-acquired-zoox-2020-6\">Amazon acquired self-driving-taxi company Zoox</a>.</p><p>Musk poked at Bezos in 2019 after the unveiling of Blue Origin's concept for a lunar-landing vehicle, called Blue Moon.</p><p>\"Putting the word 'Blue' on a ball is questionable branding,\" he tweeted.</p><p>Musk later <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jeff-bezos-and-elon-musk-mocking-each-others-mars-and-moon-plans-2019-5\">mocked up a screenshot</a>&#160;of a New York Times article that changed the name from \"Blue Moon\" to \"Blue Balls.\"&#160;</p><p>\"Oh stop teasing, Jeff 😉,\" <a href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1126686813840535552\">Musk wrote</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tFor his part, Bezos has been less overt about his distaste for Musk and SpaceX, but he's made veiled comments about his thoughts on the company's plans.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f2434b5988ee355d06d3b1c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"jeff bezos blue origin blue moon\" height=\"3712\" width=\"4949\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Clodagh Kilcoyne</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>While Bezos has stopped short of calling out Musk directly, he has taken aim at Musk's biggest ambition: colonizing Mars, the main goal of SpaceX.&#160;</p><p>Bezos' focus is on getting humans to the moon, and he's described the idea of reaching Mars as \"un-motivating.\"</p><p>\"Go live on the top of Mount Everest for a year first and see if you like it, because it's a garden paradise compared to Mars,\" Bezos <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jeff-bezos-mount-everest-challenge-mars-spacex-elon-musk-2019-3\">said in 2019</a>.</p><p>During his presentation for Blue Moon, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jeff-bezos-and-elon-musk-mocking-each-others-mars-and-moon-plans-2019-5\">Bezos referenced SpaceX's Mars ambitions</a> once again, titling a slide about Mars \"FAR, FAR AWAY.\"</p>\n\tIn July, Musk appeared to make yet another dig at Bezos - this time about his age - in an interview with the New York Times.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f08dbda988ee35a183e3db6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Elon Musk\" height=\"1866\" width=\"2488\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Hennessy/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>In a <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/25/style/elon-musk-maureen-dowd.html\">wide-ranging Times interview</a>, Musk, 49, took the opportunity to comment on Blue Origin, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-jeff-bezos-blue-origin-insult-space-feud-2020-7\">appearing to imply</a> that Jeff Bezos, 56, is too old and Blue Origin too slow to ever make real progress.&#160;&#160;</p><p>\"The rate of progress is too slow and the amount of years he has left is not enough, but I'm still glad he's doing what he's doing with Blue Origin,\" Musk said.&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tThough the pair's main point of contention appears to be space, Musk has made other pointed remarks about Amazon, recently calling the company a monopoly.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f0f50313ad8616cff6b8179?format=jpeg\" alt=\"elon musk\" height=\"1940\" width=\"2587\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla CEO Elon Musk leaves Manhattan federal court after a hearing on his fraud settlement with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in New York City, U.S. April 4, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Brendan McDermid/File Photo</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>After Amazon's publishing service refused to publish a book about the coronavirus by writer Alex Berenson, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-calls-for-breaking-up-amazon-over-coronavirus-book-2020-6\">Musk tweeted at Bezos</a> that the situation was \"insane\" and called for Amazon to be broken up.&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Elon Musk  (@elonmusk) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1268603809409888256?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">June 4, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Musk's comments were in response to Amazon's Kindle Direct Publishing service refusing to publish Berenson's book titled \"Unreported Truths about COVID-19 and Lockdowns.\" Berenson <a href=\"https://twitter.com/AlexBerenson/status/1268529570480824320?s=20\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\">tweeted a screenshot</a>&#160;of an email he says he received from Amazon and said the company \"censored\" his book. The screenshot appeared to show the publishing division saying the book does not comply with its guidelines.</p><p>Amazon later told Business Insider the book was removed in error and would be reinstated.&#160;&#160;</p>\n\tBut both Bezos and Musk have continued to make progress - and grow their wealth - even as their rivalry continues on.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ef633385af6cc7fb046a396?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jeff Bezos Elon Musk\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jeff Bezos (left) and Elon Musk.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Joshua Roberts</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>In May, SpaceX experienced a historic first: the company <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/spacex-launches-historic-rocket-mission-nasa-astronauts-demo-2-2020-5\">successfully launched two NASA astronauts into space</a>.&#160;</p><p>\"This is a dream come true for me and everyone else at SpaceX,\" Musk said at the time. \"I didn't even dream that this would come true.\"</p><p>Earlier this month, the company <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/astronauts-attach-spacex-crew-dragon-spaceship-international-space-station-2020-11\">partnered with NASA again</a> to send four astronauts to the International Space Station, SpaceX's first \"operational\" human spaceflight.</p><p>Meanwhile, Musk's other venture, Tesla, has hit all-time highs in the stock market in recent weeks. Musk is now the world's second-wealthiest person at $128 billion as Tesla's market value <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/elon-musk-net-worth-bill-gates-second-richest-tesla-2020-11-1029832827\">edges closer to $500 billion</a>.&#160;</p><p>Bezos remains the richest person in the world with <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/profiles/jeffrey-p-bezos/?sref=BWbpWjRm\">a net worth of $182 billion</a>.&#160;</p><p>While Bezos is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-antitrust-hearing-recap-bezos-cook-zuckerberg-pichai-testimony-2020-7\">facing government scrutiny</a> over Amazon's potentially anticompetitive behavior, the company continues to thrive: During it's most recent earnings, Amazon <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-earnings-q3-2020-revenue-eps-profit-analysis-2020-10\">blew past Wall Street's expectations for revenue and profit</a> due to the continued surge in online shopping during the pandemic.&#160;</p><p>Regardless of where Bezos' and Musk's rivalry stands, the two moguls won't stop being competitors anytime soon: these days, their companies are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-spacex-blue-origin-design-lunar-landers-2020-5\">both submitting designs for lunar landers</a>&#160;to NASA for a mission to return humans to the moon by 2024.</p>\n\tIt's possible Bezos has softened his stance on SpaceX, however: After the rocket company conducted a test of its Starship spacecraft this month, Bezos publicly complimented the company for its ambitious attempt.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd10f7d48a2590018262757?format=jpeg\" alt=\"elon musk spacex starship sn8 serial number 8 steel rocket ship prototype boca chica south texas sunset sunrise getty 4x3\" height=\"1499\" width=\"1998\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>SpaceX, founded by Elon Musk, is building and launching Starship prototypes in Boca Chica, Texas.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.flickr.com/photos/spacex/48954138902/\" target=\"_blank\">SpaceX; Mark Brake/Getty Images; Business Insider</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>SpaceX launched the rocket thousands of feet in the air during during a 7-minute test flight, but <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/spacex-starship-sn8-rocket-41000-foot-launch-boca-chica-texas-2020-12\">the rocket exploded during landing.</a></p><p>Still, the audacious test garnered praise from Musk's space rival, Bezos.&#160;</p><p>\"Anybody who knows how hard this stuff is is impressed by today's Starship test,\" Bezos wrote in an Instagram post, accompanied by a low-resolution photo of the rocket. \"Big congrats to the whole @SpaceX team. I'm confident they'll be back at it soon.\"</p><blockquote class=\"instagram-media\"   style=\"background:#FFF; border:0; border-radius:3px; box-shadow:0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width:540; padding:0; width:99.375%; width:-webkit-calc(100% - 2px); width:calc(100% - 2px); data.width~540;\">\n\t<div style=\"padding:8px;\">\n\t\t<div style=\"background:#F8F8F8; line-height:0; margin-top:40px; padding:62.4537037037% 0; text-align:center; width:100%;\">\n\t\t\t<div style=\"background:url(data:image/png;base64,); display:block; height:44px; margin:0 auto -44px; position:relative; top:-22px; width:44px;\"></div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<p style=\"margin:8px 0 0 0; padding:0 4px;\">\n\t\t\t<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CImF2runz0j\" style=\" color:#000; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px; text-decoration:none; word-wrap:break-word;\" target=\"_blank\"></a></p> <p style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;\">A post shared by Jeff Bezos (@jeffbezos)<time style=\" font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px;\" datetime=\"\"></time>\n\t\t</p></div></blockquote><script async defer src=\"//platform.instagram.com/en_US/embeds.js\"></script><p>&#160;</p>\n</div><div -35-22-909_96d52774b0338f8c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fd10f7d48a2590018262757?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn93@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-23-947_fcff9c56d41c4bec.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=yuq_oYjOK8Y:1BlYtUoIynA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn92@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-28-913_97ff36b0163e1faf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=yuq_oYjOK8Y:1BlYtUoIynA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn89@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-25-975_33f47bf78d99539a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=yuq_oYjOK8Y:1BlYtUoIynA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/yuq_oYjOK8Y":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn68@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-23-092_bc13a26ded631747.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712062},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"George Conway writes op-ed calling Trump's effort to overturn the election the true 'big fraud' of 2020","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/conway-calls-trump-effort-to-overturn-election-true-big-fraud-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd296d37b7e0500191074ce?format=jpeg\" alt=\"George Conway\" height=\"1102\" width=\"2204\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Conservative attorney George Conway in a new op-ed ripped into President Donald Trump and his Republican allies over their efforts to invalidate millions of votes and overturn the election.</li>\n<li>\"History will record that the scam didn't succeed,\" Conway wrote, describing the latest suit out of Texas as&#160;an \"embarrassment to the legal profession.\"</li>\n<li>Trump and his GOP allies have won zero out of the at least <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-lawsuits-election-results-2020-11\">38 election-related lawsuits</a> they've filed.</li>\n<li>The president has repeatedly pushed the baseless assertion that President-elect Joe Biden won due to mass voter fraud.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>George Conway in a new <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/george-conway-trump-texas-steal-election/2020/12/10/be38b1dc-3b0c-11eb-98c4-25dc9f4987e8_story.html\">Washington Post op-ed</a> excoriated efforts by President Donald Trump and his Republican allies to overturn the 2020 election.&#160;</p><p>Conway, a conservative lawyer and husband to White House counselor Kellyanne Conway, described the overwhelmingly failed legal battle to challenge the election results as \"the biggest farce of all.\"</p><p>\"The big fraud of 2020 didn't take place in any voting booth, drop box or tabulation center. It happened after the election, at the presidential lectern, at news conferences and in legal briefs orchestrated to support the fiction that Donald Trump won,\" Conway wrote, adding, \"History will record that the scam didn't succeed.\"</p><p>Trump has baselessly claimed the election was \"rigged\" against him and that President-elect Joe Biden won due to mass voter fraud. No evidence has emerged to support Trump's assertions.</p><p>The president and his GOP allies have won zero out of the at least <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-lawsuits-election-results-2020-11\">38 election-related lawsuits</a> they've filed. The Supreme Court on Tuesday rejected an attempt by Trump allies to overturn the results in Pennsylvania.&#160;</p><p>Meanwhile, all 50 states and Washington, DC, have certified their election results and the federal \"safe harbor\" deadline to do so has passed - cementing Biden's victory. The Electoral College is set to make Biden's win final when it votes on December 14.&#160;</p><p>\"Trump and his litigation boosters have lost every which way, and everywhere. In state courts and federal courts. In trial courts and appellate courts, intermediate and supreme. Before Democratic judges and Republican ones. In <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/nevada-trump-lawsuit-dismissed/2020/12/04/844d420a-3682-11eb-a997-1f4c53d2a747_story.html?itid=lk_inline_manual_7\" title=\"www.washingtonpost.com\">Pennsylvania, Georgia, Michigan, Wisconsin, Arizona and Nevada</a> - every state that could possibly matter. On substantive grounds and procedural ones, on the facts, and on the law,\" Conway wrote.&#160;</p><p>\"It's hard to imagine that any alliance of litigants and lawyers has ever lost more cases for more reasons - and in less time - than this sorry bunch has,\" he added. \"Their problem is they have nothing to sue about, and never did.\"</p><p>But Republicans across the country continue to challenge the results in concert with Trump. Ken Paxton, Texas' pro-Trump attorney general, on Tuesday filed a longshot lawsuit in the Supreme Court seeking to overturn the election results in Pennsylvania, Georgia, Michigan, and Wisconsin. Trump and <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/09/us/politics/trump-texas-supreme-court-lawsuit.html\">17 other Republican attorneys general</a> are supporting the suit, which is essentially an effort to invalidate millions of votes.&#160;</p><p>Legal experts say the suit is likely to fail and <a href=\"https://twitter.com/steve_vladeck/status/1336329901859688451?s=20\">doubt the nation's highest court</a> will take up the case. Conway shares this view, describing the Texas suit as \"a recycling of failed claims\" and an \"embarrassment to the legal profession.\"</p><p>\"There's no reason to believe the Supreme Court, which has jurisdiction to hear cases between states, will entertain this one,\" Conway said. \"For public officials such as Paxton and his fellow Republican attorneys general to call for the wholesale disenfranchisement of the people of four states is an affront to the rule of law, an insult to an independent judiciary and a contempt of democracy.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"Chinese government claims it was 'hacked' after it shared Trump's baseless claim on social media","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/china-claims-hacked-share-trump-tweet-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6c014ac4049200115cb4da?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump Xi\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump attends a bilateral meeting with China&#39;s President Xi Jinping during the G20 leaders summit in Osaka, Japan, June 29, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kevin Lamarque/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The Twitter account belonging to the Chinese government claimed it was \"hacked\" after it retweeted one of President Donald Trump's tweets.</li>\n<li>Trump's tweet raised doubts about the recent presidential race and accused a political party of fraudulently coming to power.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Chinese officials in the US claimed their social media account was hacked after a government Twitter account retweeted one of President Donald Trump's unsubstantiated claims about the results of the 2020 election.</p><p>\"The Chinese Embassy twitter account was hacked this afternoon and we condemn such an act,\" the Washington, D.C.-based account <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ChineseEmbinUS/status/1336888614052048897?s=20\">said</a>. \"For clarification, the Embassy didn't do any retweeting on Dec.9.\"</p><p>The tweet the embassy shared was one in which Trump raised doubts about the presidential race he lost and accused a political party of fraudulently coming to power.</p><p>\"If somebody cheated in the Election, which the Democrats did, why wouldn't the Election be immediately overturned,\" Trump tweeted. \"How can a Country be run like this?\"</p><p>The embassy's Twitter account frequently posts stories from state-affiliated news networks, some of which disregard the mounting evidence that human-rights violations have taken place in <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/human-rights-groups-battle-against-firms-on-xinjiang-forced-labor-2020-12\">Xinjiang</a>. The account has also been labeled by Twitter as one that is operated by the Chinese government, a communist state with an unelected leader. Twitter mentions in a disclaimer that \"China blocks access to Twitter for regular users.\"</p><p>\"We believe that people benefit from additional context when interacting with Chinese government and state-affiliated accounts,\" Twitter says in its <a href=\"https://help.twitter.com/en/rules-and-policies/state-affiliated-china\">disclaimer</a>.</p><p>US-China relations have been particularly tense in recent days after Beijing announced retaliatory measures aimed at US politicians for imposing <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-china-sanctions/u-s-blacklists-chinese-crime-boss-others-in-anti-corruption-sanctions-idUSKBN28J267\">sanctions</a>. During the Trump administration, the two countries have often waged tit-for-tat diplomatic warfare, particularly in light of the continuing trade war.</p><p>Former Vice President Joe Biden won the majority of electoral votes from states that certified their results - 306 votes, compared to Trump's 232.</p><p>Republican operatives have been fighting the election result on the basis of dubious evidence. Subsequent legal challenges levied by the Trump campaign, including a request to invalidate <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-wisconsin-lawsuit-invalidate-mail-ballots-covid-19-lawyer-2020-12\">hundreds of thousands of ballots</a>, have been met with significant resistance from federal judges.</p><p>Of at least <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-lawsuits-election-results-2020-11\">38 lawsuits filed</a>, the campaign and other GOP-tied groups have yet to be victorious.</p><p>Despite President-elect Joe Biden's likely inauguration on January 20, 2021, Trump has cast aspersions against both Democrats and Republicans and has baselessly claimed the election was \"rigged.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/china-claims-hacked-share-trump-tweet-2020-12'>Business
