src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ef251844dca681175234c16?format=jpeg\" alt=\"william barr\" height=\"2240\" width=\"4480\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>US Attorney General William Barr arrives for the event where US President Donald Trump signs an executive order on police reform, in the Rose Garden of the White House in Washington, DC, on June 16, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">SAUL LOEB/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Attorney General William Barr knew about two criminal investigations into Hunter Biden's financial dealings for months before the general election but kept them from the public, The Wall Street Journal reported.</li>\n<li>The news is a remarkable twist in Barr's tenure as President Donald Trump's attorney general, during which he repeatedly took steps to benefit the president and feed into his conspiracy theories.</li>\n<li>According to The Journal, Barr knew about the Biden tax investigations since at least the spring but tried to keep them under wraps in accordance with Justice Department rules that prevent prosecutors from taking overt investigative steps that could affect the outcome of an election.</li>\n<li>Thursday's report will likely infuriate Trump, who has been frustrated with Barr in recent months and came close to firing him on several occasions before aides talked the president out of it.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Attorney General William Barr knew for months about two investigations into Hunter Biden's financial activity but worked to shield them from the public, <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/barr-worked-to-keep-hunter-biden-probes-from-public-view-during-election-11607653188\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Wall Street Journal reported</a> late Thursday.</p><p>The news is a remarkable twist in Barr's tenure as President Donald Trump's attorney general, during which time he repeatedly took steps to aid the president and feed into his talking points about the Russia investigation, the Obama administration, and the 2020 election.</p><p>Barr's reported attempts to keep the Hunter Biden probes from becoming public were in accordance with Justice Department rules that restrict prosecutors from taking public investigative steps that could affect the outcome of an election. President-elect Joe Biden won the 2020 general election, notching 306 Electoral College votes compared with Trump's 232.</p><p>Hunter Biden announced that he was being investigated on Wednesday after CNN reached out to the Biden transition team when it learned that the younger Biden was the subject of criminal inquiries into his finances.</p><p>\"I learned yesterday for the first time that the US Attorney's Office in Delaware advised my legal counsel, also yesterday, that they are investigating my tax affairs,\" Hunter Biden said in a statement on Wednesday. \"I take this matter very seriously but I am confident that a professional and objective review of these matters will demonstrate that I handled my affairs legally and appropriately, including with the benefit of professional tax advisors.\"</p><p>Subsequent media reports said the investigation was broader in scope than Hunter Biden initially indicated, with <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/09/us/politics/hunter-biden-tax-investigation.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The New York Times revealing</a> that the tax probe grew out of what started off as a money-laundering investigation in late 2018. Politico <a href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/12/09/justice-department-interest-hunter-biden-taxes-444139\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">also reported</a>, citing one source, that in addition to Delaware prosecutors, the securities fraud unit at the Manhattan US attorney's office investigated Hunter Biden's finances, and as of early 2019, prosecutors in both Delaware and Washington, DC, were examining possible foreign ties and money laundering.</p><p>The Times reported that the money laundering inquiry has since fizzled out from a lack of evidence, but that investigators with the Internal Revenue Service are continuing to scrutinize Hunter Biden's taxes.</p><p>The younger Biden has not been charged in any criminal activity related to the investigations or prior inquiries. The president-elect is also not a subject of interest in the probes focusing on his son.</p><p>Thursday's reporting from The Journal about Barr's role in keeping the Hunter Biden investigations from the public will likely infuriate the president, who has been frustrated with the attorney general in recent weeks and was on the brink of firing him several times before aides talked Trump out of it.</p><p>The Justice Department declined to comment to The Journal, and the White House did not immediately respond to a request for comment from Business Insider.</p><div 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez ripped into GOP Sen. Mike Lee after he blocked the creation of Latino and women's history museums during a dramatic Senate session","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/aoc-rips-into-sen-mike-blocking-latino-womens-history-museums-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd2da709cf1420018d2eb13?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Sen. Mike Lee\" height=\"1620\" width=\"2160\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Republican Sen. Mike Lee of Utah said Americans didn&#39;t need &#34;separate but equal&#34; museums.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tasos Katopodis/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>US Senator Mike Lee blocked two proposals that would establish new Smithsonian museums for American Latino and women's history.</li>\n<li>Both bipartisan bills passed the House of Representatives earlier this year, but the Republican senator said Americans didn't need \"separate but equal\" museums.</li>\n<li>Democrat Sen. Bob Menendez and GOP Sen. Susan Collins both pushed back at Lee during a dramatic Senate session on Thursday.</li>\n<li>US Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez ripped into Lee's remarks on Twitter, saying, \"good to know Utah Sen. Mike Lee is spending his time today giving speeches about why Latinos shouldn't have a national history museum.\"</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>US Senator Mike Lee blocked two proposals that would establish new Smithsonian museums for American Latino and women's history during a dramatic <a href=\"https://www.c-span.org/video/?507167-1/senate-session\">Senate session</a> on Thursday.</p><p>Both bipartisan bills passed the House of Representatives earlier this year, but Lee said Americans didn't need \"separate, siloed\" museums. Instead, he said the existing American History museum could be expanded to include the stories of all groups that make up US history.</p><p>\"But the last thing we need is to further divide an already divided nation with an array of separate but equal museums for hyphenated identity groups,\" the Republican senator from Utah said.</p><p>Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez ripped into Lee's remarks on Twitter.</p><p>\"No movement on COVID in the Senate but good to know Utah Sen. Mike Lee is spending his time today giving speeches about why Latinos shouldn't have a national history museum and oh, while we're at it, why there shouldn't be a women's history museum either,\" she said in a <a href=\"https://twitter.com/AOC/status/1337191512627699714?s=20\">tweet</a>.</p><p>Lee prompted a livid response from Sen. Bob Menendez, a Democrat and longtime advocate of establishing a Latino museum.</p><p>\"One Republican colleague from Utah stands in the way of the hopes and dreams and aspirations of seeing Americans of Latino descent having their dreams fulfilled in being recognized, just being recognized,\" he said during the session. \"It's pretty outrageous.\"</p><p>Smithsonian museums for African-American history and Native American history already exist, but Lee said those groups were exceptions because they were \"systematically excluded\" from the nation's history.</p><p>\"We have been systematically excluded,\" Menendez said of American Latinos. \"And the only righteous way to end that exclusion is to pass this bill.\"</p><p>GOP Sen. Susan Collins also expressed support for the American Latino museum. Collins co-sponsored the bill for the women's history museum, which was also blocked by Lee during Thursday's session.</p><p>\"It seems wrong that one senator can block consideration of a bill that would have overwhelming support by a majority of this body,\" she said in response to Lee.</p><p>\"It is extraordinary to me that not 100 years ago not every woman in this country was allowed to vote in every state,\" she said. \"That story is one of the stories that needs to be told.\"</p><p>After Lee blocked the women's history museum, Collins said, \"I regret that that will not occur this evening, but we will not give up the fight.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 2020 06:29:37 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fd2da66e00bce00188bab17?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"3e1a58a2a3c4b70cc22f4bd756890bdb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn73@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-20-559_5773ba6d9bb690f7.webp","destWidth":1507,"destHeight":1130,"sourceBytes":43360,"destBytes":43360,"author":"kvlamis@businessinsider.com (Kelsey Vlamis)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd2da709cf1420018d2eb13?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HQpsmhLaiJY:AStO-MJh1c4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn15@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-31-127_3b6d8b5a4f59878a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HQpsmhLaiJY:AStO-MJh1c4:V_sGLiPBpWU":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HQpsmhLaiJY:AStO-MJh1c4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/HQpsmhLaiJY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn89@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-20-476_2d95eb30b28bb53b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712033},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez slams Mitch McConnell for opposing $1,200 stimulus checks in Instagram live session","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/aoc-slams-mitch-mcconnell-for-opposing-stimulus-checks-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa98df11df1d50018219a33?format=jpeg\" alt=\"AOC\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-N.Y., on Monday, August 24, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tom Williams/CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty Images/Pool</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez slammed Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell over his opposition to stimulus checks on an Instagram livestream on Thursday night.&#160;</li>\n<li>Ocasio-Cortez has repeatedly called for a $1,200 direct payment to be included in the relief bill Congress is aiming to pass during the lame-duck session.</li>\n<li>The freshman congresswoman also argued that Republicans haven't been \"in a rush\" to pass additional stimulus legislation because Wall Street was already given a massive bailout last spring.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez briefed her followers on the state of Congress' COVID-19 relief bill negotiations and slammed Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell over his opposition to stimulus checks during an Instagram livestream on Thursday night.&#160;</p><p>Ocasio-Cortez has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/aoc-calls-for-1200-stimulus-checks-covid-relief-bill-2020-12\">repeatedly called for a $1,200 direct payment</a> to be included in the relief bill Congress is aiming to pass during the lame-duck session. She pointed out that some Republicans, including Sen. Josh Hawley, also support stimulus checks, but argued that Sen. McConnell is leading the resistance.&#160;</p><p>\"This is a matter of Mitch McConnell not wanting a check,\" she told nearly the nearly 40,000 people who tuned in to watch her \"Cooking and Q&#38;A\" session.</p><p>Congress is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-relief-talks-perilous-moment-trump-mcconnell-pelosi-2020-12\">currently negotiating</a> a bipartisan $908 billion proposal - a far less aggressive package than the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/house-democrats-stimulus-plan-congress-unemployment-economy-pass-vote-bill-2020-9\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"f4442d4ffa580050ae866c585641882c\">$2.2 trillion</a> bill Democrats passed in October. But many Republicans are still demanding a slimmer aid package that focuses on small businesses and vaccine distribution and includes a liability shield to protect corporations from virus-related lawsuits. GOP lawmakers are also largely opposed to sending additional funding to strapped state and local governments.&#160;</p><p>Ocasio-Cortez called the liability shield proposal a \"corporate bailout.\" She argued that allowing Republicans to include the liability protections in the bill in exchange for stimulus checks or state and local government funding would be a bad deal for workers.&#160;</p><p>\"You may get a $1,200 check on one hand, but you may also get a multi-million hospital bill with no recourse and no ability to protect yourself from a negligent corporation or employer,\" she said. \"Why do we need to exchange people's well being and ability to survive for yet another corporate bailout?\"</p><p>Other progressive lawmakers, including Sen. Bernie Sanders' have also demanded stimulus checks in the bill and decried the liability shield.</p><p>The freshman congresswoman also argued that Republicans haven't been \"in a rush\" to pass additional stimulus legislation because Wall Street was already <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/business/coronavirus-bailout-spending/\">given a massive bailout</a> last spring. About <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/business/coronavirus-bailout-spending/\">one-fifth</a> of the $4 trillion in stimulus that the federal government has spent since the pandemic hit has gone to workers and families. About $2.3 trillion went to businesses, many of which didn't have to show that they were hurt by the pandemic or they would use the money to prevent layoffs.</p><p>Democrats in the House passed the $2.2 trillion HEROES Act in May and then again in October. Ahead of the November election, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin failed to negotiate a slightly smaller stimulus backed by the White House, while in October the Senate proposed a slimmed-down $500 stimulus package that was blocked by Democrats.</p><p>\"What keeps me up at night was that it was short-term relief that was really important and really necessary ... but what we gave away to Wall Street was so large and so structural that, frankly, that's why Republicans and Mitch McConnell has not been in a rush,\" she said.&#160;</p><p>President-elect Joe Biden has promised to pass an additional stimulus when he takes office in late January, but Americans are in desperate need of help before then. If Congress fails to pass a new relief bill in the next nine days, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/millions-could-lose-unemployment-aid-by-december-without-coronavirus-stimulus-2020-11\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"309e819ac3983ce1582158879be03e73\">almost 12 million Americans</a> could lose their unemployment benefits in late December, millions could be evicted from their homes, and millions more will again be on the hook for student loan payments after January 31.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article Relman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fa98df11df1d50018219a33?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn8@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-29-700_f358e9e1e0291650.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=xS2jAdCmwyM:6rcPNtJWu98:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn63@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-36-285_53f32e468972fe74.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=xS2jAdCmwyM:6rcPNtJWu98:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn43@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-23-646_4ad3b4ab7b440b20.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=xS2jAdCmwyM:6rcPNtJWu98:gIN9vFwOqvQ":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/xS2jAdCmwyM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn96@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-29-514_d7fa3d8e300ace00.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712034},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"The best space heaters in 2020","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-space-heater","description":"<bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>If you have a home that heats unevenly, a space heater can keep you comfortable without wasting energy.</strong></li><li><strong style=\"color: #222222;\">After testing eight space heaters, the </strong><a href=\"https://goto.walmart.com/c/196318/565706/9383?veh=aff&sourceid=imp_000011112222333344&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FLasko-Electric-Ceramic-Heater-1500W-Silver-754200%2F1650322516503225\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Lasko Ceramic Portable Space Heater</strong></a><strong style=\"color: #222222;\"> is our top pick thanks to its affordable price tag and ability to churn out heat quickly. </strong></li><li><strong style=\"color: #222222;\">It's also compact, lightweight, and perfect for heating up a small home office.</strong></li></ul><p>Temperature is <a href=\"https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/cold-or-warm-can-we-really-tell/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">incredibly subjective</a>: I see this in my own home, where I am perpetually hot and my husband is <em>always </em>cold. It's an objective fact, however, that my furnace does a bad job of heating certain recesses of my house. The basement feels like the inside of a half-open igloo and the kitchen, with its large window, heats up like a greenhouse. It makes controlling the thermostat difficult.&#160;</p><p>Space heaters can help warm the chillier bits of your home, reduce friction if you're constantly fighting over the thermostat with your housemates, and (building codes permitting) offer you some control over the temperature of your surroundings in places like offices or dorms where the heat is not adjustable. They're also a good solution in between seasons where it's not quite cold enough to turn on whole-house heat, and an obvious choice for garages, RVs, boats, and other places that may not have access to gas-powered heat.&#160;</p><p>In addition to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mr-heater-buddy-heater-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">testing portable outdoor heaters</a> and writing <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-patio-heater\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">our guide to the best patio heaters</a>, I've been testing and reviewing products for nearly half a decade, covering everything from fitness gadgets to kitchen appliances. For almost two months, I put eight space heaters through various tests to see how they would affect the ambient temperature in my home office. I evaluated their performance, ease of use, settings, noise level, and safety features. I also interviewed Matthew Griffith, fire prevention section chief with the <a href=\"https://ville.montreal.qc.ca/sim/en\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Montreal Fire Department</a>, and Dan Mock, brand manager of <a href=\"https://www.mistersparky.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mr. Sparky</a>, an electrical services company, about space heater safety. At the end of the guide, you can find a breakdown of my <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-space-heater#methodology-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">testing methodology</a>, along with information about <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-space-heater#what-to-look-for-in-a-space-heater-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">what to look for in a space heater</a> and tips on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-space-heater#space-heater-safety-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">space heater safety</a>.&#160;</p><h2>The best space heaters</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best overall: </strong><a href=\"https://goto.walmart.com/c/196318/565706/9383?veh=aff&sourceid=imp_000011112222333344&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FLasko-Electric-Ceramic-Heater-1500W-Silver-754200%2F1650322516503225\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Lasko Ceramic Portable Space Heater</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best full-size: </strong><a href=\"https://goto.walmart.com/c/196318/565706/9383?veh=aff&sourceid=imp_000011112222333344&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FLasko-1500W-Cyclonic-Ceramic-Room-Space-Heater-CC24920-Black%2F37695416976954169\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Lasko Cyclonic Digital Ceramic Heater</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best high-end: </strong><a href=\"https://shop-links.co/1725511746138880990\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Dyson Pure Hot+Cool</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best that's also a fan: </strong><a href=\"https://goto.walmart.com/c/196318/565706/9383?veh=aff&sourceid=imp_000011112222333344&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FHoneywell-VersaHeat-Digital-Two-Position-Heater-HHF260-White%2F21544199415441994\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>HoneyWell Versa Two Position Heater</strong></a></li></ul><p><em>Prices and links are accurate as of 12/10/20; we rewrote this guide with new recommendations after comprehensive testing, and added guidance on shopping for and using a space heater. </em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best space heater overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd253c37b7e050019107318?format=jpeg\" alt=\"lasko space heater overall slide\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steph Coelho/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://goto.walmart.com/c/196318/565706/9383?veh=aff&#38;sourceid=imp_000011112222333344&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FLasko-Electric-Ceramic-Heater-1500W-Silver-754200%2F16503225\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Lasko Ceramic Portable Space Heater</a> is a practical, no-frills miniature heater with enough juice to turn your chilly home office into a cozy, warm nook of productivity.&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Compact, incredibly efficient, easy to use, housing stays cool to the touch, overheat detector&#160;</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>No tip-over safety switch, no temperature display&#160;</p><p>This unit is the first space heater I tested and the one that I keep coming back to for my own personal use. It's one of the smallest heaters on this list at just about 10 inches tall, but pulls a powerful 1,500 watts of power to heat efficiently for its miniature size. There are three settings (low, high, and fan) and an adjustable temperature dial. The temperature dial uses dots instead of specific temperatures, so it took some time to figure out how to adjust the unit to my preferred temperature &#8212; I ended up watching a <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b31HU-LYQOY&#38;feature=youtu.be\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">YouTube</a> video to get the gist &#8212; but once I got it working, the heat cycling feature kept me comfortable for hours. It's relatively quiet and I didn't feel the need to shut it off during Zoom calls.&#160;</p><p>That said, it's definitely not a whole-room heater: the unit only increased the overall temperature in my office by about 3 degrees Fahrenheit in my testing. However, sitting close to the heater and feeling the warmth blowing directly at me, I felt much, much warmer. (It's also worth noting that how well any space heater will heat depends on the size of your room and the ambient temperature.)</p><p>The heater has cool-touch housing, which didn't heat up during use, but the front grille does get hot (though this is par for the course with most space heaters). It'll also shut off automatically if it detects overheating. The manual didn't specify at what temperature this function triggers, and I didn't encounter it during my testing, but it's a must-have safety feature for any space heater. There's no tip-over safety switch, but if you're only using it under supervision (as safety experts say you should with any space heater), I don't think it's a deal-breaker &#8212; especially since the unit is so stable. I really had to shove it off my desk for it to tip over.&#160;</p><p>I can see myself using this frequently when I'm unwilling to turn on the furnace. It's easy to store and tote around the house. I recommend this unit to anyone who works in a chilly office (home or otherwise).&#160;</p>\n\tThe best full-size space heater\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd254247b7e05001910731e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lasko full sized space heater slide\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steph Coelho/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://goto.walmart.com/c/196318/565706/9383?veh=aff&#38;sourceid=imp_000011112222333344&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FLasko-1500W-Cyclonic-Ceramic-Room-Space-Heater-CC24920-Black%2F376954169\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Lasko Cyclonic Digital Ceramic Heater</a> is a full-size space heater that takes up minimal space and delivers an effective dose of warmth.&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Lightweight, accurate internal thermostat, overheat protection</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>No fan-only option, no tip-over shutoff&#160;</p><p>When my grandfather was looking for a space heater to warm up his bedroom, which doesn't seem to heat as well as other areas of his apartment, this was the model I decided to recommend to him. At almost two feet tall, it's a full-size floor model but it is surprisingly lightweight, so it's easy to move around from room to room. The light-up control panel is legible from afar and allows you to choose your desired room temperature, select high or low heat settings, and set a timer. You can also adjust the angle of the airflow, which is helpful if you don't want hot air blowing directly on you.&#160;</p><p>By selecting the room temperature, the unit will automatically know to cycle off (and eventually back on) when it senses that it reaches the right temperature. This function was very accurate when I compared its temperature display to my reference thermometer. It's a lot quieter than I expected for such a large machine, and it does a great job of heating up a room quickly without blowing uncomfortably hot air. On a chilly morning, the heater was able to warm the air by 6 degrees Fahrenheit in under an hour.&#160;</p><p>Unfortunately, this unit doesn't have a fan-only option, and while there's a thermal overload detector to prevent overheating, there's no tip-over shutoff. Unlike other space heater models I tried, this model purports to be safe to place against a wall because of the way the air enters and exits the machine. Safety experts usually recommend keeping the backside of a space heater clear, but I did confirm that no hot air was blowing out the back of the machine and it never overheated during use.</p>\n\tThe best high-end space heater\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd25d6530f2740018b0f1d4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dyson space heater\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steph Coelho/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://shop-links.co/1725511746138880990\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Dyson Pure Hot+Cool</a> boasts an impressive design; features like air purifying, app compatibility, and some cooling capability make it an expansive home appliance that does much more than heat.&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros</strong>: Air-purifying feature, all parts stay cool to the touch, 360-degree oscillation, automatically shuts off after nine hours or if overheating is detected, beautiful design, app compatibility and controls, smart assistant compatibility, tip-over switch</p><p><strong>Cons</strong>: Display is difficult to read, replacement filters are expensive</p><p>This Dyson unit is the macdaddy of space heaters. It's a full-size heater with a unique oblong, donut-shaped design. Setup is super easy; just click in the filters and plug it in to get started. You can use the remote or an app (available on <a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/dyson-link/id993135524\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">iOS</a> or <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.dyson.mobile.android&#38;hl=en_US&#38;gl=US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Android</a>) to control and adjust the airflow speed, oscillation, temperature, airflow direction, and turn on the sleep timer or night mode &#8212; a feature that darkens the display and reduces the airflow speed to prevent night time disturbances. There's also a \"cooling\" mode, which is really just a fan. In testing, the cooling mode barely made a dent in room temperature, though the breeze did make me feel more comfortable.&#160;</p><p>The heating function on the Dyson works really well. The room starts warming almost immediately and the heat is effectively dispersed throughout the room. Within the first hour of testing, the temperature increased by 6 degrees Fahrenheit &#8212; a welcome bit of warmth on a particularly cold day. To run the heater, you select your desired room temperature in degrees. On auto, the heater will run at the ideal speed to quickly heat your room (and purify the air), but you can override that and select your own airflow settings.</p><p>The noise level depends on the selected airflow speed, which runs from settings one to 10. Setting 10 will require some volume adjustment on your TV while a one or two is barely noticeable and didn't disturb me at all while I was working. The heater has an auto-shutoff that prevents it from overheating and it will automatically turn off if falls over or detects that the heating mode has been active for more than 9 hours. It's also the only heater where no part of the exterior is hot to the touch, making it safe for use around kids.&#160;</p><p>In my opinion, the air purifier is the main advantage of this device over other heaters. I quickly became obsessed with tracking my home's air quality and love the detailed info I get from using the app. The machine reacts quickly and automatically to air contaminants I had never really thought about. For example, while I was preheating my oven for dinner, the unit automatically adjusted to its maximum air speed to help purify the \"contaminated\" air caused by my dirty hot oven. Other users report it ramping up air flow when you're using household cleaning products, to help dissipate the chemicals.</p><p>Unfortunately, this feature means that, unlike the other heaters on this list, the Dyson requires regular maintenance. In addition to the initial cost, you'll have to spend more on <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=36310&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dyson.com%2Fsupport%2Fjourney%2Ftools%2F969048-01\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">filter replacements</a>, which don't come cheap at almost $80 each. The rate at which you replace them depends on usage and air quality. For reference, I've been running the unit for a few weeks and the app says that the HEPA and carbon filters have 98% life remaining.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Another drawback is that the Dyson's onboard display is almost totally useless; it's so small that it's impossible to read from across a room. You really have to have your nose right up to the unit to peek at the tiny, round screen. However, you can access the same information in the app.&#160;</p><p>The Dyson is also, by far, the most expensive space heater we tested. It comes loaded with tons of extra features that might justify the price tag if you're concerned about air quality in your home or want a connected device that can be used with an app or virtual assistants like Amazon Alexa or Google Home. However, if you're just interested in warming a chilly space, you'll get similar heating power from the cheaper picks in this guide.</p>\n\tThe best space heater that's also a fan\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd257ac30f2740018b0f19c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Honeywell space heater\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steph Coelho/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://goto.walmart.com/c/196318/565706/9383?veh=aff&#38;sourceid=imp_000011112222333344&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FHoneywell-VersaHeat-Digital-Two-Position-Heater-HHF260-White%2F215441994\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">HoneyWell Versa Two Position Heater</a> is a space-saving heater with a powerful fan and thoughtful safety features not usually found in most space heaters.&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Powerful fan, cool-touch housing, overheat protection, unique safety features intended to prevent electrical fires&#160;</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Noisy, no heat cycling, no tip-over switch</p><p>The \"two position\" feature of this heater means you can place the unit upright or on its side, so you can use it in a variety of spaces and situations. I primarily used it in the upright position and was impressed by how this little rectangular heater warmed my office by 3 degrees very quickly. It uses a fan to push heat around, and the warmth spread evenly throughout my office instead of being concentrated in one area. Since the heat disperses so well, it didn't leave me sweating while I was waiting for my office to warm, unlike some other models I tried.</p><p>In addition to being a good feature for dispersing heat, the fan can also be used to keep you cool. While the fan is powerful when used on its own, this feature does make a fair bit of noise, which I could hear from adjoining rooms.&#160;</p><p>I also appreciated the thoughtful safety features of this space heater. While it doesn't have a tip-over sensor, the unit stays cool to the touch and the wiring is thermally insulated to prevent the cord from overheating. It also has an overheat sensor and an ALCI plug like those found on many blow dryers, which reacts quickly to shorts like a surge protector does. Overall, it's a great space heater for those who are safety conscious and those who want a product they can also use in warmer weather.&#160;</p>\n\tWhat else we tested\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd259e77b7e050019107360?format=jpeg\" alt=\"What else we tested space heater\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steph Coelho/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>All the heaters I tested worked as intended, quickly raising the temperature in my office by several degrees. A few just missed the mark for inclusion in our top picks. Here are some heaters that might be worth considering depending on your needs:</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01K6UGW1Y/ref=as_li_tl?ots=1&#38;slotNum=20&#38;imprToken=a8ba58eb-594b-7e6f-3fe&#38;ie=UTF8&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;creativeASIN=B01K6UGW1Y&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;tag=biipgf_081117_best-space-heaters-20&#38;linkId=3978820c799c0ed86d6ac17f145a543f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Honeywell Uberheat Ceramic Heater</strong></a> <strong>($34.99): </strong>This is a sleek little heater with an attractive aesthetic that looks more like a designer speaker than a space heater. It takes up minimal desk space and has several key safety features like a highly sensitive tip-over switch and an overheat detector. It has one control knob to select both the setting (high or low) and the temperature, which was pretty easy to use after a quick peek at the instruction manual. However, the cycling function didn't do a great job at maintaining a consistent temperature. More often than not, I felt uncomfortably hot. The unit would cycle on when the room temperature hadn't dipped at all. This leads me to believe that the internal temperature sensor isn't particularly accurate or the machine turns on and off at preset intervals. The front grille also gets <em>very</em> hot, so I had to be extra careful when handling the unit, though the rest of the housing does stay cool to the touch. Still, if you use the heater without the cycling function, it produces a fair bit of warmth and looks good doing it. It's a great little heater for the design-conscious individual.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B089LWW1GP/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_081117_best-space-heaters-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B089LWW1GP&#38;linkId=58cf5c08217e28d79b03e30d3d4ab9a9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Taotronics Space Heater</strong></a> <strong>($64.99): </strong>The moderate size of this heater was surprising, especially since marketing photos on Amazon make it look much bigger than it actually is. In reality, it's a little under a foot-and-a-half tall: too small for a floor heater, but too tall for a tabletop heater. When I used it on the floor, I felt like only my lower legs were warmed, and when I used it on my desk, it was impossible to adjust and check the heat settings while seated, since the controls are at the top of the unit. It's likely why the unit comes with a remote, but if I'm using this in my home office, a remote is a silly extra thing to have on hand and only serves to clutter up my workspace. It heats fine, looks sleek, and swivels, but it's an awkward size and shape for a space heater.&#160;</p>\n\tWhat we don't recommend\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd25adc30f2740018b0f1c1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"What we don&#39;t recommend space heaters\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steph Coelho/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Some models didn't quite make the cut because of safety concerns, design flaws, or other limitations. Here are the heaters that we don't recommend buying:</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07WLCBH96/ref=as_li_tl?ots=1&#38;slotNum=5&#38;imprToken=a8ba58eb-594b-7e6f-3fe&#38;ie=UTF8&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;creativeASIN=B07WLCBH96&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;tag=biipgf_081117_best-space-heaters-20&#38;linkId=759f0726020c19931d8a1388b9877ca3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Trustech Ceramic Space Heater</strong></a><strong> ($29.99): </strong>Straight out of the box, this unit intrigued me with its streamlined design, but as soon as I put it on my desk I changed my tune. The heater has an oscillation feature with a spinning disc on the bottom of the unit, but it makes the heater wobble and feel unsteady compared to other models I tested. While it does have a tip-over switch, I never quite felt comfortable using this heater because of how much it wobbles. It heats up just fine, but no better than other heaters I tried, and not enough to justify the design concerns.</p><p><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=3184&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.macys.com%2Fshop%2Fproduct%2Fvornado-velocity-5-space-heater%3FID%3D11697799\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Vornado Velocity 5</strong></a><strong> ($99.99): </strong>This square-shaped heater looked rugged and powerful with its large fan placed prominently on display, but it was surprisingly underpowered. It didn't do a good job of dispersing heat, and I often felt chilly sitting right near it if it wasn't pointed directly at me. The crisp display is one of the most legible of all the heaters I tested, but the built-in thermostat is very inaccurate. Anytime I checked my reference thermometer, the reading on the heater's display was at least 3 to 4 degrees off the mark.</p>\n\tTesting methodology\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd25c577b7e050019107375?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Our methodology space heater\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steph Coelho/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>In addition to interviewing two safety experts about space heaters, I relied heavily on my own experience reviewing heating devices like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-patio-heater\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">patio heaters</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mr-heater-buddy-heater-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">portable outdoor heaters</a> for this guide. I put all eight space heaters through the same set of standard tests and used a reference thermometer to collect temperature data. Here's what I looked for with each test:</p><p><strong>Ability to heat: </strong>This is the most important function of a space heater. I tested every heater in my 100 square foot office. I used a reference thermometer that was always positioned on the corner of my desk, smack dab in the middle of the room. I placed the heaters diagonally from the thermometer &#8212; compact units sat on my desk while full-sized ones were placed in the far corner of my office. I tried each heater's various settings and took notes about the accuracy of internal thermostats. I was also looking for how well the heaters could hold the room at my desired temperature &#8212; usually around 70 to 72 degrees Fahrenheit &#8212; without surrounding me in a nauseating heat cloud. To the best of my ability, I made sure that I didn't turn on my thermostat throughout testing except when there was a risk of pipes freezing or danger to my parrot's health. Most of the time, testing began when the temperature in my office was hovering somewhere between 60 and 64 degrees Fahrenheit.&#160;</p><p><strong>Time to heat</strong>: I used an indoor thermometer and a timer to evaluate how long it took for the space heater to bring the room up to my ideal temperature. Some models operate by blasting heat higher than your target temperature to get the room hot faster, but I found these left me feeling hot and sweaty. Units that were too slow left me still feeling the shivers a few hours later. I was searching for the sweet spot in the middle. Units with an accurate cycling feature received bonus points for maintaining comfort levels in my office.&#160;</p><p><strong>Easy-to-use controls: </strong>It's a space heater, not a spaceship. While safety experts recommend reading the manual cover-to-cover before using a space heater, I put myself in the average consumer's shoes and tried to figure out the unit on my own before referencing any manuals. I looked for controls that were intuitive and easy to figure out.</p><p><strong>Size</strong>: In a small office, there's not a whole lot of extra room for a device like a space heater. Extra points went to units that were powerful, but still compact, lightweight, and easy to fit in a confined area. For those who have larger spaces to heat, we did include picks for full-size heaters.</p><p><strong>Noise: </strong>Every space heater made some noise, which is to be expected, but some were a bit quieter than others. I docked points from units that I felt needed to be turned off for Zoom meetings or phone calls.&#160;</p><p><strong>Safety features: </strong>I verified whether safety features were functional (except for overheat functions, since that would have presented a safety hazard), including tipping the units over to test for automatic shut offs.&#160;</p>\n\tWhat to look for in a space heater\n\t\n\t<p>Space heaters convert electricity into heat and contain a fan that helps propel and disperse the heat throughout the room. Most space heaters all share a few standard functions, like a power button and high or low temperature settings. However, we've found a few key features to consider when shopping for a space heater:</p><p><strong>Power: </strong>Most heaters in our guide have 1,500 watts of power, which is pretty standard for space heaters. More powerful heaters are usually marketed as \"garage heaters\" and either need to be hardwired into your electrical circuit or run on a special appliance circuit. Fortunately, a heater with 1,500 watts should be enough to heat a room of about 150 square feet.&#160;</p><p><strong>Heat cycling function: </strong>For comfort and energy efficiency, you'll want a space heater with a heat cycling function &#8212; this allows you to select a desired temperature that the unit then attempts to maintain by cycling on and off when the temperature dips above or below the threshold. This is similar to how a built-in thermostat works in your home and prevents you from having to manually turn the unit on and off to maintain comfort levels. Not all cycling features work well, however; our picks above outline models with cycling features that are accurate and easy to use.&#160;</p><p><strong>Size: </strong>You can also choose between compact models and larger full-size units. A small space heater is great for desktop use in a home office, dorm room, or office building. It'll usually heat just the area right around the heater comfortably, which is good enough if you're just looking for a small bubble of personal comfort. A space heater with a bigger footprint has a larger fan, which helps blow air around the room and is ideal for heating large spaces like garages or full rooms. Opt for a full-size heater if you have a lot of space to heat.</p><p><strong>Safety: </strong>We outline more safety features to look for in the section below, but overheat protection is a must.&#160;</p>\n\tSpace heater safety\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd25d307b7e05001910737a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Space heater safety\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steph Coelho/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Sure, space heaters are ultra-convenient, but the safety experts we spoke to said they can also be dangerous if not used properly. According to a 2018 report from the <a href=\"https://www.nfpa.org/News-and-Research/Publications-and-media/Press-Room/News-releases/2018/Space-heaters-account-for-43-percent-of-US-home-heating-fires-and-85-percent-of-associated-deaths\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">National Fire Protection Association</a>, space heaters cause 43% of U.S. fires due to home heating &#8212; and 85% of related deaths.&#160;</p><p>Both Matthew Griffith, fire prevention section chief with the <a href=\"https://ville.montreal.qc.ca/sim/en\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Montreal Fire Department</a>, and Dan Mock, brand manager of <a href=\"https://www.mistersparky.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mr. Sparky</a>, an electrical services company, said the number one rule for using a space heater is to <em>never</em> leave it unattended.&#160;</p><p>Beyond that, experts said that space heater safety starts with buying and unboxing the unit. Griffith said customers should look for a space heater that's certified by the <a href=\"https://www.ul.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Underwriter's Laboratory</a> (UL, or ULC in Canada) and has safety features like an auto-shutoff and tip-over switch. Mock also recommends reading the instruction manual cover-to-cover and inspecting the device before running it. \"A lot of times things can get cracked or broken or the plug gets pulled loose or gets dirt in the heating element. You just want to make sure it's nice and clean,\" said Mock. The best way to dislodge trapped dust is to use a combination of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0000AE67M/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_081117_best-space-heaters-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0000AE67M&#38;linkId=35d13a512f9f95b936530ff6b1181d51\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">canned air</a> and a dry cloth. It's also a good idea to keep the packaging so you can store the heater and keep it dust-free during the warmer months.&#160;</p><p>Where you place the space heater matters, too. Griffith said not to put a space heater too close to walls or flammable materials, and keep the backside of the heater clear, as the unit can overheat if blocked.</p><p>Additionally, paying attention to what you're plugging into electrical outlets can help prevent fires, said Mock. The average circuit breaker is rated at about 15 amps, but a powerful space heater can take up the entire power load of the circuit. \"A circuit breaker is really only supposedly safe up to about 80% of its maximum capacity, which is about 12 amps,\" he said. \"So if you think about it, a 15 amp electric heater on a circuit is drawing everything it can out of one circuit breaker. So if you add a lamp, if you add anything else to that circuit, you're overloading the circuit and you're standing a good chance of causing an electrical fire.\" While circuit breakers provide some protection from electrical fires, it's important to be mindful of repeatedly overtaxing the circuit. Mock also warns against using extension cords with these types of appliances (as do most space heater instruction manuals) because they can heat up significantly, which increases your risk of starting a fire.</p><h3>The bottom line</h3><p>Keep an eye on your space heater. Think of it like a candle. You'd never leave the house or go to bed with one burning; treat your heater the same way.</p>\n\tCheck out our other winter guides to keep warm\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d9fa1274af9093a4d5255b6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"5bdb2e338c35ab5036124742\" height=\"525\" width=\"700\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">J. Crew/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-fire-pit\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best fire pits</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-winter-boots-women\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best winter boots for women</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-winter-coat-men\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best winter coats for men</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-beanie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best beanies</a></li></ul>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/best-space-heater'>Business (Steph Coelho)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd253c37b7e050019107318?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn24@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-12-433_2a8d300bf35d7966.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fd254247b7e05001910731e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn80@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-34-705_9e8e95aec48d5ebf.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fd25d6530f2740018b0f1d4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn23@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-23-360_6063fc56a9ea71c5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fd257ac30f2740018b0f19c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn63@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-32-426_fe0dcf978232a1e0.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fd259e77b7e050019107360?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn19@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-485_b1172adb7303caa8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fd25adc30f2740018b0f1c1?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn60@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-25-862_91ed290248fe7b44.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fd25c577b7e050019107375?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn32@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-25-676_5d030ec4a69675a5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fd25d307b7e05001910737a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn13@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-28-205_b9c07f14f96af745.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d9fa1274af9093a4d5255b6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn96@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-31-070_a1d149808d247062.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=nc6csU1ctkk:Zh5PzLe_5Es:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn87@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-29-519_a27e202d8238e118.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=nc6csU1ctkk:Zh5PzLe_5Es:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn44@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-32-207_76ceb46265a10dca.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=nc6csU1ctkk:Zh5PzLe_5Es:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn19@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-28-243_013df7ea7373f195.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/nc6csU1ctkk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn27@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-33-431_b271f2126b6765a0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712044},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"An eruption on the sun didn't bring the aurora to Pennsylvania or Oregon this week, but more solar outbursts are expected soon","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/solar-eruption-storm-could-bring-aurora-to-northern-us-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd1293748a2590018262808?format=jpeg\" alt=\"coronal mass ejection sun\" height=\"1012\" width=\"1350\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The sun blows out a coronal mass ejection, February 24, 2015.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://images.nasa.gov/details-brief-outburst_16760026566_o\" target=\"_blank\">NASA/GSFC</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>An eruption on the sun's surface sent plasma and charged particles speeding towards Earth this week.</li>\n<li>Forecasts suggested that this coronal mass ejection would reach our planet Wednesday as a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/gray-whales-stranded-during-solar-storms-cant-navigate-properly-2020-2\">solar storm</a> that could <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/titanic-theory-suggests-aurora-borealis-solar-storm-affected-crash-2020-9\">interfere with radio</a>, GPS, and power grids.</li>\n<li>There was a possibility the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-types-of-aurora-upending-understanding-of-polar-lights-2020-9\">aurora borealis</a> could be visible from Pennsylvania to Iowa to Oregon, but in the end, the northern lights didn't appear that far south.</li>\n<li>The sun is entering a period of increasing violent activity, so more opportunities for the northern US to see the aurora are likely.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>An eruption on the sun this week prompted warnings from the National Weather Service.</p><p>The outburst sent plasma and magnetically charged particles, called a coronal mass ejection (CME), speeding towards Earth. If those particles had hit our atmosphere just right, the NWS <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/NWSSWPC/posts/4863777813673409\">said</a>, they could have inundated the planet in a geomagnetic storm that would interfere with power grids, GPS, and radio communications, and even affect satellites' orbits around Earth.</p><p>These impacts could have extended into the northern US and brought the aurora borealis - a reaction between solar particles and Earth's atmosphere - creeping down into regions from Pennsylvania to Iowa to Oregon.</p><p>But when the CME arrived on Wednesday, there were no northern lights in these lower states.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f75f1fe0ab50d00184ad8db?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Aurora Borealis\" height=\"1500\" width=\"1999\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Aurora Borealis (Northern Lights) is seen over the sky near Rovaniemi in Lapland, Finland, October 7, 2018.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alexander Kuznetsov/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The space-weather branch of the National Weather Service had initially issued a watch for a \"strong\" geomagnetic storm on Thursday, but it downgraded the watch to \"minor\" after the CME's arrival.</p><p>This was because the CME's magnetic field was pointing north, according to Mike Hapgood, a space-weather consultant at the Rutherford Appleton Laboratory in the UK. It would need to face south in order to wash far enough through the North Pole opening in Earth's magnetic field to reach the US.</p><p>\"We're unlikely to see much activity, and the aurora will stay further north over Canada,\" Hapgood told Business Insider. The northern reaches of Maine and Michigan <a href=\"https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation\">may</a> still catch a glimpse of the green lights, though.</p><p>But Illinoisans and Iowans shouldn't despair. There may be better opportunities for them to see the aurora in the near future.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed7098d988ee353a8208169?format=jpeg\" alt=\"aurora southern lights earth atmosphere international space station iss\" height=\"518\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Aurora Australis, or southern lights, as seen from the International Space Station, on June 25, 2017.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ArHwh3xkEa8\" target=\"_blank\">NASA</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>That's because this CME was just a preview of an upcoming period of intense solar activity that could bring more geomagnetic storms and far-reaching aurorae. The sun is entering a new 11-year solar cycle, which means its eruptions and flares will grow more frequent and violent, ramping up to a peak in 2025.</p><p>\"This is more a wake-up call that stronger storms could occur in the next few years - and we ought to make sure we are ready for them,\" Hapgood said.</p><p>Strong solar storms are fairly common - the NWS <a href=\"https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation\">estimates</a> that each solar cycle produces about 200 of them - but scientists can't always predict them like this. That often means that power grids and key radio connections are left vulnerable.</p><h2>NASA is working to better predict space weather</h2><p>Electric currents from solar storms can travel down Earth's pipelines and power lines, overpowering technologies that humans rely on.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f0f5f544dca68027d287db4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Solar Orbiter sun corona\" height=\"876\" width=\"1167\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Solar Orbiter took this picture of the sun as it approached closer than any previous spacecraft on May 30, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Solar Orbiter/EUI Team (ESA &#38; NASA); CSL, IAS, MPS, PMOD/WRC, ROB, UCL/MSSL</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>In 1989, an inundation of particles from the sun <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/feature/goddard/2016/nasa-helps-power-grids-weather-geomagnetic-storms\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"33582a4c21859d56cd7046e1126d7a84\">knocked out Quebec's power</a> for about nine hours. Two other solar storms cut off emergency radio communications for a total of 11 hours shortly after Hurricane Irma in 2017. A solar storm may have even <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/titanic-theory-suggests-aurora-borealis-solar-storm-affected-crash-2020-9\">cut off SOS broadcasts from the Titanic</a> as it sank on April 14, 1912.</p><p>Bursts of solar activity can also endanger astronauts in Earth's orbit by interfering with their spacecraft or knocking out communications to mission control.</p><p>Studying the source of charged solar particles could help scientists figure out how to protect both astronauts and Earth's electric grid from these unpredictable electrical storms. Two spacecraft currently orbiting the sun are doing just that.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3c8fba3ac0c9643912f2fb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"solar orbiter sun spacecraft\" height=\"1414\" width=\"1885\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An artist&#39;s impression of the Solar Orbiter observing an eruption on the sun.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://sci.esa.int/web/solar-orbiter/-/50294-solar-orbiter-exploring-the-sun-s-realm\" target=\"_blank\">ESA/AOES</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>In February, NASA and the European Space Agency launched&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/europe-nasa-launching-new-spacecraft-toward-the-sun-2020-1\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"ab0fa0f9b5fd1b2544bc43aa068f199e\">the Solar Orbiter</a>&#160;to capture data about eruptions on the sun's surface. NASA's&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-parker-solar-probe-winds-flip-suns-magnetic-field-2019-12\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"34aaa072c235e0122c4c6b146f3fbb6a\">Parker Solar Probe</a>&#160;is also zooming around the sun. It's designed to measure solar eruptions as they happen, tracing the flow of material from the sun to the Earth in real-time.</p><p>The information these spacecraft are collecting could one day help scientists forecast more geomagnetic storms before they happen.</p><p><em>This story has been updated with new information. It was originally published at 7:34 p.m. ET on December 9, 2020.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a t/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qaMb2xNipxU:CuDG1xgv-Xc:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn20@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-29-209_3c3348609ae1449a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qaMb2xNipxU:CuDG1xgv-Xc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn75@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-30-842_72e7072a3a886d7d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qaMb2xNipxU:CuDG1xgv-Xc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn11@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-29-039_ce851db13b03ac22.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/qaMb2xNipxU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn47@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-33-619_003f1fe7333bbba4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712049},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"Biden tells civil rights leaders that Republicans weaponized the 'defund the police' slogan to 'beat the hell' out of Democrats","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-told-civil-rights-leaders-avoid-defund-the-police-slogan-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd286912dc42e0018f0e471?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Joe Biden\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President-elect Joe Biden speaks at The Queen theater in Wilmington, Del., Wednesday, Dec. 9, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Susan Walsh/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President-elect Joe Biden told a group of civil rights leaders that Republicans \"beat the hell\" out of Democrats in 2020 by attacking them over the \"defund the police\" slogan employed by some activists.</li>\n<li>Biden made the remarks in a Tuesday Zoom call with several civil rights heavyweights.</li>\n<li>Audio from the call was leaked to The Intercept.</li>\n<li>Biden urged the group to avoid pushing for drastic police reform measures ahead of the two US Senate runoff elections in Georgia.</li>\n<li>\"I also don't think we should get too far ahead ourselves on dealing with police reform in that, because they've already labeled us as being 'defund the police' anything we put forward in terms of the organizational structure to change policing,\" Biden said.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>President-elect Joe Biden warned a group of prominent civil rights leaders that Republicans \"beat the hell\" out of downballot Democrats in the 2020 election by portraying them as supportive of \"defunding\" the police in a Tuesday meeting with civil rights leaders, <a href=\"https://theintercept.com/2020/12/10/biden-audio-meeting-civil-rights-leaders/\">according to audio of the meeting obtained by the Intercept.&#160;</a></p><p>The call included Vice-president elect Sen. Kamala Harris, prominent civil rights advocates including NAACP President Derrick Johnson, National Action Network founder Rev. Al Sharpton, NAACP Education &#38; Legal Defense Fund leader Sherrilyn Ifill, former Department of Justice Civil Rights Division leader Vanita Gupta, and Rep. Cedric Richmond of Louisiana, who is set to join the Biden administration.&#160;</p><p>\"I also don't think we should get too far ahead ourselves on dealing with police reform in that, because they've already labeled us as being 'defund the police' anything we put forward in terms of the organizational structure to change policing - which I promise you, will occur. Promise you,\" Biden said during the call.</p><p>Police and criminal justice reform became a Nationwide issue earlier this year after the police killings of George Floyd, Breona Taylor, and other Black Americans. Some activists have used the phrasing \"defund the police\" to describe how they wanted justice and policing reformed in their communities.</p><p>\"That's how they beat the living hell out of us across the country, saying that we're talking about defunding the police. We're not. We're talking about holding them accountable,\" Biden said. \"We're talking about giving them money to do the right things. We're talking about putting more psychologists and psychiatrists on the telephones when the 911 calls through. We're talking about spending money to enable them to do their jobs better, not with more force, with less force and more understanding.\"</p><p>Just beore making his remaks about police, Biden responded to a concern<a href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/12/09/black-farmers-tom-vilsack-agriculture-usda-biden-cabinet-444077\">&#160;from Johnson about nominating Tom Vilsack to serve as Agriculture Secretary</a>, a position Vilsack held for the entire duration of former President Barack Obama's administration from 2009 to 2017.&#160;</p><p>In 2010, Vilsack was criticized for<a href=\"https://www.huffpost.com/entry/joe-biden-tom-vilsack-agriculture-secretary_n_5fd03658c5b61d81b33a0d17\"> firing Shirley Sherrod</a>, then the Director of Rural Development for the agency, over remarks she made that were deceptively edited by Breitbart News founder Andrew Breitbart. After an uproar over her ouster, Vilsack offered Sherrod a job back at the department, which she declined.&#160;</p><p>On January 5, there are two US Senate runoffs taking place in Georgia, which will determine which party controls the US Senate. If Democrats win both seats, control of the Senate will be evenly divided between 50 Democratic caucus members and 50 Republicans with Harris as the tie-breaking vote.&#160;</p><p>\"If you consider the victory that you appreciated in Georgia, it was around 12,000 votes,\" Johnson said. \"And so as you consider appointments, you also must consider what impact would that have on voters in the state of Georgia. And I will submit to you that former Secretary Vilsack could have a disastrous impact on voters in Georgia. Shirley Sherrod is a civil rights legend, a hero.\"</p><p>Biden told Johnson he'd \"learn more about Vilsack's record\" before he pivoted to warning the leaders not to go all-in on police reform or promote the \"defund the police\" slogan ahead of the Georgia runoffs.</p><p>While Biden won the presidency with 306 Electoral College votes, Democrats down the ballot didn't fare as well. Pending the outcome of the Georgia runoffs. Democrats only won back one US Senate seat and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/2020-house-elections-results\">lost nine US House seats</a>, according to Decision Desk HQ and Insider.</p><p>\"President-elect Biden is the same person behind closed doors that he is public; honest, direct and realistic about the challenges facing our nation the day he is sworn in,\" <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2020-election/leaked-recording-biden-says-gop-used-defund-police-beat-living-n1250757\">a Biden transition official told NBC News about the recording</a>. \"As he made clear throughout the campaign, he believes in supporting bold and urgent reform to our criminal justice system while continuing to support law enforcement's mission to keep our communities safe.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-told-civil-rights-leaders-avoid-defund-the-police-slogan-2020-12'>Business 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"A Wisconsin Air National Guard F-16 pilot is dead after a fighter jet crash in Michigan","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/wisconsin-air-nationa-guard-f-16-crashes-in-michigan-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd0d83f240ebd00126bddf6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"A Wisconsin Air National Guard F-16 Fighting Falcon fighter aircraft\" height=\"373\" width=\"746\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Wisconsin Air National Guard F-16.\n<p class=\"copyright\">US Air Force</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A Wisconsin National Guard F-16 fighter jet crashed in Michigan during a routine training flight Tuesday night, the Guard said in a Facebook post.</li>\n<li>The Guard's 115th Fighter Wing announced Thursday afternoon that the pilot, who was initially missing after the crash, had died.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A Wisconsin Air National Guard F-16 Fighting Falcon crashed in Michigan's Upper Peninsula during a routine training flight Tuesday evening. The pilot's death was announced Thursday afternoon.</p><p>The fighter jet, which went down around 8 p.m. Tuesday in Delta County, Michigan, was assigned to the 115th Fighter Wing at Truax Field Air National Guard Base in Madison, Wisconsin.</p><p>\"The cause of the crash, as well as the status of the pilot, are unknown at this time, and the incident is under investigation,\" the Wisconsin National Guard said in the immediate aftermath.</p><p>On Thursday, the 115th Fighter Wing announced that the pilot, who was initially missing after the crash, had died. The pilot's identity is being withheld for 24 hours, during which time next of kin will be notified.</p><p>\"We are deeply saddened by this tragic loss; our thoughts and prayers are with the family during this difficult time,\" 115th Fighter Wing commander Col. Bart Van Roo said in a statement. \"Today is a day for mourning, the 115th Fighter Wing and the entire Wisconsin National Guard stands with the pilot's family as we grieve the loss of a great Airman, and patriot.\"</p><p>\"We are an extremely close knit group at the fighter wing, the loss of one of our own brings immeasurable sadness to every member of our organization,\" he added.</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe src=\"https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2F115FW%2Fposts%2F10158865246132378&show_text=true&width=552&height=697&appId\" width=\"552\" height=\"697\" style=\"border:none;overflow:hidden\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"true\" allow=\"autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; picture-in-picture; web-share\"></iframe></div><p>The US military has seen a handful of F-16 crashes this year, some of which have been deadly.</p><p>In mid-July, a US Air Force F-16C Viper crashed while landing at Holloman Air Force base in New Mexico. The pilot of the single-seat aircraft was able to eject successfully and sustained only minor injuries.</p><p>In June, an Air Force F-16CM Fighting Falcon crashed during a late-night flight at Shaw Air Force Base in South Carolina. The pilot, 1st Lt. David Schmitz, died after being taken to a local hospital.</p><p>In November last year, Air Force Magazine reported that the Air Force said that it had seen no data pointing to any safety issues with the fighter aircraft, despite a string of F-16 crashes over the years.</p><p><em>Update: This post, which was initially published on 12/9/2020, has been updated to include the announcement on the pilot's death.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/wisconsin-air-nationa-guard-f-16-crashes-in-michigan-2020-12'>Business src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd286457b7e050019107461?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: The Snapchat app logo is seen on a smartphone in this picture illustration taken September 15, 2017. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration\" height=\"1749\" width=\"3500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Snapchat app logo is seen on a smartphone in this illustration\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Shares of Snap and Twitter jumped on Thursday after Twitter launched a new feature on its iOS mobile app that allows users to embed tweets into snapchats.</strong></li><li><strong>Snapchat's parent company, Snap Inc, jumped as high as 8% to $53 per share. Twitter gained 9.5% in intraday trading and is now hovering around $51 a share.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>Mobile Twitter users who are logged into the Snapchat app can now tap on a tweet and share it on snapchat via a snap story or a snapchat to a friend.&#160;</strong></li><li><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/snap-stock\"><strong>Watch Snap trade live here.</strong></a><strong>&#160;</strong></li><li><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/twtr-stock\"><strong>Watch Twitter trade live here</strong></a><strong>.&#160;</strong></li></ul><hr><p>Shares of <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/snap-stock\">Snap</a> and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/twtr-stock\">Twitter</a> jumped on Thursday after Twitter launched a new feature on the iOS version of it app that allows users to share tweets via Snapchat.</p><p>Snapchat's parent company, Snap Inc, jumped as high as 8% and closed at $53.19 on Thursday. Twitter gained 9.5% in intraday trading and closed at $51.22. <br><br>Mobile Twitter users who are logged into the Snapchat app can now tap on a tweet and share it on snapchat via a snap story or a snapchat to a friend. The feature is available on iOS now.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cathie-wood-market-outlook-tesla-salesforce-slack-merger-bitcoin-webinar-2020-12\" data-analytics-position=\"7\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Cathie Wood is beating 99% of fund managers this year. The ARK CEO and her team share their outlooks for 2021 - including thoughts on Tesla's $5 billion stock sale, the Salesforce-Slack tie-up, and bitcoin's meteoric rise.</a></em></p><p>According to Reuters, Twitter plans to roll out the feature soon for Android users. Reuters also reported that Twitter will start testing a similar integration feature for stories on Instagram for a small group of users.&#160;</p><p>Twitter is up 59% year-to-date, while Snap has been on an even bigger tear, up 221% in the same period. <br><br><br></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
