2020 21:08:43 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f68b5db57b7da001ee12c11?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"9db23251ded2149ecdb5654242c3bfff","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn1@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-20-582_2646089e366d4e22.webp","destWidth":3488,"destHeight":2615,"sourceBytes":119092,"destBytes":119092,"author":"egraffeo@businessinsider.com (Emily Graffeo)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd286457b7e050019107461?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn56@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-33-094_53bff59576c5f425.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=e5h99tbG6_E:qfbi_4tST-Y:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn31@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-29-089_fae7e5f8db44e3ad.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=e5h99tbG6_E:qfbi_4tST-Y:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn78@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-30-174_5154c35c4d62f9e5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=e5h99tbG6_E:qfbi_4tST-Y:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn29@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-30-498_753d59b472ab205f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/e5h99tbG6_E":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn12@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-23-292_1e52edbda6f8b787.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712060},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"Young adults are having a harder time finding the motivation to work during the pandemic than their older peers","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/young-adults-struggling-motivation-covid-pandemic-pew-survey-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd2490830f2740018b0f0ff?format=jpeg\" alt=\"work from home\" height=\"2128\" width=\"4256\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>As a majority of the US workforce work from home during the pandemic, and a recent survey from the Pew Research Center shows that younger respondents are struggling to self-motivate during the pandemic.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A recent survey from the Pew Research Center showed that 42% of US adults under the age of 50 reported difficulties in finding the motivation to work since the beginning of the pandemic.</li>\n<li>Respondents between the ages of 18-29 expressed difficulties motivating themselves at an even higher rate: 53%.</li>\n<li>A quarter of respondents said finding an adequate workspace during the pandemic has proven to be difficult.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>As she wakes up each morning in her miniature Brooklyn apartment, Noa Gutow-Ellis' motivation to be productive has waned each day the pandemic has dragged on.</p><p>The 24-year-old former museum collections and exhibitions assistant is currently applying to law schools. She's one of many young adults grappling with their mental health and motivation to work during the COVID-19 pandemic, which has killed more than <a href=\"https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#cases_casesper100klast7days\">285,000 people in the US alone</a>.</p><p>\"I don't remember 9/11, like I have no recollection,\" Gutow-Ellis told Insider. \"This is the first time that I've experienced death and suffering on this kind of a scale.\"</p><p>In a recent survey from the <a href=\"https://www.pewsocialtrends.org/2020/12/09/how-the-coronavirus-outbreak-has-and-hasnt-changed-the-way-americans-work/\">Pew Research Center</a>, 42% of adults under the age of 50 said it's been somewhat or very difficult for them to feel motivated since the onset of the coronavirus pandemic. Respondents aged 50 and older said the same just 20% of the time - a 22 percentage point difference.</p><p>The divide is even larger for some of the country's youngest workers. According to the survey, 53% of respondents between the ages of 18 and 29 complained of a lack of motivation.</p><p>\"I'm almost just like, 'How are we doing anything else?' How am I supposed to study for the LSATs so that I can get my law school applications out when all I want to do is try to make things better for people?\" Gutow-Ellis said.</p><p>She said spending all her time confined in her apartment has added to the stress. One in four respondents to the Pew survey also noted that they had a difficult time finding adequate workspaces during the pandemic.</p><p>\"I do everything in the same space - and I'm someone who really thrived off of being able to go work in a library or a coffee shop,\" Gutow-Ellis said. \"I'm definitely finding that when you cook and eat and sleep in the same shoebox in Brooklyn, it's very hard to differentiate when to do what.\"</p><p>Four other people under the age of 29 spread across the US shared similar frustrations with Insider. They asked to be anonymous so they could speak freely about motivation and mental health and not have their employers retaliate.</p><p>Some young adults are working remotely as they enter the workforce for the first time post-college, sometimes leading to imposter syndrome where they don't feel like they can keep up with their coworkers.</p><p>As one person told Insider, \"combine that with regular anxiety and a hint of pandemic depression, and baby you've got a mental illness stew going.\"</p><p>Jesse Lehrer, a 37-year-old in New York who was working in the field of social work before quitting and enrolling in online classes, told Insider that his motivation was sapped because of how his office handled transitioning its workflow during the pandemic.</p><p>\"They were just giving me total busy work to do,\" Lehrer said. \"Most of it was just a complete and utter waste of time.\"</p><p>Lehrer told Insider that the switch to online classes has improved his mental health and has helped him stay busy and pass the time. But the ongoing pandemic continues to take a toll on his motivation.</p><p>\"It's hard to be motivated for anything right now because of being home and not having your regular social supports there,\" Lehrer said. \"The backdrop of everything is just depressing and stressful.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Coulter)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd27e0b7b7e050019107424?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn80@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-21-707_27ca940b89a62e38.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=26Fdzqq59OU:x7uy8h9A0uM:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn95@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-25-394_18c4d2ba5779bf9c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=26Fdzqq59OU:x7uy8h9A0uM:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn4@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-29-668_acf934428895caab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=26Fdzqq59OU:x7uy8h9A0uM:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn44@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-25-826_d29ae52f73faf37e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/26Fdzqq59OU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-24-417_8e37d4168a68d214.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712032},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"The best travel mugs","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-travel-mug","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>We put a dozen travel mugs to the test for temperature retention, leak resistance, and general ease of use.</li><li>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0746BXMZX/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B0746BXMZX&linkId=0ef4f9be0e578c25fdb00988c07c17200e578c25fdb00988c07c1720\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Zojirushi SM-SE Travel Mug</a> kept coffee hot and ice frozen for the longest of any mug we tested.</li><li>Plus, its locking lid ensures its contents stay safe inside.</li></ul><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><p>If you're frequently on the go, and you need your caffeine fix close at hand, a good travel mug likely features prominently in your daily routine.</p><p>Any mug with a lid that you can carry from place to place is technically a travel mug, but a poorly performing one will likely leave you with tepid coffee, spill stains on your clothes, and, in some cases, a moldy uncleanable lid that could make you sick.</p><p>With so many on the market, it can be difficult to distinguish the bad from the good. We put a dozen travel mugs to the test, evaluating each for how well it retained temperature, how easy it was to clean, and most importantly, how nice it was to drink from.</p><p>After more than five months of testing, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00HYOGTTG/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00HYOGTTG&linkId=0984a05a28cdd1ad1e90ab7e7135fab228cdd1ad1e90ab7e7135fab2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Zojirushi SM-SE Travel Mug</a> stood out as the clear winner, but there were other mugs that excelled in specific areas that we think you'll like as well. For our full testing methodology and quantitative temperature test results, scroll to the bottom of this guide.</p><h2>These are the best travel mugs</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best overall: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0746BXMZX/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B0746BXMZX&linkId=0ef4f9be0e578c25fdb00988c07c17200e578c25fdb00988c07c1720\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Zojirushi SM-SE Travel Mug</a></strong></li><li>Best with a carry loop: <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hydroflask.com%2F16-oz-coffee-with-flex-sip-lid-sip-lid\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Hydro Flask Coffee with Flex Sip Lid</a></li><li>Best flip-top travel mug: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07WDRQ7Z6/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07WDRQ7Z6&linkId=3b8bfdcf7555c12e3c72af0d7b98344a7555c12e3c72af0d7b98344a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">S'well Commuter</a></li><li>Best spill-proof travel mug: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07L6N2641/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07L6N2641&linkId=cef392dcca9dbca6e10022970e2219d6ca9dbca6e10022970e2219d6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Stanley Classic Trigger Action Travel Mug</a></li><li>Best large-capacity travel mug:&#160;<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0842S56G8/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B0842S56G8&linkId=67763060b80d85d18994005887211e09b80d85d18994005887211e09\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Yeti Rambler Bottle</a> with <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G3BW24T/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07G3BW24T&linkId=40c44af7d64c60aaffa3eb0f771d3417d64c60aaffa3eb0f771d3417\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">HotShot Cap</a></li></ul><p><em>Prices and links are current as of 12/10/20. We overhauled this guide with new testing metrics and determined all new picks based on our testing. Les Shu contributed to this story.</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8f8e5adace450018a3e594?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Zojirushi SM SE Travel Mug Cap (2)\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Les Shu/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0746BXMZX/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0746BXMZX&#38;linkId=0ef4f9be0e578c25fdb00988c07c1720\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Zojirushi SM-SE Travel Mug</a>&#160;keeps both hot and cold drinks at enjoyable temperatures for hours longer than the competition, and its lockable lid ensures it's truly leak-proof.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Best temperature retention by far, lid is easy to clean, leak-proof locking lid, one-handed operation, five-year warranty on the vacuum insulation</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Not dishwasher safe, won't fit large ice cubes, will rattle around in cupholders</p><p>It's rare that we at Insider Reviews come across a product that is so head and shoulders above the competition that it's without a doubt the best overall pick; there's almost always a shortcoming or a caveat. But the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0746BXMZX/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0746BXMZX&#38;linkId=0ef4f9be0e578c25fdb00988c07c1720\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Zojirushi SM-SE Travel Mug</a> is, hands down, the best travel mug you can buy, and we've got the data to back it up.</p><p>According to our test, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0746BXMZX/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0746BXMZX&#38;linkId=0ef4f9be0e578c25fdb00988c07c1720\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Zojirushi</a> kept coffee hot for 14 hours &#8212; five hours longer than the next-best mug &#8212; and kept ice frozen for seven hours &#8212; an hour and a half longer than second place. Les Shu, Insider Reviews senior guides editor who helped me with secondary testing, found that it kept liquids hotter far longer if you don't open the lid as often.</p><p>Its spring-loaded push-button lid flips open to reveal a sizeable drinking spout that regulates liquid well, whether you're pouring it into a cup or your mouth. When closed, it's properly leak-proof, and it's got a switch at the base of the lid that locks it shut so you can confidently toss it in your bag.</p><p>The lid disassembles into two plastic pieces and two rubber gaskets, so you can get into all the nooks and crannies as you clean it. Unfortunately, you'll have to clean all the parts by hand as it's not dishwasher safe. It's a skinny mug too, so you'll want to invest in a good bottle brush. Because it's so skinny, you may have trouble fitting large ice cubes into it. It may also rattle around in your car's cupholder. But we're being nitpicky here.</p><p>If you want the mug that's going to keep your coffee hot the longest and provide the best drinking experience, this is your pick. Zojirushi also offers a five-year warranty on the vacuum insulation, so if your mug loses its ability to retain temperature, Zojirushi will replace it.</p>\n\tThe best with a carry loop\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8f8e6cb0526700185cc83b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hydro flask coffee travel mug cap\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Les Shu/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hydroflask.com%2F16-oz-coffee-with-flex-sip-lid\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Hydro Flask Coffee</a> is comfortable to drink from and easy to tote around on your next adventure thanks to its strong rubber carry loop.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Rubber carry loop, comfortable to drink from, lid disassembles easily, dishwasher safe, lifetime warranty</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Retained coffee smell, rubber loop may not be durable enough for attaching to packs</p><p>As much as I love the Zojirushi mug, it can get annoying to carry it around if you're roaming around bag-free or just don't have anywhere to stow it. The Hydro Flask Coffee helps mitigate this problem with the addition of a sturdy rubber carry loop. While walking around with it, I primarily held onto the loop with one or two fingers.</p><p>The Hydro Flask also provided one of the nicest drinking experiences of all the mugs we tested. The lid simply twists open, the liquid flows well, and there's no large lid mechanism to get in the way while you're drinking. When closed, the lid reveals a red square so you can quickly see that your mug is sealed. The lid disassembles into three plastic pieces and one rubber gasket, and all parts are dishwasher safe on the top rack.</p><p>In our temperature tests, it kept coffee hot for five hours and ice frozen for four and a half. We did find that the stainless steel retained some coffee smell after repeated use, so you may want to dedicate this mug to one type of beverage.</p><p>While the lid system does a good job of keeping it sealed, it's not as convenient to use as a trigger button if you primarily use your mug while driving. If you hit a bump and the lid is open, you might encounter a small spill. This was a rare occurrence, but drivers may want to keep this in mind.</p>\n\tThe best flip-top travel mug\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8f8e85b0526700185cc83d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"swell commuter travel mug cap\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Les Shu/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>With its one-piece flip-top lid, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07WDRQ7Z6/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07WDRQ7Z6&#38;linkId=3b8bfdcf7555c12e3c72af0d7b98344a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">S'well Commuter</a> is easy to clean and leak-proof, and it manages heat retention reasonably well.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Simple lid is easy to clean, stays leak-proof even after repeated use</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Too large for some cupholders, handwash only, won't keep ice frozen for very long</p><p>We disqualified more than one travel mug simply due to their exceedingly complicated lid mechanisms. A lid that's too hard to disassemble and clean will discourage you from washing it properly which can lead to mold growth. Flip-top lids are often one piece and the most simple, so mold has nowhere to hide.</p><p>The best flip-top travel mug we tried was the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07WDRQ7Z6/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07WDRQ7Z6&#38;linkId=3b8bfdcf7555c12e3c72af0d7b98344a\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">S'well Commuter</a>. It kept coffee hot for five hours, though admittedly it performed the worst in our ice test, keeping ice frozen for a mere two and a half hours. But it made up for it in its ease of use. The flip-top protrudes slightly from the lid, giving your thumb something to push up against and open the lid. It also folds back and locks in place so it doesn't droop and hit you in the nose while you drink.</p><p>Its wide base does mean that it may not fit in some cupholders &#8212; it's just slightly too fat for my Toyota Corolla &#8212; so if you're a car commuter, you may need to look elsewhere. We suggest you check out the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PYK3CVX/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07PYK3CVX&#38;linkId=c4276f11628f6ddb2cce49fd32b8e448\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Miir Travel Tumbler</a> &#8212; it's thinner and retains the temperature just as well as the S'well, but its flip-top was stiffer and slightly harder to open, so it just barely lost out.</p>\n\tThe best spill-proof travel mug\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8f8e96dace450018a3e597?format=jpeg\" alt=\"stanley classic trigger action travel mug cap\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Les Shu/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07L6N2641/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07L6N2641&#38;linkId=cef392dcca9dbca6e10022970e2219d6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Stanley Classic Trigger Action Travel Mug</a> opens with the press of a button and automatically seals itself shut so you won't have to worry about whether you remembered to close it.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Automatically seals when not in use, dishwasher-safe, lifetime warranty</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>Hand may get in the way while drinking, middling temperature retention</p><p>Even the most leak-proof mug is going to spill if you knock it over while the lid is open. If you know you're prone to spills or simply have too many important papers on your desk at any given time, do yourself a favor and invest in a mug that's totally klutz-proof.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07L6N2641/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07L6N2641&#38;linkId=cef392dcca9dbca6e10022970e2219d6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Stanley Classic Trigger Action Mug</a> automatically seals when not in use, helping to retain temperature as well as ensure all your coffee stays where it's supposed to. To drink, you simply press and hold down the button on the lid which depresses the stopper in the spout and lets liquid flow. Upon releasing the button, the stopper raises back up to seal the spout.&#160;</p><p>The Stanley performed admirably in our temperature tests, keeping coffee hot for six hours and ice frozen for four &#8212; firmly middle of the pack. The lid mechanism is a bit complicated, with buttons and springs, so you'll want to regularly disassemble it and get into the nooks and crannies with a brush to ensure it doesn't harbor mold, especially around the metal spring. It disassembles into two pieces with a simple twist.</p><p>The main disadvantage to this mug is also its main draw &#8212; you have to press the button to drink. The button is positioned on the back of the lid, so you may find your own hand gets in the way of drinking, especially if your hand is larger. The button is also why this is one of Les Shu's favorites, who has been using it nonstop since early 2019.</p>\n\tThe best large-capacity travel mug\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f90894eabcd0c0018d68e33?format=jpeg\" alt=\"yeti rambler Travel Mug Cap\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jen Gushue/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>If a single cup of coffee simply won't cut it, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0842S56G8/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0842S56G8&#38;linkId=67763060b80d85d18994005887211e09\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Yeti Rambler 26-oz. Bottle</a> has more than enough room to keep you fueled up, and the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G3BW24T/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07G3BW24T&#38;linkId=40c44af7d64c60aaffa3eb0f771d3417\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">HotShot Cap</a> makes it go down easy.</h3><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Offered in larger sizes than any other mug we tested, retains heat very well, dishwasher safe, very sturdy build</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Retains cold poorly, HotShot lid sold separately, HotShot lid gives no visual indication that it's open, definitely won't fit in cupholders</p><p>Most of the travel mugs we recommend come in multiple sizes, but they all max out at 20 ounces. If you're used to guzzling large amounts of your beverage of choice, and you can't be bothered with a refill, you'll want a travel mug to match your habits.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0842S56G8/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0842S56G8&#38;linkId=67763060b80d85d18994005887211e09\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Yeti Rambler Bottle</a> comes in smaller 12-oz. and 18-oz. offerings, but the unique 26-oz. model is what caught our eye, and it performed well in our heat-retention test putting up a second-place score of nine hours. It performed rather poorly in our cold test, keeping ice frozen for just three hours.</p><p>The Rambler Bottle comes with what Yeti calls its Chug Cap &#8212; think classic soda bottle top with a large-handled lid that twists all the way off. It's great for water, iced coffee, and other cold drinks, but if hot beverages are your main priority, you'll want to buy the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G3BW24T/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07G3BW24T&#38;linkId=40c44af7d64c60aaffa3eb0f771d3417\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">HotShot Cap</a> which is sold separately.</p><p>Senior Guides Editor Les Shu and I were split in our feelings on the HotShot. He appreciates the inner wall and the tight lock that keep spills at bay, while I was disappointed that it gave no visual indication that it was open or closed.</p><p>If by some chance, 26 ounces isn't enough coffee to get you going in the morning, Yeti also offers a huge <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0842BGFS8/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0842BGFS8&#38;linkId=89db9368684c482d8c1c1834f7192542\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">36-oz. Rambler Bottle</a>.</p><h3>Yeti HotShot Cap</h3><div id=\"ProductCard_5f7f6986d67e12205d039ad0\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f7f6986d67e12205d039ad0&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><h3>Yeti 26-oz. Rambler Bottle</h3>\n\tWhat else we recommend\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f90b79921211300187400ec?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Miir Klean Kanteen Travel Mugs\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Les Shu/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>These travel mugs are also terrific options and were only just edged out by our top picks.</p><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PYK3CVX/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07PYK3CVX&#38;linkId=c4276f11628f6ddb2cce49fd32b8e448\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Miir Travel Tumbler</a>: </strong>This flip-top mug was neck in neck with the S'well Commuter for our best flip-top pick. It was competitive in both temperature tests, and it fit nicely in cupholders which the S'well did not. But it lost out in the ease of use department. Its flip-top lies almost flush with the rest of the cap, so it's hard to get your thumb under it to open it, and it's so stiff that it requires quite a bit of force.</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07NRCGYY6/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07NRCGYY6&#38;linkId=f8a2a1bca55e4dda79e5e67d795f901c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Klean Kanteen Insulated TKWide</a>: </strong>This was another tough call in our best with a carry loop category. The Klean Kanteen actually beat out the Hydro Flask in both temperature tests, albeit by small margins, and we like the metal carry loop for durability. But the Klean Kanteen lid is difficult to disassemble for proper cleaning, and the metal carry loop is uncomfortable if you're carrying it by hand. The Hydro Flask just offered a nicer drinking experience. With that said, Senior Guides Editor Les Shu has been using an older Klean Kanteen for more than 10 years and can attest to the quality of the products.</li></ul>\n\tWhat else we considered\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f96d5844743a3001216b923?format=jpeg\" alt=\"snow peak otterbox contigo thermos travel mugs\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Les Shu/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>These containers are good products &#8212; in fact, they are made by reputable companies we like. But we encountered enough issues that stopped them from making our final list. Some didn't perform as well as our top picks, while others are a bit niche or too pricey for us to recommend to everyone. We plan to revisit these for our next update, to see if our opinion has changed since we last tested them.</p><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PGGQFWS/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07PGGQFWS&#38;linkId=e6b372206a2800cfc59dd1cda300fa6c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Thermos Stainless King</a>: </strong>The Thermos name is synonymous with travel mugs, so we wanted to test one. It performed well in the heat test but rather poorly in the cold test. Senior Editor Les Shu liked how easy it was to lock and unlock the lid. I found it difficult to disassemble and reassemble, while he didn't. Ultimately, it was edged out by stronger performers.&#160;</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07N3C5BM8/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07N3C5BM8&#38;linkId=50c08db43ca33f788dc0fccc37c82e38\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Contigo Luxe Autoseal</a>: </strong>We had high hopes for the Contigo since its predecessor, the Autoseal West Loop was our previous best overall pick. But it was the only mug that grew mold during my testing period. Shu, who uses this often as an everyday mug, said extra attention is needed when cleaning the inner spring mechanism, which is difficult to reach, but this should keep mold away. <br />For me, the metal lid also got hot when full of coffee, which made the button on the lid uncomfortable to press to drink. Shu does not find this to be an issue, and he appreciates the easy button press to unlock. Despite our difference of opinion on the Contigo, we concurred that for most people, the difficulty in cleaning was a dealbreaker. Contigo mugs are popular and can be found in many retailers, so if you do pick one up, we recommend getting a good set of cleaning brushes, like <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;xcust=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.gocontigo.com%2Fcleaning-brushes-set-of-3.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">these from the company</a>,</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F183023%2Fstanley-stay-hot-titanium-travel-mug-14-fl-oz\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Stanley Stay-Hot Titanium Travel Mug</a>: </strong>I received this mug from Stanley in an unsolicited press mailer, so I decided to throw it on the testing pile. It performed decently, but with a $100 price tag, it's simply out of reach for most people. Much cheaper mugs on our list can do exactly what the Stanley Stay-Hot can do. Its titanium build makes it very lightweight, but the Zojirushi actually clocks in at a few grams lighter. (Not shown in the photo above.)</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.backcountry.com%2Fsnow-peak-kanpai-bottle\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Snow Peak Kanpai Bottle</a>:</strong> This Snow Peak mug is another that falls under the premium category. It comes with three separate lids &#8212; a freezable cold lid, a sealed hot lid, and a drink-through lid. It's a sleek-looking mug, and the Snow Peak brand is a favorite among outdoors people. But the drink-through lid wasn't leak-proof, and at $80 for the whole kit, it just didn't follow through on performance.</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07W3PSTDW/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07W3PSTDW&#38;linkId=7da4c606d899ed68b4f038fd45db4463\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Otterbox Elevation Tumbler</a>: </strong>A tumbler isn't quite a travel mug. It's more of a cup with a lid, but Otterbox has a good reputation, so we decided to give it a shot. It performed poorly in the heat test, but it surprised us by posting a mid-range score in the cold test. If you're an iced coffee lover, you might not want to discount this one. But be aware, it's not leak-proof. <strong>Editor's note:&#160;</strong>During our first round of testing, we didn't try the <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/sid/biipgf_051517_best-travel-mugs/https://www.otterbox.com/en-us/elevation/thermal-lid/otr57-tumbler-acc-thermos.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Thermal Lid</a> (shown above), an optional lid that turns the Elevation Tumbler into a proper travel mug. It's a pricey accessory, but we are putting it to the test to see if it's worth considering.</li></ul>\n\tOur temperature retention test results\n\t\n\t<div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe title=\"Heat retention test on travel mugs\" aria-label=\"Split Bars\" id=\"datawrapper-chart-avi5H\" src=\"https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/avi5H/2/\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" style=\"width: 0; min-width: 100% ; border: none;\" height=\"605\"></iframe><script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(){\"use strict\";window.addEventListener(\"message\",(function(a){if(void 0!==a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"])for(var e in a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"]){var t=document.getElementById(\"datawrapper-chart-\"+e)||document.querySelector(\"iframe[src*='\"+e+\"']\");t&&(t.style.height=a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"][e]+\"px\")}}))}();\n</script></div><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe title=\"Cold retention test on travel mugs\" aria-label=\"Bar Chart\" id=\"datawrapper-chart-dkFcZ\" src=\"https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/dkFcZ/2/\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" style=\"width: 0; min-width: 100% ; border: none;\" height=\"571\"></iframe><script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(){\"use strict\";window.addEventListener(\"message\",(function(a){if(void 0!==a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"])for(var e in a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"]){var t=document.getElementById(\"datawrapper-chart-\"+e)||document.querySelector(\"iframe[src*='\"+e+\"']\");t&&(t.style.height=a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"][e]+\"px\")}}))}();\n</script></div><p>Alyssa Powell/Business Insider</p>\n\tOur testing methodology\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9790d2f21803001222c1f2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"travel mug heat test methodology\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Les Shu/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>In order to test travel mugs, we established several criteria we hoped each of our top picks would meet. Our three testers analyzed general ease of use, how they felt to drink from, and how easy they were to clean. We also tested for more technical aspects of each mug like temperature retention and how leak-proof each mug was. Our initial testing period lasted one month, but we are still testing long-term durability in case issues arise. Below are each of our tests.</p><p><strong>Temperature retention</strong>: To test heat retention, we filled each mug with water heated to 136 degrees Fahrenheit, the optimal temperature for hot beverages <a href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0305417907002550?via%3Dihub#!\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">according to a study</a> by the University of Texas. We then tested the temperature hourly and noted change. Once the temperature dropped 25 degrees, we deemed the beverage too cold to drink and ended the test. To test cold retention, we filled each mug with 45-degree water straight from the refrigerator. We added three ice cubes and timed how long the ice remained frozen.</p><p><strong>Leak test: </strong>We filled each travel mug with water and turned it upside down and shook it for a total of 30 seconds. We performed this test once at the beginning of our testing period and again at the end to ensure each mug stayed leak-proof even after repeated use.</p><p><strong>Ease of use and cleaning</strong>: We wanted to test how easy each mug was to drink from while on the go. We noted how easy each mug was to operate with one hand. We also noted how well the liquid flowed out of each and whether or not they fit in standard car cupholders. We took into account how easy each mug was to clean. Many of these mugs have complex lids that can harbor mold if not properly sanitized. If lids were too complicated, difficult to disassemble or reassemble, or began to show signs of mold even after what we thought was a thorough cleaning, the mug lost major points.</p><p><strong>Long-term testing</strong>: Though our initial testing period lasted roughly five months, we acknowledge that other issues could crop up with long-term use. We are continuing to test each of our top picks and we will update this guide with any issues we encounter.</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a fAk3tCtE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn64@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-31-655_a3959d482b0dadcb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/RMsEHcP2zkY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn5@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-21-913_62d5fba89a883a55.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712043},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"The best free at-home workouts, like Nike Training Club and FightCamp","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-free-virtual-workouts","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Staying or getting fit at-home doesn't mean you have to shell out for expensive subscription fees (or equipment) to stream on-demand workouts and fitness classes.&#160;</li><li>There are plenty of free, at-home, virtual workouts for every fitness ability, mobility level, and time constraints.&#160;&#160;</li><li>Our top pick, the <strong><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=16331&awinaffid=257137&clickref=biipgf_033120_best-free-workouts&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nike.com%2Fntc-appom%2Fntc-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Nike Training App</a>, offers the highest quality routines with the most variety of intensity levels, time requirements, and workout types, as well as the most motivational trainers.</strong></li><li><strong>Also check out <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/best-workout-apps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best workout apps that are worth paying for</a> and <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/best-at-home-workout-programs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best at-home workout programs that deliver gym-level results</a>.</strong></li></ul><p>With COVID-19 cases on the rise and temperatures outside dropping quickly, most of us are <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/best-face-masks-for-running\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ditching public gyms</a> and outdoor workouts and turning to <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/work-from-home-workout\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">at-home fitness options</a>. Luckily, we live in an era of primo digital fitness content. Many are as good as having a real-life personal trainer motivating you at your local gym.</p><p>You've probably seen friends or fitness bloggers who swear by the six- to 12-week programs they purchased and sweated to in their living room, week after week. And some pay-for programs are <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/best-at-home-workout-programs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">definitely worth the results</a>.</p><p>But in actuality, there's a huge database of high-quality, motivating fitness routines you can access for free.&#160;What's more, many long-established programs, like <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=16331&awinaffid=257137&clickref=biipgf_033120_best-free-workouts&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nike.com%2Fntc-appom%2Fntc-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nike Training Club (NTC)</a>, lifted their membership fee at the start of the pandemic to make it easier for people to de-stress and stay fit, and a few (NTC included) haven't reinstated it.</p><p>These free at-home virtual workouts not only reprieve you from having to figure out how to see results with just your bodyweight or <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-dumbbells\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a single set of dumbbells</a>, but they also offer engaging coaches to keep you going until the clock runs out when it'd be just as easy to press pause and sit on the couch.</p><p>Here, we've not only rounded up great at-home workouts that will cost you nothing, but we also put in the time to test the best currently available. From fully featured workout apps via recognizable names like Nike to more beginner-friendly programs from the YMCA, we tried it all. Below, you'll find our favorite free at-home virtual workouts that let you break a sweat at no charge.&#160;</p><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><h2>Here are the best free at-home virtual workouts:</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best overall: <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=16331&awinaffid=257137&clickref=biipgf_033120_best-free-workouts&p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nike.com%2Fntc-appom%2Fntc-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Nike Training Club App</a> </strong></li><li><strong>Best for yoga: <a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/5-minute-yoga-workouts/id362093404\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">5 Minute Yoga</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best for older adults: <a href=\"https://ymca360.org/on-demand#/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">YMCA 360</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best for beginners: <a href=\"https://my.lifetime.life/lp/video-workouts.html?icmp=od-video&section=healthylthy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Life Time Athletic</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best for boxing: <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&u=1088116&m=80882&afftrack=biipgf_033120_best-free-workouts&urllink=joinfightcamp.com%2Ffightcamp.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">FightCamp</a></strong></li></ul><p><em>Updated on 12/10/2020 by Rachael Schultz: Updated intro, updated choice for best yoga app, changed photos, checked and updated the links where necessary, and updated the formatting throughout.</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best free virtual workout overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc96918b6a3a800199b67fc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Traci_Copeland_NTC_App_Workout_3_hd_1600\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://s3.amazonaws.com/nikeinc/assets/27104/Traci_Copeland_NTC_App_Workout_3_hd_1600.jpg?1391032742\" target=\"_blank\">Nike</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Previously $15 per month, the <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=16331&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=biipgf_033120_best-free-workouts&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nike.com%2Fntc-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Nike Training Club app</a> is now free, offering high-quality streaming strength, cardio, core, upper body, lower body, and full-body workouts.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Offers tons of workout variety, all taught by expert Nike trainers</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Some workouts are full videos versus others which are just videos of specific individual exercises with a set and rep scheme&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=16331&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=biipgf_033120_best-free-workouts&#38;p=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nike.com%2Fntc-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Nike Training Club</a> has over 185 workouts, including strength training, core workouts, machine-free cardio sessions, upper and lower body-focused routines, and yoga routines. Each workout ranges from 15 to 60 minutes, so the commitment adapts to your day. Plus, the brief tells you what equipment you'll need &#8212; many programs are bodyweight, and many with weights offer modifications if you don't have any &#8212; so you know exactly what you're getting.</p><p>I'm used to varying my workouts daily &#8212; I usually do cardio each morning, either running, a group fitness class, or yoga, followed by a strength training class or body part-specific workout in the afternoon. I'm used to being able to do different workouts each day, and with this app, I was able to keep up the variety in my routine without it ever feeling repetitive.&#160;</p><p>Nike Training Club allows you to take individual classes or pick from a multi-week program, all of which are taught and programmed by elite Nike trainers. These trainers are really what make the difference &#8212; they have a unique ability to keep you engaged and motivated even through a screen, which is a hard feat for virtual workouts. The app also offers nutrition, sleep, mindset, and recovery tips from trainers and other experts, as well.</p>\n\tThe best free yoga workout\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc96c0d037cbd0018613bee?format=jpeg\" alt=\"yoga teacher computer\" height=\"2680\" width=\"3573\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">insta_photos/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>It's incredibly hard to find a free yoga app, but <a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/5-minute-yoga-workouts/id362093404\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">5 Minute Yoga</a>&#160;offers a quick daily practice to help you find some zen while working out at home.</h3><p><strong style=\"color: #222222; font-size: 15px;\">Pros:</strong> Yoga workouts are changed on a daily basis, low time commitment</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Practices are always limited to five minutes</p><p>If you're looking to start doing yoga regularly, <a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/5-minute-yoga-workouts/id362093404\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">5 Minute Yoga</a> asks very little of your time, making it far harder to justify skipping a day. Every day it offers a new sequence, delivered via illustrated asana by asana alongside an on-screen timer counting down how long to hold each pose for (one minute each). After five poses (and five minutes), your daily practice is finished.</p><p>For a fee, you can unlock more content and longer routines. But it's near impossible to find any yoga app for free (or rather, one that doesn't require you to start paying after a short trial period), so we'll take what we can get. What's more, if you're totally new to yoga and need help establishing a daily habit, five minutes is long enough to help you de-stress and be introduced to the practice in digestible chunks. <em>--Rachael Schultz</em></p>\n\tThe best free workout for older adults\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc968e0b6a3a800199b67fa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"y360_cardio\" height=\"679\" width=\"905\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">ymca 360</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Stay moving and get familiar with a new routine using the <a href=\"https://ymca360.org/on-demand#/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">YMCA 360</a> health and fitness on-demand videos.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Short and long workout options across several exercise types, keeps time and rep counts for you</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Limited number of total workouts, doesn't offer much variety in fitness level&#160;</p><p>If you're older and looking to stay healthy, YMCA 360 offers a section of videos specifically for the active, older user. This includes classes like Bootcamp, barre, yoga, weightlifting, Tai Chi, and Y Box.</p><p>For the younger crowd, there's even a youth soccer section with drills and a youth sports performance section with exercises to help develop skills &#8212; and to keep kids entertained while spending more time inside.&#160;</p><p>I liked that there was a wide variety of workouts to choose from, especially exercise skills for youth sports, though I mostly stuck with the Bootcamp-specific workouts. These workouts moved at a steady pace and offered exercise modifications to make moves easier to manage. I personally like a bit more speed and energy in my workouts, but these get the job done.</p><p>For anyone who likes familiarity with their workouts, and wants to know exactly what they're getting into, YMCA's videos are perfect. Because there's a limited number, you'll be able to try them all and easily identify your favorites to repeat.&#160;</p>\n\tThe best free workout for beginnners\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e838cd10c2a622b7b182e48?format=jpeg\" alt=\"on demand overview xl\" height=\"960\" width=\"1280\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Life Time Athletic</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Members and non-members alike have access to a limited number of cardio, strength, and yoga classes from <a href=\"https://my.lifetime.life/lp/video-workouts.html?icmp=od-video&#38;section=healthy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Life Time Athletic</a>.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Strength, cardio, and yoga offerings, great for users at a beginner or intermediate level&#160;</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Limited variety in fitness level, limited number of workouts, no new workouts added</p><p>From the fitness center giant comes <a href=\"https://my.lifetime.life/lp/video-workouts.html?icmp=od-video&#38;section=healthy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Life Time Athletic</a>, an app that allows users to choose workouts based on a few different categories: the muscle groups they want to work, the equipment they have at home, or the type of workout they want to do (cardio, strength, yoga, etc). Each video states the length and optional equipment needed upfront, so you're never caught off-guard.&#160;</p><p>For light cardio classes, the Life Time Athletic courses are perfect. While I would classify some of the exercises as beginner level, they still kept me moving and elevated my heart rate, which is what I was looking to do.</p><p>If you're a Life Time member, you'll be familiar with some of the specific classes like Strike, Warrior Sculpt, and Shred. The workouts are good for any beginner or intermediate users who want to keep moving at home and prefer limited video options to choose from.</p>\n\tThe best free workout for boxing\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dfa3e2c71a5ca7b72555667?format=jpeg\" alt=\"fight camp\" height=\"810\" width=\"1080\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Fight Camp</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Keep your punches in check while getting in a full-body cardiovascular workout when you download <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=80882&#38;afftrack=biipgf_033120_best-free-workouts&#38;urllink=joinfightcamp.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">FightCamp</a>.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Boxing workouts for people of all fitness levels, delivers a full-body workout, more than 350 workout routines</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Programming is mostly boxing-specific, the full FightCamp setup is required for the interactive experience which requires money and space</p><p>While FightCamp does <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fightcamp-at-home-boxing-system-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">offer the option to purchase</a>&#160;a bag, gloves, and sensors to track your punches and progress, the brand also offers its actual workout videos <a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/fightcamp-boxing-workouts/id1328562100\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">via its app for free</a>. This means that anyone who has a bag and gloves of their own, or who wants to shadowbox, can follow the free workouts. You can also let the app know your boxing experience and fitness level and have workouts suggested accordingly.</p><p>My New York City apartment is too small for a boxing bag, so I chose to shadowbox during the workouts. Surprisingly to me, I found them to be great cardio. Non-boxers may find it odd to wail away at the air, but the intensity of the workout keeps you moving from start to finish and breaks a good sweat in just 20 minutes.&#160;</p><p>If you love boxing or <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/rumble-boxing-class-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">boxing-inspired workouts</a>, consider downloading this app. There are more than 350 boxing and bodyweight workouts, so you'll never be lacking in variety.</p>\n\tWhat else we considered\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc96b95b6a3a800199b6809?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 1187354786\" height=\"1413\" width=\"1884\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Yoga is a safe, low impact workout for people with asthma.\n<p class=\"copyright\">PeopleImages/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>While testing free workout apps, we came across several other services offering workouts at no cost through Instagram or Facebook Live streams or extended free trials. Here are a few of our favorites that stood out, but ultimately didn't make the cut:</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.corepoweryoga.com/yoga-on-demand\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">CorePower Yoga</a>: </strong>The yoga franchise maintains their class approach through their app, offering everything from foundation-building, beginner-friendly courses to more challenging asanas to routines that focus more on a fitness flow, making this a great option if you want to grow or diversify your yoga practice. This was our top choice for a yoga app when they lifted their paywall at the beginning of the pandemic, but classes are back to being free for just the first seven days for new subscribers, and then require a monthly fee.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.boxandflow.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Box + Flow</a>: </strong>Led by fitness expert, Olivia Young, Box + Flow takes the popular boxing class formula and adds the mindfulness of yoga for a well-rounded, yet intense, workout. The NYC-based brand hosts daily streams of its workouts via Instagram Live, with Young herself leading a few of the workouts. Classes are free for the first seven days for new subscribers and then require a monthly fee.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://campgladiator.com/blog/2020/03/hustle\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Camp Gladiator</a>: </strong>Participate in live streaming workouts through Camp Gladiators Facebook Live channel, or try its at-home printable routines. These are free always but the site doesn't offer a library of on-demand workouts.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/peloton-digital-membership-round-up\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Peloton</a>: </strong>Peloton now offers a free trial of its Peloton Digital Membership for 30 days. The app features thousands of on-demand workouts including running, strength, yoga, and cycling &#8212; and you don't even need a bike to access them.&#160;</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.toneitup.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tone It Up</a>: </strong>Strengthen, tone, or get in some cardio with founders Karena and Katrina, as well as the app's community of trainers. Choose individual workouts or do a program to follow. It was free in the spring of 2020, but has since reverted back to a free seven-day trial for new subscribers and then a monthly fee.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://theclass.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Class by Taryn Toomey</a>: </strong>Exercise your body and engage your mind with this untraditional form of training. The workouts on The Class help you to release stress and anything weighing you down through repetitive movements accompanied by loud exhales. It's a transformative experience that everyone should try. The app currently offers a free two-week trial.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://fitbodyapp.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">FitBody</a>: </strong>We love the shred, tone, and sculpting programs created by trainer and social media personality Anna Victoria, but it only offers a seven-day free trial for new subscribers, and then a monthly fee.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.fitnessondemand247.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Snap Fitness</a>: </strong>Snap Fitness currently offers free 90-day access to FitnessOnDemand.com, where you can stream workouts from Sweat Factor by Mike Donvanik, Nora Tobin, SH1FT, and DailyBurn.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/obe-fitness-class-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ob&#233; Fitness</a></strong>: Join a live workout from a daily schedule of 14 classes, or choose from its library of over 4,000 on-demand workouts including strength, Pilates, dance, HIIT, cardio boxing, and more. It only offers a seven-day free trial for new subscribers, and then a monthly fee.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.jazzercise.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Jazzercise on Demand</a>:</strong> Jazz up your usual routine with a little dance party. These workouts combine jazz dance, yoga, Pilates, kickboxing, and HIIT. New users can sign up for a free two-week trial.&#160;</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hydrow-rowing-machine-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hydrow</a>:</strong> Join this brand's free at-home 14-day challenge, which has a mix of 20- to 30-minute rowing (if you have a machine) and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-yoga-mat\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">mat routines</a>&#160;that include yoga, Pilates, and more.&#160;</p>\n\tHow we tested the apps\n\t\n\t<p>Each of these apps was tested not just for their respective use case but also across a variety of categories, including <strong>ease of use, variety, effectiveness</strong>, and&#160;<strong>entertainment value</strong>. Since each app is entirely free, it was important to create a benchmark for how well they perform and to associate a different kind of value to them without factoring in price. Here's what we looked for in each category:</p><ul><li><strong>Ease of use:&#160;</strong>An intuitive app experience is vital to not only enjoy using it but also to get the most out of it. If an app is cumbersome in its navigation, or makes finding and choosing workouts difficult, then it won't promote much in the way of motivation or desire to work out.&#160;</li><li><strong>Variety:&#160;</strong>Though we broke down the guide into specific sections on activities like yoga or boxing, we wanted to see that the apps that fell into the other categories were diverse enough in what they offered to keep the experience fresh and engaging. This means offering more than just one or two workout styles, as well as making available a library of classes.</li><li><strong>Effectiveness:&#160;</strong>This category doesn't necessarily mean results from a fitness standpoint. Though that is important, there's not a way to judge that reliably or to stand behind one person's interpretation of it, so this instead means how well it's able to motivate you to workout, if it's able to push you through to the end of a session, and if it offers enough variety to allow you the chance to learn new exercises.&#160;&#160;</li><li><strong>Entertainment value:&#160;</strong>If you enjoy working out, you'll do it more often &#8212; plain and simple. Even free apps can offer some form of entertainment which can serve as a huge reason to revisit it (and workout) often.&#160;&#160;</li></ul>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original
