rx11/cdn70@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-33-822_211221fcb0bf008a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712078},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"Back when travel was a thing, we tested about half of Lo & Sons' travel bags - if you're looking for a gift or a bag to use when it's safe to adventure again, here's what to buy","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-lo-and-sons-bags","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"http://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd259ce30f2740018b0f1b6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lo &#38; Sons\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lo &#38; Sons</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"http://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Lo &#38; Sons bags</a> are made of high-quality materials and feature thoughtfully placed pockets and compartments.</li><li><strong>Lo &#38; Sons currently has more than 15 travel-bag styles, including the roomy <a href=\"http://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fproducts%2Fcatalina-deluxe-washed-canvas-midnight-ash&sid=biip_041019_lo-and-sons-travel-bags-team-reviewview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Catalina Deluxe Large Weekender Travel Bag</a> (from $86) and the sleek <a href=\"http://www.gopjn.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fproducts%2Fclaremont-full-grain-leather-sienna%3Futm_source%3Dpepperjam%26utm_campaign%3D133628%26utm_medium%3Daffiliate%26clickId%3D2658334218&sid=biip_041019_lo-and-sons-travel-bags-team-reviewview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Claremont Leather Camera Bag</a> ($368).</strong></li><li><strong>The Insider Reviews team has reviewed eight different Lo &#38; Sons bags so far and found that their ergonomic, versatile designs are game-changing and worth the sometimes hefty price tags.</strong></li></ul><p>For those of you who aren't familiar with the company, Lo &#38; Sons makes stylish, travel-friendly bags that are optimized for space and function.</p><p>Founder and CEO Helen Lo originally launched Lo &#38; Sons with the mission of creating a travel bag that alleviated the back pain she developed in her mid-60s. This sparked the idea that birthed <a href=\"https://www.pjtra.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fpages%2Fdiscover-og2-womens-travel-laptop-bag\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">the O.G. overnight bag</a>, a smartly designed shoulder bag with a suitcase-handle sleeve for easy transportation.</p><p>From there, Lo &#38; Sons' success drove the team to develop over 15 other styles, including overnight bags, laptop bags, camera bags, clutches, backpacks, and more - for both men and women. Lo &#38; Sons prides itself on only using high-quality materials to make its bags, careful placement of pockets and compartments, and travel-friendly details, like the aforementioned suitcase-handle sleeve, so you spend less time fumbling with your belongings and more time exploring.</p><p>At first glance, some of the bags seem a bit pricey, but consider what you're getting for the money: Many of the bags convert to multiple styles (<a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fpages%2Fedgemont-mens-travel-laptop-backpack\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">the $128 Edgemont</a> goes from backpack to tote in just a few steps) and all of the bags feature thoughtfully designed pockets and compartments, for everything from your shoes to your laptop depending on their size. There's none of that, \"What am I supposed to do with this?\" business. It's obvious how much designing and testing Lo &#38; Sons has done before launching each travel bag.</p><p>The Insider Reviews team put eight different bags to the test (back when it was safe to do so), traversing New York City and even traveling across the country and overseas. Our travels and daily commutes were much improved as a result. Whether you're preparing for a future when travel is finally safe again, or you're looking for something that can take you on a safe weekend trip in driving distance, we can help you choose which bag to buy.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tEdgemont Convertible Backpack Tote\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cae0f1f85c4b7171b29a8d2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"edgemont desktop adaptable women 01_530abd60 6ff3 44eb a171 2d5671a69493\" height=\"1010\" width=\"1346\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lo &#38; Sons</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fpages%2Fedgemont-mens-travel-laptop-backpack\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Edgemont Convertible Backpack Tote, $128</a></h3><p>With its structured form, multiple well-designed compartments, and ability to convert between two different styles in just a few steps, this backpack tote boasts value that far outweighs its $128 price tag. In safer times, I used it as a work-to-gym bag, and it fit all the essentials for both purposes, but still managed to feel fairly light and very comfortable on my back or shoulder.</p><p>Its stash pockets, perfectly placed under the arm, make it easy to access IDs, keys, and MetroCards, and are one of my favorite features of the bag. I also love that the material is eco-friendly and water-resistant, and specifically the Navy Camo pattern is subtle but stylish. &#8212; <strong>Connie Chen, Insider Reviews senior reporter</strong></p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lo-and-sons-convertible-backpack-tote-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full review of the Edgemont here</a>.</strong></p>\n\tThe O.G. Overnight Bag\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd258447b7e050019107353?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lo &#38; Sons OG bag 2\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lo &#38; Sons</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fpages%2Fdiscover-og2-womens-travel-laptop-bag\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">The O.G. 2 Overnight Bag, from $113</a></h3><p><em>Editor's note: Our review was of the original O.G. Overnight Bag, you can now purchase the redesigned O.G. 2, which features similar specs.</em></p><p>The O.G. Overnight Bag quickly became my go-to personal item on flights back when it was safe to travel. Its suitcase-handle sleeve is a game-changer; I could rest assured that when I placed my personal item atop my carry-on it wouldn't fall off. Inside the bag are some even cooler features, like a padded laptop sleeve, a separate shoe compartment, and tons of pockets for organizing everything from my pens to my earbuds. The O.G. also comes with a messenger strap for easy and comfortable carrying across your body or over your shoulder, and it's made of durable and water-resistant nylon, so there's no need to worry about it being ruined by coffee spills or bad weather. <strong>&#8212; Ellen Hoffman, Insider Reviews executive editor</strong></p><p>With all of all the smart features, I've found I'm able to fit just about everything I need for a weekend away in this one bag, unless it's winter (because sweaters and coats are just too bulky). Even though the bag is so structured, it's really lightweight, making it really easy to carry, even when loaded with clothing and toiletries. While pricey, I think it's worth the $295 investment. <strong>&#8212; Remi Rosmarin, former Insider Reviews reporter</strong></p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lo-and-sons-og-overnight-bag-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full review of The O.G. here</a>.</strong></p>\n\tCatalina Deluxe Large Weekender Travel Bag\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cae0b2919ed2901e068285c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2019 04 10 at 11.26.14 AM\" height=\"673\" width=\"897\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lo &#38; Sons</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fproducts%2Fcatalina-deluxe-washed-canvas-midnight-ash&#38;sid=biip_041019_lo-and-sons-travel-bags-team-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Catalina Deluxe Weekender Large Travel Bag, from $86</a></h3><p>I took the <a href=\"http://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fproducts%2Fcatalina-deluxe-washed-canvas-midnight-ash&#38;sid=biip_041019_lo-and-sons-travel-bags-team-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Catalina Deluxe Weekender Large Travel Bag</a> on a couple of short road trips a while ago. Packing a bag is easier than lugging a suitcase around, but I usually travel with the weekender version of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/BAGGU-Reusable-Shopping-Foldable-Ripstop/dp/B07H536CD3/ref=sr_1_5?crid=2JU70Q9N0V389&#38;keywords=baggu+sailor+stripe&#38;qid=1554827072&#38;s=gateway&#38;sprefix=baggu+sailor+s%2Caps%2C136&#38;sr=8-5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">this blue and white striped nylon Baggu tote</a>. It's weightless and holds a lot, but it lacks structure and organization.</p><p>By comparison, <a href=\"http://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fproducts%2Fcatalina-deluxe-washed-canvas-midnight-ash&#38;sid=biip_041019_lo-and-sons-travel-bags-team-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Lo &#38; Son's weekender</a> is made out of thick canvas &#8212; it's heavy duty, but can be folded when not in use. I have yet to max out the large bag on a weekend trip, even with packing sweaters and bulkier items. If I were traveling to a warm-weather destination, the bag could easily fit a week's worth of clothes. The bottom compartment comes in handy for separating out shoes and heavier pieces of clothing, but I did find the zipper hard to maneuver when the bag was empty, since the weight of the canvas bag weighs it down. Overall, this is a well-made travel bag and one that I will definitely continue to use. <strong>&#8212; Lauren Lyons Cole, former director of personal finance&#160;</strong></p>\n\tWaverley 2 Convertible Leather Crossbody\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cae0e0c505bd9155660e7f5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"waverley materials 3 md2x\" height=\"1280\" width=\"1707\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lo &#38; Sons</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.pjatr.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fproducts%2Fwaverley-2-nappa-leather-black-gunmetal-grey\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Waverley 2 Crossbody, from $84</a></h3><p>Small but functional, this bag is perfect for taking on the go while running errands, exploring new cities, or toting around during the day. It's big enough to fit a phone, wallet, and other small essentials, plus the interior has three small card pockets that can help save some space if your wallet takes up too much room.</p><p>The best part of this bag, though, is the exterior &#8212; it can be worn four different ways! Adjust the straps to wear it as a crossbody, a belt bag, a shoulder bag, or a wristlet. I've worn this bag on days when I'm just walking around the city. The size is small enough to bear holding for long walks, but big enough to hold all the essentials for a casual weekend day. The light grey color is unlike any bag I've owned before, but it has a minimalist chic look that I'm excited to incorporate more for spring. <strong>&#8212; Remi Rosmarin, former Insider Reviews reporter</strong></p>\n\tClaremont Leather Camera Bag\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cd9b5a5021b4c2b36325fd5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Slider 2_Claremont_interior padding_750x\" height=\"562\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lo &#38; Sons</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://www.gopjn.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fproducts%2Fclaremont-full-grain-leather-sienna%3Futm_source%3Dpepperjam%26utm_campaign%3D133628%26utm_medium%3Daffiliate%26clickId%3D2658334218&#38;sid=biip_041019_lo-and-sons-travel-bags-team-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Claremont Leather Camera Bag, $368</a></h3><p>I've had a DSLR camera for six years. During that time, I've probably taken it on vacation with me once or twice &#8212; and at least one of those times, it didn't make it out of my suitcase. The problem is that it's clunky, no lightweight or attractive travel purse fits it, and wearing it around my neck is not appealing. It also becomes a risk in museums, when I worry every time I lean over if it will swing it into a neoclassical treasure like a cannonball.</p><p><a href=\"http://www.gopjn.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fproducts%2Fclaremont-full-grain-leather-sienna%3Futm_source%3Dpepperjam%26utm_campaign%3D133628%26utm_medium%3Daffiliate%26clickId%3D2658334218&#38;sid=biip_041019_lo-and-sons-travel-bags-team-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Lo &#38; Son's Claremont camera bag</a> is a game-changer. It's attractive, lightweight, and built specifically to house and protect my DSLR as well as the other tourist essentials, like my passport and money in the easily accessed back pocket. Its organization is helpful but not overwhelming &#8212; meaning that I can convert it to a crossbody bag, or make full use of the SD memory card pockets and the soft and protective divider. <strong>&#8212; Mara Leighton, Insider Reviews senior reporter</strong></p>\n\tHanover Deluxe Backpack\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd258af30f2740018b0f1ac?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lo &#38; Sons The Hanover Deluxe 2\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lo &#38; Sons</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong><a href=\"https://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fpages%2Fdiscover-hanover-deluxe-2-laptop-backpack\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Hanover Deluxe 2 backpack, $100</a></strong></h3><p><em>Editor's note: Our review was of the original Hanover Deluxe backpack, you can now purchase the redesigned Hanover Deluxe 2, which features similar specs.</em></p><p>I was honestly shocked how much I was able to fit inside this backpack. There two side pockets and one exterior pocket, plus the main compartment has a removable insert designed to organize all your stuff. I was able to fit well over 20 items, including multiple outfits, a pair of shoes, laptop, Kindle, and random electronics and toiletries, with ease. On top of that, the memory-foam shoulder straps are very comfortable, so much so that I almost forgot I was carrying 15-20 pounds on my back. I'm not sure I'll ever use another travel backpack if I'm being honest. <strong>&#8212; Francesca Rea, Insider Reviews senior story producer</strong></p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lo-and-sons-hanover-deluxe-backpack-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full review of the Hanover Deluxe here</a>.</strong></p>\n\tRowledge Convertible Nylon Backpack Tote\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cd9b2dc021b4c26d818b689?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Slider 2_Rowledge_Suitcase Handle Sleeve_750x\" height=\"562\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lo &#38; Sons</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fproducts%2Frowledge-nylon-black-gold-grey\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Rowledge Convertible Nylon Backpack Tote, from $170</a></h3><p>The newest Lo &#38; Sons bag, <a href=\"http://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fproducts%2Frowledge-nylon-black-gold-grey\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">the Rowledge</a>, marries style and function for one of the company's most-wanted bags to date (there's currently a wait list for it). It does have a hefty price tag, but it has a lot going for it to justify the cost: It converts three ways so it can serve you whether you're in work mode, travel mode, or weekend mode. It has a laptop sleeve, key leash, and many other useful compartments, like exterior side pockets that can be unzipped to store your water bottle, or zipped up for a sleek, virtually invisible, look. I used it to commute to work so that I could ditch my gym bag, back when that was a thing. &#8212;<strong> Francesca Rea, Insider Reviews senior story producer</strong></p>\n\tPearl Crossbody Bag and Clutch\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cd9b5e1021b4c2e32319b75?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Slider 1_Pearl_wristlet_750x\" height=\"562\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lo &#38; Sons</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGR0dLRUJGSEhLR01CRk1OTklL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loandsons.com%2Fproducts%2Fpearl-saffiano-leather-black-gold-grey&#38;sid=biip_041019_lo-and-sons-travel-bags-team-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">The Pearl Crossbody Bag and Clutch, from $119</a></h3><p>This leather crossbody looks small but holds everything I need to go out during the day. The main compartment located in the middle of the bag is perfect for items I need to access quickly, like my phone and wallet, and the smaller zip pockets on the outside are optimal places for loose cash. It also includes this neat little leash that I could hook onto my keys. I hate digging for my house key in the bottom of my purse (especially when it's raining outside), so this was perfect! The leather feels high-quality; although I've only used the bag a few times so far, I can tell it's going hold up well and not going to scratch easily.\" <strong>&#8212; Megan Foster, former Insider Reviews intern</strong></p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/best-lo-and-sons-bags'>Business Insider</a></div><div (Francesca Rea)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd259ce30f2740018b0f1b6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-12-319_cee8193617de7df7.webp","https://i.insider.com/5cae0f1f85c4b7171b29a8d2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn24@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-24-197_15ea84f59645ccda.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fd258447b7e050019107353?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn38@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-35-789_77331779e12ae75c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5cae0b2919ed2901e068285c?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5cae0e0c505bd9155660e7f5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn63@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-21-699_b9e9d83e8dfdcf45.webp","https://i.insider.com/5cd9b5a5021b4c2b36325fd5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn46@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-27-136_44c80110969bd7ab.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fd258af30f2740018b0f1ac?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn76@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-23-229_f0bec77ded9733d4.webp","https://i.insider.com/5cd9b2dc021b4c26d818b689?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn21@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-27-651_7540f9a0c1119e8c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5cd9b5e1021b4c2e32319b75?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn24@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-21-521_9c756f998c4050ca.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=WQ-ZRgugTZ4:KwC_dP3wptk:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn17@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-26-920_fa12af559ad34b61.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=WQ-ZRgugTZ4:KwC_dP3wptk:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn100@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-33-394_1b76a489b8cedbda.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=WQ-ZRgugTZ4:KwC_dP3wptk:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn9@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-22-853_2ab2786a3014a652.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/WQ-ZRgugTZ4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn35@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-22-107_c73e9beac15e5fe9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712050},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"How the Swiss Army knife factory makes 45,000 pocket knives per day","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/swiss-army-knife-factory-victorinox-pocket-knives-manufacturer-2019-9","description":"<div style=\"position:relative; overflow:hidden; padding-bottom:56.25%\">\n<iframe src=\"https://cdn.jwplayer.com/players/ScVmsYJz-jZbcmOYf.html\"\nwidth=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" title=\"How the Swiss Army knife factory makes 45,000 pocket knives per day\"\nstyle=\"position:absolute;\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n</div><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><strong>Victorinox is Europe's largest knife manufacturer, best known for its iconic Swiss Army knives that have been around for nearly 130 years. </strong></li>\n<li><strong>The iconic red pocket knife design was originally created by Karl Elsener in 1891.&#160;</strong></li>\n<li><strong>The Victorinox factory in Ibach, Switzerland produces over 45,000 pocket knives each day and exports them to over 120 countries.&#160;</strong></li>\n<li><strong>We visited the flagship store in Geneva, Switzerland to look at some of the company's 400 different knife models.&#160;</strong></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.</a>&#160;</li>\n</ul><p>You've probably used one, or know of the iconic shape. After all, 10 million of these pocket knives are produced annually. But how does one factory produce 45,000 each day, and in such a precise manner?</p><p>The Swiss Army knives has been around for nearly 130 years. It was originally delivered to the Swiss Army by Karl Elsener in 1891. The knives are now produced by Victorinox, Europe's largest knife manufacturer. The company was founded in 1884.&#160;</p><p>The main factory in Ibach, Switzerland, produces a variety of knives, designed to offer versatility and compactness. Here, it takes around 5minutes to produce a pocket knife depending on the model. There are 400 different models.</p><p>The basis of the knife is 85% iron, along with 13% chromium and a small trace of other metals.</p><p>2,400 metric tonnes of steel are imported to the factory each year. From these rolls, knife blades are stamped to 2 millimeters thick. This requires 50 metric tonnes of pressure. Each roll can make 16,000 blades.</p><p>Various tools require various alloys for hardness. Blades are made from hard steel, whereas screwdrivers are formed from softer steel. The blades are rounded off using triangular-shaped plastic wheels and water.</p><p>The knife blades are then extracted via a magnet and grinded down again to achieve an exact width. They are imprinted with a company stamp, then placed in an oven at 1,050 degrees Celsius.&#160;</p><p>The signature red outer casing is formed via injection molding. Other tools for the knives are produced on nearby machines via a process of milling and grinding.</p><p>The classic officer's knife is assembled by machine at the factory. Other editions are assembled by hand.&#160;</p><p>The blades are smoothed and given a final inspection. A small metal cross emblem - the Victorinox Cross &#38; Shield - is inspected via a microscope to ensure standard thickness. This was added the first time in 1909 and later to all Victorinox knives since 2006.</p><p>The knives are exported from the Ibach factory to over 120 countries.&#160;</p><p><em>Special thanks to the <a href=\"https://www.geneve.com/\">Geneva Tourist Board</a> and <a href=\"https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-gb/\">My Switzerland</a>.</em></p><p><em>EDITOR'S NOTE: This video was originally published in September 2019.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/swiss-army-knife-factory-victorinox-pocket-knives-manufacturer-2019-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=HsgJXF8idRU:gBpoYey_-ic:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=HsgJXF8idRU:gBpoYey_-ic:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HsgJXF8idRU:gBpoYey_-ic:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=HsgJXF8idRU:gBpoYey_-ic:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/HsgJXF8idRU\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Dec 2020 21:24:36 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5d5ffb002e22af5f2b558862?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"26c192be586fc1ae9a337e8b282cd333","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn62@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-20-686_b0fd2b990c4f278e.webp","destWidth":1440,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":88612,"destBytes":88612,"author":"insider@insider.com (Ju Shardlow,Charlie Floyd)","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HsgJXF8idRU:gBpoYey_-ic:F7zBnMyn0Lo":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HsgJXF8idRU:gBpoYey_-ic:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn44@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-26-404_c2c151cec096d63e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HsgJXF8idRU:gBpoYey_-ic:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn21@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-34-380_1ff19cfb6abb82c3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/HsgJXF8idRU":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712056},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"A lawyer who pushed a 'birther' conspiracy about Kamala Harris has joined Trump's election fight","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/lawyer-who-pushed-birther-theory-on-kamala-harris-represents-trump-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd277a27b7e050019107408?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages  john eastman\" height=\"1312\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>John Eastman, Director of the Center for Constitutional Jurisprudence at Chapman University in Orange, California.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lyn Alweis/The Denver Post via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A lawyer who pushed a \"birther\" conspiracy theory about Vice President-elect Kamala Harris is representing President Donald Trump in his latest election fight.</li>\n<li>John Eastman, a law professor at Chapman University, sparked national criticism for writing a controversial op-ed about Harris in August.</li>\n<li>In the column, Eastman promoted a racist lie that Harris may be ineligible to become vice president because her parents are immigrants.</li>\n<li>Harris was born in California and indisputably a US citizen.</li>\n<li>Eastman has been cited as Trump's counsel of record in a motion to join a Texas lawsuit seeking to invalidate ballots in Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, Michigan and Georgia.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A lawyer who pushed a \"birther\" conspiracy theory about Vice President-elect Kamala Harris is representing President Donald Trump in his latest election fight.</p><p>John Eastman, a law professor at Chapman University, has been cited as Trump's counsel of record in a motion to join a Texas lawsuit that seeks to invalidate millions of votes in the 2020 presidential election, according to a <a href=\"https://www.supremecourt.gov/DocketPDF/22/22O155/163234/20201209155327055_No.%2022O155%20Original%20Motion%20to%20Intervene.pdf\">court filing</a> on Wednesday.</p><p>Eastman was widely criticized for writing a <a href=\"https://www.newsweek.com/some-questions-kamala-harris-about-eligibility-opinion-1524483\">controversial op-ed</a> in Newsweek in August about Harris, a California senator who was <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-vp-pick-kamala-harris-2020-8\">then-newly announced</a> as President-elect Joe Biden's running mate.</p><p>In the column, Eastman promoted a racist lie that Harris may be ineligible for the position because she has immigrant parents. Harris was born in California and is indisputably a US citizen.</p><p>Newsweek <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/newsweek-apologizes-for-kamala-harris-vp-eligibility-op-ed-2020-8\">appended</a> an editor's note to the article two days after its publication, stating: \"All of us at Newsweek are horrified that this op-ed gave rise to a wave of vile Birtherism directed at Senator Harris.\"</p><p>At the time, Trump&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-promotes-racist-false-birther-conspiracy-about-kamala-harris-2020-8\">elevated</a> Eastman's assertions, and hailed him as a \"very highly qualified, very talented lawyer.\" Trump similarly promoted racist birtherism claims about President Barack Obama.</p><p>The Trump campaign and Eastman did not immediately respond to Insider's requests for comment.</p><p>Eastman is working on a case filed by Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton straight to the Supreme Court - a long-shot attempt to overturn the election results in key battleground states won by President-elect Joe Biden, including Pennsylvania, Michigan, Wisconsin and Georgia.</p><p>\"I'm honored that the President asked me to represent him in this matter,\" Eastman said in a <a href=\"https://www.donaldjtrump.com/media/president-trump-moves-to-intervene-in-texas-supreme-court-case/\">statement</a> released by the Trump campaign on Wednesday. \"I think his intervention in this case strengthens an already very strong original action by the state of Texas.\"&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/texas-election-result-lawsuit-trump-supreme-court-motion-problems-2020-12\">Many election law experts</a> have described the litigation as factually inaccurate and unlikely to succeed. Republican attorneys general from 17 states have also backed the last-ditch effort, though <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/gop-sen-john-cornyn-criticizes-lawsuit-aimed-overturning-biden-win-2020-12\">other</a> GOP members have criticized its legal basis.&#160;</p><p>Trump has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-lawsuits-election-results-2020-11\">lost more than three dozen legal challenges</a> against the election thus far.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/lawyer-who-pushed-birther-theory-on-kamala-harris-represents-trump-2020-12'>Business Insider</a></div><div border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=8Y5PAKLMI94:3QKEwC1aE9w:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8Y5PAKLMI94:3QKEwC1aE9w:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8Y5PAKLMI94\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Dec 2020 20:58:10 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fd277ab2dc42e0018f0e41b?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"7746cd8f4b39351e668bb38e53edc1aa","destWidth":1749,"destHeight":1312,"sourceBytes":127134,"destBytes":127134,"author":"oseddiq@insider.com (Oma Seddiq)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd277a27b7e050019107408?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn33@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-26-986_17df620e2b894b66.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8Y5PAKLMI94:3QKEwC1aE9w:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn56@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-23-079_6a603b40863c7bde.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8Y5PAKLMI94:3QKEwC1aE9w:V_sGLiPBpWU":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8Y5PAKLMI94:3QKEwC1aE9w:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn56@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-21-653_b12ce9770494abba.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8Y5PAKLMI94":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn48@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-419_c270c0fa240cd829.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712063},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"Facebook reportedly told its ad reviewers to ignore fraud and hacked accounts as long as 'Facebook gets paid'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-allowed-fraud-hacked-accounts-ads-got-paid-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f625ffa323fc4001e0d6ac9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"facebook ceo mark zuckerberg\" height=\"2333\" width=\"3500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg arrives for a House Financial Services Committee hearing on Capitol Hill in Washington, Wednesday, Oct. 23, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Andrew Harnik</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Facebook told workers to ignore fraudulent ads and hacked accounts as long as the company \"gets paid,\" <a href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/craigsilverman/facebook-ad-scams-revenue-china-tiktok-vietnam?ref=bfnsplash\">BuzzFeed News</a>&#160;reported Thursday.</li>\n<li>BuzzFeed News' investigation revealed how Facebook consistently prioritized making money over protecting users from scams, hackers, and disinformation.</li>\n<li>Ahead of the US elections in November, Facebook even told its ad reviewers to focus on selling political ads over looking for the ones that broke its rules, according to the report.</li>\n<li>Facebook has made repeated promises to crack down on users and advertisers who break its rules, but dozens of reports in recent months have exposed that the company <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-mislabeled-60-of-georgia-election-misinfo-posts-report-2020-12?r=ts-sub\">continues to fall short on those promises</a>.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A blistering investigation into Facebook's ad business published by <a href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/craigsilverman/facebook-ad-scams-revenue-china-tiktok-vietnam?ref=bfnsplash\">BuzzFeed News</a> on Thursday revealed in new detail how the company prioritizes making money over enforcing its own rules intended to protect users from scammers and hackers.</p><p>According to BuzzFeed News, Facebook continues to knowingly allow - and profit from - fraudulent advertisers, and the company's ad business is \"built with the same lax controls and outsourcing of critical moderation work\" that has allowed disinformation, hate speech, and harassment to proliferate on its platform.</p><p>Facebook employs thousands of third-party contractors, through companies like Accenture, BCforward, and Cognizant, to review both user-generated content and ads placed on its platform to ensure they comply with Facebook's <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/communitystandards\">extensive policies</a>.</p><p>But an Accenture employee who manages 45 reviewers for Facebook told them to ignore patterns of fraud and hacked accounts as long as \"Facebook gets paid\" with legitimate payment methods so that it isn't on the hook for issuing refunds, BuzzFeed News reported, adding that the manager justified allowing hackers to run ads via hacked accounts because it was a win-win - more revenue for Facebook and a larger audience for the hacker.</p><p>A Facebook spokesperson told BuzzFeed News that the company invests heavily in keeping bad ads off its platform, and disagreed with the idea that it has profited from bad ads, but declined to comment about how it handles the money it makes from ads that violate its rules.</p><p>\"We have every incentive - financial and otherwise - to prevent abuse and make the ads experience on Facebook a positive one. To suggest otherwise fundamentally misunderstands our business model and mission,\" the spokesperson told BuzzFeed News.</p><p>Facebook did not respond to a request from Business Insider for comment on this story, and Accenture did not immediately respond to Business Insider's request for comment.</p><p>Facebook's ad business brought in <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-earnings-q3-2020-revenue-eps-profit-analysis-2020-10\">$21.2 billion in revenue</a> in the third quarter. But as BuzzFeed News and others have previously reported, some of that revenue has come from shady and at times dangerous advertisers, including <a href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/ryanmac/facebook-instagram-profit-boogaloo-ads\">pro-violence white supremacists</a>, <a href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/craigsilverman/ads-inc-crypto-scams-facebook\">scam artists</a>, <a href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/carolinehaskins1/facebook-running-anti-vax-ads-despite-ban-anti\">anti-vaxxers</a>, and hawkers of <a href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/janelytvynenko/chiropractor-runnings-false-covid-ads\">COVID-19 disinformation</a>.</p><p><strong>Read more:</strong><em> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-apple-privacy-battle-ads-how-users-interact-with-tech-2020-12?r=ts-sub\">The battle between Facebook and Apple over privacy is about more than just ads - it's about the future of how we interact with tech</a></em></p><p>Facebook has repeatedly pledged to crack down on bad actors on its platforms, but dozens of reports in recent months have exposed instances where Facebook's inability to enforce its own policies <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-ad-purge-hurting-small-business-owners-holiday-shopping-season-2020-11?r=ts-sub\">accurately</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-mislabeled-60-of-georgia-election-misinfo-posts-report-2020-12?r=ts-sub\">consistently</a>, efficiently, or <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-trump-family-misinformation-rules-exemption-donald-trump-jr-2020-1?r=ts-sub\">even at all</a> have halted progress toward those goals.</p><p>Here are a few of the major revelations from the investigation:</p><ul><li>Facebook banned political advertisers from creating new ads in the week before the US elections in November to head off misinformation. But before that deadline, it told moderators to prioritize selling ads over looking for rule-breaking ones and to reactivate accounts that broke its rules whenever possible, according to the report. (Facebook told BuzzFeed News the shift in focus was meant to help advertisers get their message out ahead of the ban.)</li><li>TikTok precursor Musical.ly had placed ads featuring young girls dancing provocatively. But when Facebook employees raised concerns that Facebook's algorithm was targeting the ads primarily toward middle-aged men, the company restricted their access to data about the ads, implied that it dismissed their concerns because Musical.ly was a big spender, and let the ads run for a year and a half, the report said. (Facebook told BuzzFeed News it created a policy against suggesting sexualized interactions - though it was never announced anywhere public.)</li><li>An internal Facebook review found that, of thousands of ads placed by Chinese advertisers, 30% violated at least one of Facebook's policies, and employees said the company looks the other way even though issues with China-based advertisers are well-known. (Facebook told BuzzFeed News it has a dedicated \"business integrity\" team in Asia and doesn't ignore violations by China-based advertisers.)</li></ul><h2><strong><a href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/craigsilverman/facebook-ad-scams-revenue-china-tiktok-vietnam?ref=bfnsplash\">Read the full BuzzFeed News story here »</a></strong></h2><div height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Dec 2020 07:15:22 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fd2cd7e9cf1420018d2eb06?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"0d4cac5abb46e5e42c0f2fb996b8cbd5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn45@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-20-546_3c19c829b61eda65.webp","destWidth":2291,"destHeight":1718,"sourceBytes":196244,"destBytes":196244,"author":"tsonnemaker@businessinsider.com (Tyler Sonnemaker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f625ffa323fc4001e0d6ac9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn1@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-34-334_db2490752d7adaa0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JlF0USMXivM:n3-0x05ZJl8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-26-066_debe34c826e0ea59.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JlF0USMXivM:n3-0x05ZJl8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn46@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-35-252_6f48626dd21b77e4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JlF0USMXivM:n3-0x05ZJl8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn71@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-26-127_a3f02da5d689c15c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/JlF0USMXivM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn52@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-22-093_c2de939297646908.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712033},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"Airbnb Luxe is a collection of vetted luxury homes with standout amenities and a designated trip planner. Many listings are notoriously pricey, but we found options for under $500.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-affordable-airbnb-luxe-homes","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Fluxury%2Flisting%2F24653181%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1607362285_cAVEn%252FH4ZyZxXS1a%26guests%3D1%26adults%3D1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fce60f7037cbd001861440a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best Airbnb Luxe listings - Oceanfront Home in Malibu, California\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Airbnb</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Fluxury\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Airbnb Luxe</a> is a collection of vetted, high-end homes that come with extra amenities and a designated trip designer.</li><li>Many Luxe listings are understandably pricey, but we found excellent options across the US for $500 or less per night.&#160;</li><li>Additionally, all of these homes abide by the company's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-new-cleaning-protocol\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Enhanced Cleaning Initiative</a> that mandates strict COVID-19 protocols.</li></ul><p>As the pandemic continues to spread across the US, many Americans are turning to closer-to-home getaways and opting for private vacation rentals rather than hotel stays. Experts and the CDC agree that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/which-is-safer-airbnb-hotels-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">private homes are a safer option</a> since there's no contact with other guests or staff.&#160;</p><p>In fact, vacation rentals have become one of the biggest <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/popular-airbnb-trending-destinations\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">travel trends</a> for 2020 and beyond. Plus, there's an added sense of security with an <a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Airbnb</a> stay since the company has rolled out its <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-new-cleaning-protocol\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Enhanced Cleaning Initiative</a> that mandates all hosts meet new COVID-19 cleaning guidelines. However, some travelers may be missing the more luxurious experience and feel of a five-star hotel.&#160;</p><p>Enter <a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Fluxury\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Airbnb Luxe</a> for the best of both worlds. Last year, the home rental company <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-launches-exclusive-luxury-homes-luxe-details-prices-2019-6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">launched the Luxe line</a> with over 2,000 new luxury homes around the world. All Luxe listings are highly curated, vetted, and include extra standout amenities that can range from personal chefs to childcare options. They even come with a designated trip designer so you get that personal concierge feel you'd find at a top hotel.</p><p>As you might expect, many of the Airbnb Luxe homes can be expensive, with the most expensive listings cost close to $200,000. But we've dug through and found more affordable options that come in under $500 per night so you can get the most bang for your buck. From private mountain-view chalets in Colorado to luxury modern homes on the ocean in Malibu, these opulent Airbnbs across the US are not to be missed.&#160;</p><p><strong>We carefully selected Airbnb rentals based on the following criteria:</strong></p><ol><li>We only included rentals available on Airbnb Luxe so you get all the extra perks.</li><li>All homes are expertly designed with high-end amenities, services, views, or all three.&#160;</li><li>All homes participate in Airbnb's Enhanced Clean Program.</li><li>We kept affordability in mind and found the best luxury properties under $500 per night.&#160;</li><li>Options vary from family-friendly to romantic getaways, so that there are homes for every type of traveler.</li></ol><h2>Here are the best affordable Airbnb Luxe listings in the US, sorted by price from low to high:</h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tPenthouse in Miami, Florida, $348\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fce6187037cbd0018614411?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Penthouse in Miami, Florida\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Airbnb</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h2><a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Fluxury%2Flisting%2F42507742%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1607362864_4mnoBAMaUdioBh6q%26guests%3D1%26adults%3D1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Book this Airbnb starting at $348 per night</a></h2><p>Set in the vibrant Wynwood neighborhood, this <a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Fluxury%2Flisting%2F42507742%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1607362864_4mnoBAMaUdioBh6q%26guests%3D1%26adults%3D1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">three-bedroom penthouse</a> offers incredible views of the city and Biscayne Bay. 69_b249cb62abf595ef.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/KnxLcHQ528A":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn84@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-22-529_ed3a17ad7bd933c2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712075},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"A submarine officer and a handful of military pilots are in the running to be the first woman to walk on the moon","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/a-us-service-member-could-be-first-woman-on-moon-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd275777b7e0500191073f9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NASA astronaut candidate Kayla Barron is seen after donning her spacesuit, Friday, July 12, 2019 at NASA&#39;s Johnson Space Center in Houston, Texas\" height=\"1024\" width=\"2048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>NASA astronaut candidate Kayla Barron is seen after donning her spacesuit, Friday, July 12, 2019 at NASA&#39;s Johnson Space Center in Houston, Texas\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/Bill Ingalls</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>NASA announced Wednesday that 18 astronauts have been selected to join the Artemis Team, which will support the Artemis lunar exploration program.</li>\n<li>Among the individuals selected are nine women, four of whom are US military personnel.</li>\n<li>One woman is a former Navy submarine warfare officer, while the other three women are former Army and Marine Corps pilots.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) announced Wednesday the names 18 astronauts who could return to the moon as part of the Artemis program, a new lunar exploration program.</p><p>\"I give you the heroes who will carry us to the Moon and beyond - the Artemis Generation,\" Vice President Mike Pence said Wednesday. \"It is amazing to think that the next man and first woman on the Moon are among the names that we just read.\"</p><p>The Artemis program is a lunar exploration effort aimed at not only sending people back to the moon by 2024 but also establishing a sustainable presence on the moon by the end of this decade.</p><p>Half of the 18 people selected are women. Among the women in the running for the historic achievement of being the first woman to walk on the moon are four US military service members: Kayla Barron, Nicole Mann, Anne McClain, and Jasmin Moghbeli.</p><p><strong>Lt. Cmdr. Kayla Barron:</strong></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd2841e7b7e050019107450?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2017 NASA astronaut candidate Kayla Barron\" height=\"1365\" width=\"2048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2017 NASA astronaut candidate Kayla Barron\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/Robert Markowitz</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Born in Idaho, Barron is a US Navy lieutenant commander. She graduated from the US Naval Academy with a bachelor's degree in systems engineering. She also has a master's degree in nuclear engineering from the University of Cambridge.</p><p>Barronwas part of the first class of women to commission as submarine officers, according to her official NASA biography. As a Submarine Warfare Officer, she completed three strategic deterrent patrols aboard the Ohio-class ballistic missile submarine USS Maine.</p><p>In 2017, NASA selected Barron, who was working at the Naval Academy at the time, to join Astronaut Candidate Class.</p><p><strong>Lt. Col. Nicole Mann:</strong></p><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd27b312dc42e0018f0e427?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NASA astronaut Nicole Aunapu Mann\" height=\"1692\" width=\"2048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>NASA astronaut Nicole Aunapu Mann\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/Bill Ingalls</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>Mann, a California native and Marine Corps lieutenant colonel, has a bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering from the US Naval Academy and a master's degree in the same field from Stanford University.</p><p>Having earned her wings of gold as a naval aviator, she deployed as a combat pilot aboard the USS Enterprise, flying a total of 47 combat missions in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom in Iraq and Operation Enduring Freedom in Afghanistan.</p><p>She later served as a test pilot flying F/A-18 Hornets and Super Hornets. In her career, she has racked up over 2,500 flight hours in 25 different aircraft types.</p><p>Mann, who joined NASA in 2013, has most recently been training for the crewed flight test of Boeing's Starliner spacecraft, <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/astronauts/biographies/nicole-a-mann/biography\">according to her official NASA biography</a>.</p><p><strong>Lt. Col. Anne McClain:</strong></p><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd27e452dc42e0018f0e43b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NASA astronaut Anne McClain\" height=\"1365\" width=\"2048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>NASA astronaut Anne McClain\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>McClain, a US Army lieutenant colonel, was born in Washington. She has a bachelor's degree in mechanical/aeronautical engineering from the US Military Academy at West Point and a master's degree in aerospace engineering from the University of Bath. She also has a master's degree in international relations from the University of Bristol.</p><p>She earned her wings as an OH-58D Kiowa Warrior scout/attack helicopter pilot, and she flew more than 800 combat hours and over 200 combat missions in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom. As a senior Army aviator, McClain has over 2,000 flight hours in 20 different aircraft.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/astronauts/biographies/anne-c-mcclain/biography\">According to her official biography</a>, she joined NASA in 2013. Most recently, she served as a flight engineer on the International Space Station.</p><p><strong>Maj. Jasmin Moghbeli:</strong></p><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd280042dc42e0018f0e44b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2017 Astronaut Candidate Jasmin Moghbeli\" height=\"1152\" width=\"1536\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2017 Astronaut Candidate Jasmin Moghbeli\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/Robert Markowitz</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>Born in Germany, Moghbeli is a major in the US Marine Corps. She holds a bachelor's degree in aerospace engineering with information technology from the Massachussetts Institute of Technology. She also has a master's degree in aerospace engineering from the Naval Postgraduate School.</p><p>Moghbeli is a graduate of the US Navy Test Pilot School. When she was selected to join NASA in 2017, she was testing H-1 helicopters for the Marine Corps in Arizona.</p><p>While details are limited in <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/content/astronaut-jasmin-moghbeli\">Moghbeli's official biography</a>, NASA says that she has flown 150 combat missions and has accumulated over 1,600 flight hours.</p><p>Other outstanding women who could be the first woman to walk on the moon include Christina Hammock Koch, Jessica Meir, Kate Rubins, Jessica Watkins, and Stephanie Wilson.</p><div Gamble is taking programmatic ad buying for its baby products brands in house.</a></li>\n  <li>P&amp;G spends an estimated $60 million on digital advertising for baby products and Omnicom media agency Hearts &amp; Science previously handled the account.</li>\n  <li>The move is the latest step in P&amp;G's ongoing effort to handle more of its massive ad budget itself and shift it away from agencies.</li>\n </ul>\n <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pg-continues-in-housing-more-programmatic-ad-buying-omnicom-loss-2020-12\">Read the full story here.</a></h3>\n <hr>\n  <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/legendary-disney-movie-chief-may-be-near-exit-2020-12\">\n    <figure> \n     <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f92e11a2121130018740665?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 1225877439\" height=\"3406\" width=\"4541\" charset=\"\"> \n      <figcaption> \n       <p class=\"copyright\">Hakan Nural/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images</p> \n      </figcaption> </img>\n    </figure></a></h3>\n  <section>\n   <h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/legendary-disney-movie-chief-may-be-near-exit-2020-12\">Hollywood insiders are speculating that Disney's Bob Iger, Alan Horn, and others are headed for the exit</a></h3>\n   <ul>\n    <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/legendary-disney-movie-chief-may-be-near-exit-2020-12\">Disney's Bob Iger and Alan Horn are the center of speculation that they're about to depart, reports Claire Atkinson.</a></li>\n    <li>The chatter comes as Wall Street wants to know details of Disney's plan to boost its subscription streaming business without hurting the film box office.</li>\n    <li>Other Disney insiders said it would be wrong to say Horn is retiring, as nothing is imminent, though. Johnson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd288a82dc42e0018f0e481?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn8@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-12-508_9f8c073ea1892f36.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f92e11a2121130018740665?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn84@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-23-225_c9e2b4a5356cae31.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fd1474d240ebd00126be12e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn88@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-34-726_80f5d50d416d9910.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8pkOMSrt2PQ:6IbKLnKem8w:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn55@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-34-490_a9ea1fa07ca2bbd2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8pkOMSrt2PQ:6IbKLnKem8w:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn68@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-31-637_79ee85ab8894fc39.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8pkOMSrt2PQ:6IbKLnKem8w:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn20@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-29-857_0f27ea9353526e04.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8pkOMSrt2PQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn79@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-33-260_5530a601ac8bd26d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712040},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"The US is likely to have more daily COVID-19 deaths than 9/11 for the next 60 to 90 days, CDC director warns","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-more-covid-19-deaths-911-90-days-cdc-director-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd2a32f9cf1420018d2eac6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"9:11 COVID 19\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A man commemorates victims in the 9/11 attacks at the National September 11 Memorial and Museum in New York, the United States, Sept. 11, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Wang Ying/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The director of the CDC on Thursday warned that the daily death toll from COVID-19 in the US is likely to exceed the number of deaths from major national tragedies in the coming weeks.</li>\n<li>\"We are in the timeframe now that probably for the next 60 to 90 days we're going to have more deaths per day than we had at 9/11 or we had at Pearl Harbor,\" Dr. Robert Redfield said.&#160;</li>\n<li>The US recorded 3,124 new COVID-19 deaths on Wednesday, the largest single-day total to date and higher than the death toll on September 11, 2001.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The US will \"probably\" see more COVID-19 deaths per day for the next two to three months than the total death tolls from major national tragedies like the 9/11 terror attacks and Pearl Harbor, the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warned on Thursday.&#160;</p><p>\"We are in the timeframe now that probably for the next 60 to 90 days we're going to have more deaths per day than we had at 9/11 or we had at Pearl Harbor,\" Dr. Robert Redfield said at an event hosted by the Council on Foreign Relations, <a href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/healthcare/529709-cdc-director-us-covid-19-deaths-likely-to-exceed-9-11-toll-for-60-days\">per The Hill.</a></p><p>Though a COVID-19 vaccine from Pfizer is seemingly <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/us-experts-convene-pfizer-vaccine-virus-4a798b8073c845e60305479e4d94b786\">on the verge of being approved in the US</a>, Redfield suggested this would not have a major impact on the daily death toll over the next two months.&#160;</p><p>\"The reality is the vaccine approval this week's not going to really impact that I think to any degree for the next 60 days,\" Redfield said.</p><p>The US recorded <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/daily-us-covid-19-deaths-higher-than-911-death-toll-2020-12\">3,124 new COVID-19 deaths</a> on Wednesday, the largest single-day total to date. It marked the first time the US reported more deaths in one day from the pandemic than the total number of people killed in the terror attacks on September 11, 2001.</p><p>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2013/07/27/us/september-11-anniversary-fast-facts/index.html\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"e3691b9e94f9c7da004cd48a48ecefd8\">2,977</a> people were killed in New York, Pennsylvania, and Washington, DC, in the 9/11 attacks.&#160;</p><p>Japan's attack on Pearl Harbor in December 1941, which launched the US into World War II, killed 2,403 Americans.&#160;</p><p>The COVID-19 death toll in the US had surpassed 291,000 as of Thursday evening, alongside more than 15.5 million confirmed cases of the virus, <a href=\"https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/map.html\">per Johns Hopkins University.</a></p><p>No other country in the world has reported more COVID-19 cases or deaths than the US. Public health experts have excoriated President Donald Trump's handling of the pandemic, criticizing his anti-science approach and repeated efforts to downplay the threat of the virus. Trump has routinely flouted recommendations from experts, pushing against the calls from medical professionals for people to wear masks or face-coverings to help mitigate the spread of the virus.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/us-more-covid-19-deaths-911-90-days-cdc-director-2020-12'>Business Insider</a></div><div
