+0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fc8f3f0037cbd00186138e5?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"103af9aadf7918b000992d914a2510dd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn50@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-20-533_a57029f131812ffa.webp","destWidth":1777,"destHeight":1333,"sourceBytes":81832,"destBytes":81832,"author":"insider@insider.com (John Haltiwanger)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd2a32f9cf1420018d2eac6?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_dbajPmdakE:8M5eG7B87Mg:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn11@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-22-135_8c94f995d165dc64.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_dbajPmdakE:8M5eG7B87Mg:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn23@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-24-883_31923332d1d4fd31.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_dbajPmdakE:8M5eG7B87Mg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn71@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-21-864_e856dd5f43a75fc9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/_dbajPmdakE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn20@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-35-25-548_a1a7abeb2ad08b2b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712043},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"If you run an Etsy shop, half the battle is getting your products seen. Here are 14 free or affordable online courses, YouTube videos, and resources to help you understand Etsy's algorithm.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-make-money-on-etsy","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>An Etsy shop's success depends on how easily people find what you're selling. Understanding SEO, algorithms, and ads can drastically improve your sales.</li><li>Below are 14 affordable or free online courses, YouTube videos, podcasts, and online tools to help you learn everything you need to know.</li><li>Read more: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-set-up-successful-etsy-store\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">How to set up an Etsy store that instantly draws in customers and makes you big money, from people who did it</a></li><li><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sign up for Insider Reviews' weekly newsletter for more buying advice and great deals</a>.</li></ul><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Static</bi-shortcode><p>As the pandemic continues, many people are looking for ways to monetize their hobbies and start their own businesses. Some are turning to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-set-up-successful-etsy-store\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Etsy</a>, joining the millions of artisans, craft supply sellers, and vintage sellers already on the platform.&#160;</p><p>No matter the Etsy shop, there's one thing all owners have in common: A desire to hack the Etsy algorithm. Should you pack your title with SEO keywords, or keep it simple and readable? Can your shop's name help or hinder your traffic? Is it best to just pay for Etsy ads and not worry about the algorithm?&#160;</p><p>Like all e-commerce and social media platforms, Etsy's algorithm determines how high items rank in its search results. Etsy shares some tips on <a href=\"https://blog.etsy.com/en/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the official blog</a>, <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6220&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.etsy.com%2Fseller-handbook%2Farticle%2Flisten-to-the-etsy-success-podcast%2F169396694201169396694201\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Etsy Success Podcast</a>, and, more recently, <a href=\"https://etsyu.etsy.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Etsy U</a>, a hub of e-courses and workshops from successful Etsy sellers. However, it never hurts to broaden your understanding of the algorithm, and as an Etsy seller myself, I'm always on the lookout for e-courses, podcasts, YouTube channels, websites, and other resources to help me grow my shop.&#160;</p><p>While there are countless classes on how to make just about any craft imaginable, the resources in this post specifically focus on increasing your sales by optimizing your SEO, tags, titles, descriptions, and more, so that Etsy's algorithm will work in your favor. Though Etsy's algorithm is subject to change at any time without notice, getting acquainted with the people who track those changes and pass on their knowledge will help you stay on top of the competition.&#160;</p><h2>The 14 best e-learning courses, videos, and resources for Etsy shop owners:</h2><h2>Online courses</h2><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd13664664756313e691116\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd13664664756313e691116&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>In under 35 minutes, artist Jules Tillman will turn your SEO into S-E-Whoa. She even shows you how to use your About page on Etsy - an often overlooked sales tool - to draw people to your shop and convert customers. While Tillman shares technical tips for strategic things to include in your About page, I can also testify that taking the \"know, life, and trust\" factor into consideration goes a long way as well. In my own shop, I tell the short and sweet story about what inspired me to open it, which humanizes me to my customers, encourages them to keep reading, and stay on my page longer. <br><a href=\"https://www.skillshare.com/classes/Etsy-Polish-Clean-Up-Your-Shop-for-Maximum-Sales-and-Peace-of-Mind/1437599543?via=search-layout-grid\"></a></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd137cc6226302bd31e7754\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd137cc6226302bd31e7754&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>Adri Luna will help you polish your shop until it shines. If you know you're doing something wrong but aren't sure what, this course will help you figure it out. Adri goes over titles, descriptions, and categories to help answer Etsy sellers' burning questions. Should you pack your titles with SEO? (Not too much.) Should you choose categories that are broad or super specific? (A little of both.) How do you find out what Etsy shoppers are searching for and how can you write a compelling description that actually gets them to buy it? All that and more is packed into Adri's crash course.&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd1398af74e3033940027b4\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd1398af74e3033940027b4&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><a href=\"https://www.udemy.com/course/etsy-seo-boot-camp-your-first-1100-sales-blueprint/\"></a>Reaching 1000 sales is a huge Etsy milestone, and Patrick Gamaliel will help you get there for free in his Udemy course. What makes Patrick's class stand out is that he not only discusses how to identify keywords that will help you rank higher in Etsy search, but also how you can use your new knowledge of high-ranking keywords to develop new product ideas. Don't worry if you're a vintage seller (like me); these tips can work for you too. If you know what keywords are ranking highly in the vintage corner of Etsy, you can source items that are more in demand and likely to sell quickly.&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd13881664756316c0797f9\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd13881664756316c0797f9&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>Lisa Jacobs instructs sellers on how to get found on Etsy and create a sustainable marketing strategy that includes - but is not limited to - ads. Every seller fears spending money on ads that don't have a measurable impact. (Been there!) An occasional ad campaign might help you temporarily boost sales, but it's going to take more than that to maintain high sales. Whether you choose to run ad campaigns frequently, or want to make the most of planned campaigns around high sales shopping days like Black Friday, Lisa's tips will help you understand the how, when, and why of ads, and how they fit into your overall marketing strategy.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd1390b935fea26ec190a26\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd1390b935fea26ec190a26&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>Tara Jacobson has this <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.skillshare.com%2Fclasses%2FHow-To-Fall-In-Love-With-Etsy-SEO-Nerdy-But-Fun-Etsy-SEO%2F927188848%3Ffile8%3Ffile\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">course</a> on Skillshare, a ton of blog posts on <a href=\"https://marketingartfully.com/category/etsy-seo/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Etsy SEO</a> and <a href=\"https://marketingartfully.com/category/etsy-vintage-marketing/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">selling vintage on Etsy</a>, a list of her favorite <a href=\"https://marketingartfully.com/best-marketing-resources-for-entrepreneurs-authors-startups-and-realtors/#7--etsy-marketing-\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Etsy marketing resources</a>, several ebooks, and more. Most Etsy content is geared toward makers, so Tara is unique in that she specifically tailors her tips to vintage sellers, who face different challenges on the platform. Tara teaches students how to maintain consistent sales when they likely only have one of a particular item, and how to sell those obscure vintage finds that might be too quirky for the casual shopper. I'm on her email list and she occasionally sends out free video workshops on topics like refreshing your keywords that are super helpful. Her tips have been a game-changer for my shop. <br><a href=\"https://www.brynnaosh.com/etsy-success-course\"></a></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd13ae7361735279171dbc5\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd13ae7361735279171dbc5&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><a href=\"https://www.brynnaosh.com/etsy-success-course\"></a>Did you know Etsy has multiple options for ads, and that earlier this year, Etsy rolled out Offsite Ads, which are mandatory? As a former Shop Optimization Specialist at Etsy, Brynna knows the ins and outs of how Etsy works and demystifies both traditional Etsy ads and the new offsite ads. Even better, she tells you when - and when not - to use paid ads, so you get the most out of your ad spend.&#160;</p><h2>YouTube channels</h2><p>There are YouTubers with channels dedicated to helping small businesses make their Etsy shops work for them, including:</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd14504ad4c5d33c6286386\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd14504ad4c5d33c6286386&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PU69g_L3FI0&list=PLjgaqdA46AWVeX9yWZc2JksyYb12tIS5YIS5Y\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Bailey Lehrer</a> is the founder of Ringcrush, also known as The Million Dollar Etsy Shop. Bailey has made over a million dollars on Etsy. (Seriously!) But it takes more than a stellar product to rake in that kind of dough. In <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PU69g_L3FI0&list=PLjgaqdA46AWVeX9yWZc2JksyYb12tIS5YIS5Y\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this video</a>, Bailey shares a tip about how your shop's name can work with Etsy's algorithm to do some heavy lifting for you on the marketing front.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd145d183bd0b1bfb74ff44\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd145d183bd0b1bfb74ff44&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>Etsy has been pushing shop owners to offer free shipping for a while, and shops with free shipping do tend to rank higher in Etsy's search. But what about the hit to your bottom line? Is it really worth it? <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/c/DeborahEngelmajer/search?query=etsy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Deborah Engelmajer</a> does an especially great job helping you decide if free shipping is right for you in <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DLWiLGHDaRU\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this video</a>.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd1460af74e30374105d404\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd1460af74e30374105d404&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLkvtZhHx8t2NauQZOtWBmY1ECj-2QWdpl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nancy Badillo</a> is an Etsy coach and creator of an Etsy sellers support group. She's excellent at finding often overlooked ways for Etsy sellers to hack the algorithm. A perfect example is <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SHAVVCZ0_9k&list=PLkvtZhHx8t2NauQZOtWBmY1ECj-2QWdpl&index=5;index=5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this video</a> where she shares tips for how to name the sections of your shop. Hint: you're going to want to change the \"on-sale\" section name ASAP.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd146b019a2462fd9384a05\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd146b019a2462fd9384a05&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>A common question among Etsy sellers is \"Should I renew or relist items that sell out or expire?\" Does renewal versus relisting have an impact on your search ranking? Starla Moore knows the answer in <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qGexmjsfEYo&list=PLl27QKVQFjTvJ607gcflhzBdlfWUn_SdP&index=14index=14\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this video</a>.&#160;</p><h2>Websites, podcasts, and online tools:</h2><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd147cff45c2316e433a654\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd147cff45c2316e433a654&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>Because the magazine is dedicated to handmade sellers, a large portion of their content is Etsy-specific. Between how-to articles, interviews with sellers, efficiency tips for artisans, and best practices for selling in-person and online, Handmade Seller Magazine is a must-read.&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd1493b3617352b2e4865bc\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd1493b3617352b2e4865bc&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><a href=\"https://convome.com/\"></a>This podcast isn't made by Etsy staffers, though the hosts are just as passionate. They invite makers to share their Etsy experience and tips, which of course includes advice on how to beat the algorithm. What I appreciate about this podcast is that it includes a variety of perspectives from shop owners selling nearly everything imaginable. <br><a href=\"https://erank.com/\"></a></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd149e86479504bb7572678\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd149e86479504bb7572678&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>If you want your listings to be seen, you have to know what terms Etsy shoppers are searching for. Formerly known as EtsyRank, eRank tracks search and sales performance on Etsy for specific terms.<br><a href=\"https://marmalead.com/\"></a></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fd14b146bba7933c9562102\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fd14b146bba7933c9562102&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><a href=\"https://marmalead.com/\"></a>Like eRank, Marmalead helps Etsypreneurs increase sales by leveraging real shoppers' keyword searches on Etsy. The keyword forecasting function is especially useful for anticipating new trends and riding those waves of popularity.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a vaccine","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/fda-advisory-committee-endorses-pfizers-covid-19-vaccine-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc62052037cbd0018613088?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Pfizer\" height=\"2286\" width=\"3049\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Oil markets surged in the hours after Pfizer announced positive results from its coronavirus vaccine study.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dado Ruvic/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A committee of more than 20 leading scientists and doctors just voted to encourage the FDA to grant emergency use authorization for Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine in the US.</li>\n<li>Their vote is not a final verdict, it's really just advice.</li>\n<li>Ultimately, it's up to the scientists working inside the FDA to decide whether or not to approve the two-dose vaccine candidate for an emergency OK. That decision could come soon.</li>\n<li><a href=\"http://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-healthcare\">For more stories like this, sign up here for Business Insider's daily healthcare newsletter.</a></li>\n</ul><p>A committee of 22 leading scientists and doctors <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/live-updates-on-fda-covid-19-vaccine-advisory-committee-pfizer-2020-12\">just voted 17 to 4, with one abstention</a>, encouraging the US Food and Drug Administration to grant emergency use authorization for Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine in the US.</p><p>Their vote is not a final verdict, it's really just advice. It indicates that the experts think the benefits of Pfizer's vaccine outweigh its risks, and that it should be made more widely available.</p><p>Ultimately, it's up to the scientists working inside the FDA to decide whether or not to approve the two-dose vaccine candidate for an emergency OK. That decision could come just minutes, hours, or days from now.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd2a2dfe00bce00188baac6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2020 12 10 at 5.07.24 PM\" height=\"384\" width=\"719\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The question committee members voted on Thursday evening.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=owveMJBTc2I\" target=\"_blank\">FDA VRBPAC / YouTube</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>\"FDA staff feel the responsibility to move as quickly as possible,\" FDA Commissioner Stephen Hahn <a href=\"https://twitter.com/SteveFDA/status/1337173788551733251\">tweeted shortly after</a> the vote. \"However, they know they must carry out their mandate to protect the public health &#38; ensure any authorized vaccine meets our rigorous safety and effectiveness standards.\"</p><p>Hahn has already indicated that he is near-ready to give the green light for the Pfizer vaccine, though.</p><p>\"Our initial assessment is that this is a vaccine that does meet our criteria,\" he <a href=\"https://t.co/ctpbgYKyF5\">said on NBC News' TODAY</a> Thursday morning, before the committee meeting.&#160;</p><p>Pfizer's vaccine has also already been OK'd for emergency use in countries including the UK, Canada, and Bahrain. The New York-based drugmaker and its German partner, BioNTech, said in November that the 2-shot vaccine was <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-well-pfizer-shot-works-against-covid-19-2020-12\">95% effective at preventing symptomatic COVID-19</a> in a massive clinical trial.&#160;</p><p>The FDA convened an independent expert panel Thursday to weigh in on Pfizer's application. The group included some of the top virologists and medical experts in the nation, including Dr. Eric Rubin, an infectious-disease specialist and editor-in-chief of The New England Journal of Medicine, and Dr. Paul Offit, a top vaccine expert at the University of Pennsylvania who co-invented the rotavirus vaccine.</p><h2><strong>There were 4 'no' votes, and some experts raised questions around the inclusion of 16- and 17-year-olds in the authorization&#160;</strong></h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8ede909e9fe4001900a481?format=jpeg\" alt=\"16-year-old participates in coronavirus vaccine trial for Pfizer at Cincinnati Children&#39;s Hospital, pediatric vaccine studies COVID-19\" height=\"1536\" width=\"2048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 16-year-old participates in Pfizer&#39;s clinical trial to test its coronavirus vaccine candidate. She was the first adolescent patient at Cincinnati Children’s Hospital to enroll in the study.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Cincinnati Children’s Hospital</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>In a virtual meeting hosted on Adobe Connect, and punctuated by many mute miscues and WiFi issues, committee members listened to hours of presentations and debated lightly at the end of the day. One <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pfizer-covid-19-vaccine-trial-experience-side-effects-2020-12\">Pfizer vaccine trial participant spoke during the public comment period in the afternoon</a>, urging the FDA to authorize Pfizer's vaccine for emergency use Thursday night by saying \"let's roll.\"</p><p>Before the vote, there was some debate among experts about whether or not there was enough data to support OK'ing the vaccine for 16- and 17-year-olds, who were included in the wording of the FDA's voting question. No one under the age of 18 got sick with COVID-19 during the trial. Some on the committee expressed a desire to increase the minimum vaccination age to 18, until more data is available.</p><p>On of the four \"no\" voters, David Kim, told Business Insider&#160;that including 16- and 17-year-olds in the mix was his reason for voting against the question of the day.</p><p>\"My 'no' vote was because of the inclusion of 16-17 year-olds,\" Kim said in an email. \"Unfortunately, I and other members who had also voted 'no' did not have an opportunity to explain our positions before the meeting was adjourned.\"</p><p>Another expert who voted no was Dr. Archana Chatterjee, a pediatrician who's dean of the Chicago Medical School. She told CNN she wasn't in favor of making the shot available for 16- and 17-year-olds.</p><p>\"I want to make it very clear that I am fully supportive of the emergency use authorization of this vaccine for adults 18 years and older,\" she told CNN.</p><p>The reasons the other two members voted \"no\" were unclear. The group adjourned promptly, leaving no time for members to explain why they voted the way they did. Business Insider has reached out to each of the \"no\" voters for comment.</p><h2><strong>The panel discussed long-term safety of the shot</strong></h2><p>Dr. Cody Meissner, chief of the pediatrics infectious disease division at Tufts University School of Medicine said during the meeting that he's \"comfortable\" with the available safety data, particularly given the urgency of this pandemic, which is killing thousands of Americans every day. Meissner was the lone abstention from the vote.&#160;</p><p>He added that issues typically occur within the first 40 days of a vaccine. There has only been one instance of vaccine injury more than 60 days after a shot being administered, and that was in an immunocompromised patient who received the live polio vaccine.</p><p>Oveta Fuller, a microbiology and immunology professor at the University of Michigan, said that we don't yet know enough about the long-term protective effect of this shot.</p><p>\"We've only been looking for two months,\" Fuller said.</p><p>Others cautioned that this is uncharted territory because Pfizer's vaccine is based on a brand-new technological platform called messenger RNA.&#160;</p><p>Over decades of vaccine trials, the overwhelming majority of issues pop up in the first few weeks, within about 40 days. That gave some members confidence that this vaccine is safe, even though it's using a new kind of virus-fighting platform.&#160;</p><p>Throughout the meeting, no panel member expressed substantive doubts about the overall merits of the vaccine, particularly in the benefits it could provide to the most vulnerable Americans who will be prioritized.</p><h2><strong>One committee member suggested a new study on allergies</strong></h2><p>Two vaccine recipients in the UK, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pfizer-covid-19-vaccine-ingredients-allergic-reactions-2020-12\">both with histories of severe allergies, have had allergic reactions shortly after receiving their first Pfizer shot</a>. Both fully recovered after a shot of epinephrine. Questions about what to do with people with severe allergies prompted some of the most lively discussions of the day.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Offit said Pfizer should now run a smaller trial focused on people with food allergies, vaccinating them and watching them closely.</p><p>\"This issue is not going to die until we have better data,\" Offit said. \"You're talking about tens of millions of people who are not going to get this vaccine.\"</p><h2><strong>The FDA is expected to approve the shot this weekend, kicking off the US' largest ever vaccine campaign</strong></h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f71dadb74fe5b0018a8db55?format=jpeg\" alt=\"vaccine\" height=\"1843\" width=\"2852\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A half-dose of Oxford-AstraZeneca&#39;s COVID-19 vaccine initially could mean we have double the number doses available when it&#39;s approved by regulators.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Siphiwe Sibeko/Pool via AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>FDA officials signaled that vaccine authorization could come as soon as this Saturday or Sunday, according to <a href=\"https://twitter.com/virginiahughes/status/1337165842379927557\">the New York Times</a>. That authorization would kick off the largest vaccination campaign in the history of the US.&#160;</p><p>Operation Warp Speed, the federal government's vaccine initiative, plans to start shipping doses to states within 24 hours of authorization. Warp Speed officials said 2.9 million doses of Pfizer's vaccine will be sent out in an initial shipment.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/healthcare-workers-long-term-care-residents-recommended-to-get-vaccines-first-2020-12\">Centers for Disease Control and Prevention&#160;has suggested</a> that healthcare workers and nursing home residents, both groups who've been hard-hit by the pandemic, should be first in line. That's just a recommendation, however, and states are free to decide how they want to allocate their vaccine supply.</p><p>The vaccine authorization couldn't come at a more critical time, as the number of COVID-19 deaths per day in the US just surpassed 3,000 for the first time.&#160;</p><p>\"We are pleased with the vote, and if the FDA issues an authorization, stand at the ready to bring this vaccine to people in the US in an effort to help combat this devastating pandemic,\" Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla said in a statement after the panel voted.</p><h2><strong>A panel will review Moderna's shot next week</strong></h2><p>Additional help is on the way.</p><p>The FDA is also reviewing another coronavirus vaccine developed by the Massachusetts biotech Moderna. The agency is planning to have another advisory committee meeting next Thursday to discuss that application. Moderna has said its two-dose vaccine was 94% effective at preventing COVID-19 in a late-stage clinical trial.</p><p>Warp Speed officials have estimated 20 million Americans could begin the vaccination process before the end of 2020, based on supply estimates for Pfizer's and Moderna's shots. Moncef Slaoui, the chief advisor for Warp Speed, has also projected 30 million more Americans will be immunized in January, and 50 million more in February.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read class=\"copyright\">Hollis Johnson/Crystal Cox/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Whether he's your brother, partner, dad, or friend, chances are you probably have a man in your life who you're planning on getting a gift for.</li><li>To make shopping easy for you, we came up with a list of 74 great gifts for him. In my head, I have a seemingly endless Rolodex of recommendations for special occasions, like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/engagement-gifts-ideas\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">engagement parties</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/baby-shower-gifts-under-50-dollars\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">baby showers</a>.</p><p>If you need some inspiration for what to get for him, the Insider Reviews team has you covered with some truly excellent gift ideas. target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">leather wallet</a> or <a record subscription</a>&#160;and a cookbook focused on <a of cool and comfortable Allbirds sneakers ($95)</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.pjtra.com/t/TUJGRkxNR0JGSEhLR01CRktJSkpF?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.meundies.com%2Fproducts%2Fthe-boxer\" target=\"_blank\" month 0r $69.99 per year)</a></li></ol><h2>Check out all 74 great gift ideas for him:</h2><p><em>This list includes a Sponsored Product that has been suggested by Under Armour. It also meets our editorial criteria in terms of quality and value.*</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tA classic leather wallet\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d5dafcf46552c09497b1efb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"bellroy $79\" height=\"700\" width=\"933\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bellroy</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Bellroy Slim Sleeve Wallet, available at <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=43345&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fbellroy.com%2Fproducts%2Fslim-sleeve-wallet%2Fdefault%2Fcaramel%23image-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Bellroy</a> and <a href=\"https://amzn.to/2PWL9s6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Amazon</a>, $79</h3><p>A wallet doesn't have to be a boring gift when it's from Bellroy. The gorgeous Slim Sleeve fits everything he needs in a slim, efficient profile. We love it so much we named it <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wallet-men\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best men's wallet</a>&#160;in our buying guide.</p>\n\tA flask that'll keep his coffee hot\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cc07a66b14bf43b3236da87?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hydro flask $28\" height=\"551\" width=\"734\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hydro Flask</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=73c3833f-ca52-45ea-b3b4-bf051ca7bb1a&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hydroflask.com%2F20-oz-wide-mouth%2Fcolor%2Colive%2Ca%2C92%2Co%2C140\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Hydro Flask 20 oz. Coffee Flask, available at Hydro Flask, $37.95</a></h3><p>This insulated coffee flask keeps hot drinks hot (and we mean hot) for up to 12 hours, and cold drinks cold for up to 24 hours.&#160;</p>\n\tA mask up for nearly any workout\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8ee70dc21cfb0019468f55?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gifts under $50 Under Armour\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Under Armour</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=15431&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=biip_102320_gift-guide-paid-placement&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.underarmour.com%2Fen-us%2Fp%2Fua-sportsmask%2F195250918950.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">UA Sportsmask, available at Under Armour, $30</a></h3><p>Working out safely, but not sweatily, has certainly been a challenge in 2020. Enter: the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/under-armour-sportsmask-review-breathable-unshakeable-sweaty-2020-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UA Sportsmask</a>. The mask was specifically designed with athletes in mind, as represented by its water-resistant shell, cooling inner lining, and UPF 50+ sun protection. It's a gorgeous and thoughtful gift that he'll use on his next trip.&#160;</p>\n\tA TSA-approved grooming and beauty kit\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dfd0486855cc2060008a2aa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jack Black The Grand Tour\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3 id=\"title\"><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=1237&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fshop.nordstrom.com%2Fs%2Fjack-black-the-grand-tour-collection-usd-81-value%2F4765013%2Flite\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Jack Black The Grand Tour, available on Nordstrom, $52</a></h3><p>Gone are the days of dumping his brand-new grooming products in the trash at security because they were one ounce over the limit. 15_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=yqjftPHIsIc:UPK5hxQkWrk:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn98@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-35-766_35c1cb3a86a10e9b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=yqjftPHIsIc:UPK5hxQkWrk:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn12@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-24-843_ceeaec210eaafa37.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=yqjftPHIsIc:UPK5hxQkWrk:gIN9vFwOqvQ":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/yqjftPHIsIc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn34@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-35-732_0d030396a6fa3c4c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712059},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"House panel says CDC director Robert Redfield demanded the deletion of an email showing interference in Covid-19 guidance","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-director-accused-of-directing-deletion-of-trump-aide-email-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd2757f2e054900186a3502?format=jpeg\" alt=\"trump visit cdc\" height=\"977\" width=\"1955\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>US President Donald Trump alongside US Health and Human Service Secretary Alex Azar (at left), and CDC Director Robert Redfield (at right) during a tour of the CDC headquarters in Atlanta, Georgia, on March 6, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jim Watson/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>CDC Robert Redfield allegedly ordered subordinates to delete an email from a senior health official in the Trump administration requesting changes to a major report on how COVID-19 impacts children.</li>\n<li>Charlotte Kent, editor of the Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report, told congressional investigators on Monday that she was instructed her to delete HHS staffer Paul Alexander's email in August.</li>\n<li>Rep. James Clyburn, who leads the House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis, wrote in a letter to Trump administration health officials that the email deletion may be evidence of a cover-up of political interference.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Robert Redfield, allegedly ordered subordinates to delete an email from a senior health official in the Trump administration requesting changes to a major report on how COVID-19 impacts children.</p><p>Charlotte Kent, editor of the Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report, <a href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/12/10/cdc-redfield-email-house-watchdog-444238\">told congressional investigators on Monday</a> that, at Redfield's direction, a colleague at the CDC instructed her to delete HHS staffer Paul Alexander's email in August. She was on vacation at the time and told investigators that by the time she'd searched for the email, it had already been deleted.&#160;</p><p>Rep. James Clyburn, who leads the House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis, wrote in a letter to Redfield and Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar that he has \"serious\" concerns about \"what may be deliberate efforts by the Trump Administration to conceal and destroy evidence that senior political appointees interfered with career officials' response to the coronavirus crisis at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.\"</p><p>The MMWR was not altered before it was published. But intentionally destroying federal records is a criminal offense that can be punished with prison time.&#160;</p><p>In the email, which Clyburn quotes in his letter, Alexander wrote that the CDC's report on the coronavirus' impact on children was \"very misleading\" and aimed to undermine President Donald Trump.&#160;</p><p>\"This is designed to hurt this President [sic] for their reasons which I am not interested in,\" Alexander, a top aide to Azar, wrote in the deleted message.&#160;</p><p>Clyburn also alleged in his letter that Trump administration officials improperly delayed the publication of a CDC report on the spread of COVID-19 at a Georgia summer camp until after Redfield testified before Congress on July 31.</p><p>A spokesperson for HHS <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/covid-cdc-director-email/2020/12/10/bc72461a-3af3-11eb-9276-ae0ca72729be_story.html\">told The Washington Post</a> that Clyburn's characterization of Kent's allegations was \"irresponsible\" and denied her charges.&#160;</p><p>\"We urge the subcommittee to release the transcript in full, which will show that during her testimony Dr. Kent repeatedly said there was no political interference in the MMWR process,\" the spokesperson said.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-director-accused-of-directing-deletion-of-trump-aide-email-2020-12'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=0LcpK6Yp-Sw:FOeYHXVGAik:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=0LcpK6Yp-Sw:FOeYHXVGAik:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/0LcpK6Yp-Sw\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Dec 2020 20:59:14 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fd275907b7e0500191073fa?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"a721ce32153524be96b9264b9d3c5384","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn81@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-20-598_dcac7b72ed5bfc38.webp","destWidth":1308,"destHeight":978,"sourceBytes":125576,"destBytes":125576,"author":"insider@insider.com (Eliza Relman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd2757f2e054900186a3502?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn75@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-34-634_26188e4a55417fed.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=0LcpK6Yp-Sw:FOeYHXVGAik:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn44@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-25-015_8e1c920343490dde.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=0LcpK6Yp-Sw:FOeYHXVGAik:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn47@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-36-032_64ee0c378c2004e6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=0LcpK6Yp-Sw:FOeYHXVGAik:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn16@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-24-968_d1deb1326a9b7bc7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/0LcpK6Yp-Sw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn93@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-26-012_4dfdd139eb8fbf64.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712062},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"With weeks left in office, the Trump administration is doing a 180-degree turn on a frustrating NATO ally","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-administration-reportedly-sanctioning-turkey-over-s-400-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5da4d5044af909270141c8d2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump Erdogan\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan at the G20 leaders summit in Osaka, Japan, June 29, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kevin Lamarque/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President Donald Trump has held off on sanction Turkey over its purchase of a Russian air-defense system for three years.</li>\n<li>Recent reports indicated that the Trump administration is reversing course, as Congress pushes for action, but with tensions in the region rising, Turkey appears unlikely to back down from its purchase.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>President Donald Trump spent much of his time in office nurturing a relationship with Turkey and its president, Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.</p><p>That seeming affinity was in contrast to much of the US government's and Congress' frustration with Turkish moves that ran counter to US interests in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.</p><p>Now with just weeks left in office, and with lawmakers pressing for action, the Trump administration appears to be acting on one of the most serious disputes, sanctioning Ankara for its purchase of the Russian-made S-400 air-defense system, which is seen as a threat to the F-35 fighter-jet program and to NATO operations.</p><p>The sanctions would target Turkey's Presidency of Defence Industries, a government office that oversees military technology, and its president, Ismail Demir, according to Reuters, which <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSL1N2IQ2AF\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">first reported the looming sanctions </a>Thursday.</p><p>When asked Thursday about the report, the Treasury Department said it had no comment and the National Security Council referred questions to the State Department, which said it doesn't \"preview sanctions or possible sanctions.\"</p><h2>'About time'</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d2c9cefb44ce71f1c5b073e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Russia Turkey S-400 delivery\" height=\"932\" width=\"1400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The first parts of a Russian S-400 are unloaded from a Russian plane at Murted Airport, known as Akinci Air Base, near Ankara, July 12, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Turkish Military/Turkish Defence Ministry/Handout via REUTERS</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Turkey purchased the weapon system in 2017, and in August that year Trump signed the Countering America's Adversaries Through Sanctions Act, which was meant to deter other countries from buying Russian arms.</p><p>The US has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-says-turkey-situation-complex-is-talking-to-turkish-officials-2019-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">kicked Turkey out</a> of the F-35 program over the S-400, but Trump has avoided applying sanctions. However, this year's annual National Defense Authorization Act, which funds the military, includes a measure requiring them.</p><p>Its purchase \"constitutes a significant transaction as described\" in CAATSA, the bill states, adding that within 30 days of signing, the president \"shall impose\" sanctions. Trump has threatened to veto the NDAA over unrelated provisions.</p><p>Sen. Chris Van Hollen, a Democrat from Maryland, said it was \"about time\" to act on sanctions and that he was \"glad to see Congress do what the administration would not.\"</p><p>The S-400 is just one issue that has divided Turkey and its allies.</p><p>In Syria, Turkey has battled ISIS militants and US-backed fighters, both groups which Ankara considers terrorists. Turkey's involvement in Libya's civil war has <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-nato-france-turkey-analysis/france-turkey-tensions-mount-after-nato-naval-incident-idUSKBN2481K5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">strained</a> its relations with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nato-could-face-ultimate-test-in-growing-libya-proxy-war-2020-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">NATO and other US allies</a>. More recently, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/turkey-greece-tensions-in-mediterranean-create-problems-for-us-nato-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Turkey and Greece clashed</a> over a longstanding maritime dispute in the Eastern Mediterranean Sea. Both are NATO members, and their worsening tensions added to the alliance's headaches.</p><p>Other US actions, like the Navy's <a href=\"https://www.navy.mil/Press-Office/News-Stories/display-news/Article/2369540/uss-hershel-woody-williams-shifts-homeport-to-greece/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">recent decision</a> to make Greece's Souda Bay the homeport for a expeditionary ship, have also been viewed negatively by Turkey.</p><p>Congress is not alone in its frustration. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has criticized the S-400 deal, and at a NATO meeting this month, Pompeo <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/turkey-usa-nato-int/in-parting-shot-pompeo-rebukes-turkey-at-nato-meeting-idUSKBN28D1YJ\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">reportedly inveighed</a> against Ankara, saying the purchase was \"a gift\" to Russia and that Turkey's dispute with Greece was undermining NATO.</p><p>Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu fired back at that meeting, and this week, the presidential spokesman and chief advisor to Erdoğan, Amb. Prof. Ibrahim Kalin, called the S-400 the \"result, not the cause of\" a number of disagreements.</p><p>\"Repeated requests\" to buy US-made Patriot air-defense systems were \"turned down because we were not able to agree on the terms,\" Kalin said a German Marshall Fund virtual event. Former US officials <a href=\"https://warontherocks.com/2019/07/the-tale-of-turkey-and-the-patriots/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">have attributed</a> the failure to Erdoğan's frustration with a 2016 coup attempt as well as differences over the conflict in Syria.</p><p>Kalin said the S-400 issue could still be addressed from \"a technical-military point of view, but we also know that it's no longer a technical-military issue.\"</p><p>\"It was conceived by the Congress as a political issue for [Turkey] having close defense-industrial relations with Russia,\" Kalin added.</p><h2>Interests and allies</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faab66f1df1d50018219d7c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages erdogan biden\" height=\"647\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Erdogan and Joe Biden, then the US vice president, at the presidential complex in Ankara, August 24, 2016.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Kayhan Ozer/Anadolu Agency/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>If Trump doesn't follow through with NDAA-mandated sanctions, President-elect Joe Biden, who takes office on January 20, would be obligated to impose them.</p><p>Biden \"will probably go ahead with sanctions, but how harsh those will be will matter in determining the tone of the relationship,\" said Kadir Ustun, executive director of the SETA Foundation in Washington, DC. (SETA has links to Erdoğan's government, including through Kalin, who is a founder and former director of the think tank.)</p><p>Turkey \"will not bow to sanctions, and it would be counterproductive,\" which Biden is aware of, Ustun said.</p><p>Relations with Turkey are likely to be a concern for the Biden administration. Its <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-turkey-russian-s400-tension-could-be-problem-black-sea-2019-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">location as well as its economic and military strength</a> make it a valuable ally, particularly amid ongoing tensions with Russia.</p><p>\"You have to think cold-hearted, look at the map, look at the geography, what are our interests? And it is definitely in our interest that Turkey remains a member of NATO,\" Ben Hodges, former commander of US Army Europe, said in an interview this fall.</p><p>Biden's team are \"very knowledgeable\" of the issues Ankara cares about and \"recognize[s] the critical importance of Turkey\" in the region, Ustun said.</p><p>\"We might see a change of tone overall, but the Biden promise to rebuild relationships with allies, I expect, would extend to Turkey as well,\" Ustun said, adding that \"if Turkey sees a harder line ... it would react in strong terms.\"</p><p>\"The security concerns of the US military or political establishment [over the S-400] can be addressed,\" Kalin said this week, \"but the longer this takes and the more pressure they put on Turkey ... the problem will be much more difficult to resolve.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/_pPIrKmFTGQ\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Dec 2020 22:32:34 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fd29d129cf1420018d2ea97?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"36d082ff39b4723560fbbe9249d6e343","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn34@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-20-586_c4fa32a1613f6528.webp","destWidth":1282,"destHeight":961,"sourceBytes":60714,"destBytes":60714,"author":"insider@insider.com (Christopher Woody)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5da4d5044af909270141c8d2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn40@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-28-510_4d402f01aa86eeee.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d2c9cefb44ce71f1c5b073e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn5@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-27-491_f0cf4a5897db44b5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5faab66f1df1d50018219d7c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn19@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-33-408_54f94fea91928c94.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_pPIrKmFTGQ:7RPqcfaLGgM:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn95@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-23-409_bcab348f97ce5c26.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_pPIrKmFTGQ:7RPqcfaLGgM:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn21@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-22-754_0b77e2d1b8e4e9e9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_pPIrKmFTGQ:7RPqcfaLGgM:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn14@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-955_effee48fde854855.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/_pPIrKmFTGQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn75@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-29-235_c5a8fc5fa49a8a5a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712044},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"'It's silly season': Airbnb and DoorDash's IPO rallies signal return of dot-com-era greed, strategists say","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-doordash-ipo-rallies-market-euphoria-greed-strategists-abnb-dash-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd26d247b7e0500191073c9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Airbnb IPO\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Nasdaq digital billboard in Times Square in New York on December 10.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo by Kena Betancur/AFP/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/airbnb-stock\">Airbnb's</a>&#160;and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/dash-stock\">DoorDash's</a> massive debut rallies suggest the IPO market is getting ahead of itself, top strategists said Thursday.</strong></li><li><strong>Airbnb <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/airbnb-stock-price-ipo-trading-debut-valuation-past-100-billion-2020-12-1029882956?utm_campaign=browser_notification&utm_source=desktopktop\">spiked 115%</a>&#160;when it began trading publicly for the first time on Thursday. DoorDash <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/doordash-stock-price-ipo-public-trading-debut-nyse-dash-offering-2020-12-1029878632\">closed 86% higher</a>&#160;in its Wednesday debut.</strong></li><li><strong>The first-day climbs revealed \"euphoria and greed\" last seen in the market during the dot-com bubble of the late 1990s, Paul Schatz, the president and chief investment officer of Heritage Capital, said.</strong></li><li><strong>\"It's silly season,\" and investors need to differentiate between \"a great company and a great price or value,\" Rich Steinberg, the chief market strategist at the Colony Group, told Business Insider.</strong></li><li><strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestutm_source=msn.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=msn-slideshow&utm_campaign=bodyurl?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestts&#38;utm_medium=ingest\">Visit the Business Insider homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/airbnb-stock\">Airbnb's</a> and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/dash-stock\">DoorDash's</a> colossal post-IPO pops reveal unsustainable euphoria in the stock market, top strategists said.</p><p>Some of the year's biggest initial public offerings took place this week, adding to an already record year for market debuts. DoorDash <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/doordash-stock-price-ipo-public-trading-debut-nyse-dash-offering-2020-12-1029878632\">soared 86%</a> when it began trading on Wednesday after raising $3.2 billion through its offering the day prior. Airbnb <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/airbnb-stock-price-ipo-trading-debut-valuation-past-100-billion-2020-12-1029882956?utm_campaign=browser_notification&utm_source=desktopktop\">leaped 115%</a> when it began trading Thursday afternoon, pushing its market cap above $100 billion and raising $3.5 billion.</p><p>The first-day rallies, while extraordinary, show \"euphoria and greed\" that's likely not been seen in the stock market since the dot-com bubble of the late 1990s, Paul Schatz, the president and chief investment officer of Heritage Capital, said. Many investors are rushing to the new stocks, wanting to get in at any price, but such massive IPO bounces usually give way to similarly outsize losses, he added.&#160;</p><p>\"It's silly season,\" Rich Steinberg, the chief market strategist of the Colony Group, told Business Insider. \"Investors need to distinguish the difference between a great company and a great price or value.\"</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/global-investing-strategy-stocks-and-bonds-in-2021-john-hancock-2020-12\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"\">2 investment chiefs at John Hancock's $692 billion investing arm say the post-COVID recovery might disappoint in 2021 - but investors can profit with these 3 strategies</a></em></p><p>Both strategists attributed some of that euphoria to the near-zero interest rates expected to stay put over the next three years. The Federal Reserve's plan to hold rates at record lows leaves investors with fewer places to put their money, as the policy suppressed Treasury yields early in the pandemic. The Fed's backstop of the corporate credit market placed similar pressure on bond yields.</p><p>The combination of near-zero interest rates, a \"tsunami of liquidity,\" and hundreds of billions in unallocated investor cash fueled the two buying sprees, Schatz said.</p><p>The week's booms might be only the start. Investors could face \"complete and utter mania\" across the IPO market in the first half of 2021 as more firms look to tap the market while demand remains strong, the Heritage Capital president said. Investors should avoid trying to time such volatile debuts and instead be patient until stock prices better reflect firms' fundamentals, he added.</p><p>\"Being the last guy buying the opening of a hot IPO, at the height of this speculative excess in some of these names, typically does not end well,\" Steinberg said.&#160;</p><p><em><strong>Now read more markets coverage from Markets Insider and Business Insider:</strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/stock-market-news-today-indexes-jobless-claims-rise-stimulus-negotiations-2020-12-1029881890\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"\">US stocks dip as stimulus hopes waver and jobless claims hit 11-week high</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a data-analytics-module=\"\">Blank-check firm Silver Spike rallies 49% after merging with cannabis-tech platform Weedmaps</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a 2020 01:16:25 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fd26d2b30f2740018b0f22e?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"77f41acb0501ba15c7d530a188b708d9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn38@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-20-628_458231107ed378e2.webp","destWidth":2220,"destHeight":1665,"sourceBytes":353990,"destBytes":353990,"author":"bwinck@businessinsider.com (Ben Winck)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd26d247b7e0500191073c9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn80@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-29-275_b2a88e8b73c7cfcf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=MCCg9mg0jsQ:AYz2w4s8L6Y:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn82@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-24-057_36d5202609874228.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=MCCg9mg0jsQ:AYz2w4s8L6Y:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn85@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-35-489_b466a02a9d8f613f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=MCCg9mg0jsQ:AYz2w4s8L6Y:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn67@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-26-689_4ecf0c7ba0f0edfa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/MCCg9mg0jsQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn99@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-32-485_ad83a20e518d5fbf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712040},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"Majority of House Republicans support a lawsuit that aims to overturn the will of voters and hand 2020 election to Trump","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/majority-of-house-gop-support-lawsuit-aimed-at-overturning-election-2020-12","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd2b4bce00bce00188baaf5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 1284289810\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   A protester in Pennsylvania holds a sign that reads \"Count Every Vote.\" \n   <p class=\"copyright\">Ben Hasty/MediaNews Group/Reading Eagle via Getty Images</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\"> \n <li>A majority of Republicans in the House of Representatives have signed on to an amicus brief asking the US Supreme Court to effectively overturn the results of the 2020 election.</li> \n <li>The letter asks the Supreme Court to recognize the alleged right of Republican-led legislatures to ignore the popular vote and select electors who will support outgoing President Donald Trump.</li> \n <li>No evidence of widespread fraud has been presented by the loser of the 2020 election or his allies.</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li> \n</ul>\n<p>A majority of House Republicans have formally expressed their opposition to recognizing the democratic outcome of the 2020 election, signing an amicus brief siding with a Texas lawsuit that aims to discard the will of voters in battleground states won by President-elect Joe Biden.</p>\n<p>President Donald Trump lost the November election in a relative landslide: 7 million more people voted for his opponent than for him, leaving the outgoing president with 232 votes in the Electoral College to 306 for Biden. But the lawsuit filed by Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton seeks to undo the outcome, specifically by throwing out the votes in Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, Michigan, and Georgia, replacing the will of the people with pro-Trump electors appointed by the states' Republican-led legislatures.</p>\n<p>And at least 106 elected Republicans in the House of Representatives agree with that strategy, <a href=\"https://www.supremecourt.gov/DocketPDF/22/22O155/163403/20201210153048641_Texas%20v.%20Pennsylvania%20Amicus%20Brief%20of%20106%20Representatives.pdf\">submitting a brief</a> with the US Supreme Court that \"defends the constitutional authority of state legislatures as the only bodies duly authorized to establish the manner by which presidential electors are appointed.\"</p>\n<p>Outside of those who are retiring, there are members who signed the letter who were returned to office in an election they now claim is illegitimate.</p>\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">\n —Brad Heath (@bradheath) \n <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1337136608349478918?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">December 10, 2020</a>\n</blockquote>\n<script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script>\n<p>The litigation is highly unlikely to succeed; under the US Constitution, states administer their own elections, Texas provides no say over how they are run in Pennsylvania and vice versa. However, it signals a willingness on the part of many if not most elected Republicans to subvert democracy and their own commitment states' rights for sheer partisan gain.</p>\n<p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stimulus-document-bipartisan-deal-liability-mcconnell-2020-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\" data-qa=\"message_attachment_title_link\">New document shows all the details of the $908 billion bipartisan coronavirus stimulus in the works</a>&nbsp;</em></p>\n<p>No evidence of widespread fraud has been uncovered, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-lawsuits-election-results-2020-11\">either by Trump's lawyers</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ag-barr-confirms-lack-of-widespread-fraud-in-election-2020-12\">his Department of Justice</a>, or <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/republican-georgia-secretary-of-state-says-no-sign-of-widespread-fraud-in-vote-count-2020-11\">Republican officials</a> who oversaw voting in the states at issue, and certainly none sufficient to justify unprecedented intervention by judges that, as recourse, would effectively rob tens of millions of people of their right to vote - after their vote has already been cast, based on the results of them being counted.</p>\n<p>Though in the minority, some elected Republicans have recognized that. On Wednesday, Texas Sen. John Cornyn told CNN he was \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/gop-sen-john-cornyn-criticizes-lawsuit-aimed-overturning-biden-win-2020-12\">unconvinced</a>\" by what he characterized as the dubious legal arguments put forward by his state's attorney general, who has since been joined by 17 other states.</p>\n<p>Another Texan, Rep. Chip Roy, was more forceful, on Thursday calling the brief filed by his colleagues \"<a href=\"https://twitter.com/chiproytx/status/1337090007937527811\">a dangerous violation of federalism</a>,\" if not democratic values, saying he \"cannot support an effort that will almost certainly fail... and is inconsistent with my beliefs about protecting Texas sovereignty from the meddling of other states.\"</p>\n<p><em>Have a news tip? Email this reporter: <a href=\"mailto:cdavis@insider.com\">cdavis@insider.com</a></em></p>\n<div class=\"read-original\">\n Read the original article on \n <a Davis)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd2b4bce00bce00188baaf5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn60@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-22-328_fcf9e3e506841efb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qD3bezYh7Gc:rAn91RQe_qI:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn91@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-25-353_5e3b87cbd4b83b08.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qD3bezYh7Gc:rAn91RQe_qI:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn99@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-31-073_d9d798bb18df93d4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=qD3bezYh7Gc:rAn91RQe_qI:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn95@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-35-32-500_22d95d3f4a5f8b21.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/qD3bezYh7Gc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn83@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-35-31-074_a9a5bfb73cf08b55.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712040},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"More Americans have now died from COVID-19 than the number of US soldiers killed in battle during World War II","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/more-americans-dead-covid-19-us-battle-deaths-wwii-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd28c2d2dc42e0018f0e492?format=jpeg\" alt=\"D Day\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>American reinforcements, arrive on the beaches of Normandy from a Coast Guard landing barge into the surf on the French coast on June 23, 1944 during World War II.\n<p class=\"copyright\">US COAST GUARD/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The US saw 291,557 battle deaths during World War II, according to the Department of Veterans Affairs.</li>\n<li>The total number of confirmed COVID-19 deaths has surpassed that grim milestone. As of Thursday, 291,754 Americans have now died of this disease.&#160;</li>\n<li>This means more Americans have died from COVID-19 than the number of US soldiers killed in the bloodiest war in human history.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The United States has now recorded more COVID-19 deaths than the total number of Americans killed in combat during World War II, the bloodiest war in human history.&#160;&#160;</p><p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.va.gov/opa/publications/factsheets/fs_americas_wars.pdf\">Department of Veterans Affairs</a>, the US saw 291,557 battle deaths during WWII. As of Thursday evening, there have been 291,754 COVID-19 deaths in the US, based on data compiled by <a href=\"https://gisanddata.maps.arcgis.com/apps/opsdashboard/index.html#/bda7594740fd40299423467b48e9ecf6\">Johns Hopkins University</a>.&#160;</p><p>The coronavirus pandemic had killed more Americans than the Vietnam War <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/04/28/846701304/pandemic-death-toll-in-u-s-now-exceeds-vietnam-wars-u-s-fatalities#:~:text=Live%20Sessions-,A%20Deadly%20Disease%20Has%20Now%20Killed%20More%20Americans%20Than%20The,perished%20in%20the%20Vietnam%20War.\">by late April.</a></p><p>And by <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/live-blog/2020-05-17-coronavirus-news-n1208791/ncrd1208966#blogHeader\">around mid-May</a>, the US COVID-19 death toll had already surpassed the combined number of Americans killed in battle in every major US war since 1945 - nearly 87,000. The number of Americans killed by COVID-19 is now equivalent to almost half of the total death toll in the Civil War - approximately 620,000 - which was the bloodiest war in American history.&#160;</p><p>The US has consistently had the highest numbers of confirmed COVID-19 cases and fatalities in the world. The national caseload has surpassed 15.5 million as of Thursday, per Johns Hopkins.</p><p>House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Thursday morning noted that the US COVID-19 death toll would soon surpass to the total number of American soldiers killed in battle during WWII.&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Manu Raju  (@mkraju) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1337065971236876290?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">December 10, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Pelosi said that the war brought the country together but that President Donald Trump is not a \"unifying\" president.&#160;</p><p>\"We do not have a unifying President of the United States. In fact, we have a president in denial, delaying, and distorting, calling it a hoax. Many more thousands of people have died because of that,\" <a href=\"https://twitter.com/nowthisnews/status/1337070318888882178?s=20\">Pelosi said</a>.&#160;</p><p>Trump has been widely criticized over his response to the US COVID-19 outbreak and polling has consistently shown a <a href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/coronavirus-polls/\">majority of Americans</a> disapprove of his handling of the pandemic.</p><p>The president has repeatedly downplayed the threat of COVID-19, which he contracted in early October, and gone against the recommendations of top public health experts.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/more-americans-dead-covid-19-us-battle-deaths-wwii-2020-12'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=VuU-PVSBNgw:TAwWbCll72Y:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img
