4},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"The 'unprecedented' wreck of a Hyundai cargo ship off the coast of Georgia a year ago is no longer a mystery - here's what happened","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/cargo-ship-capsizes-thousands-of-new-hyundais-kias-on-board-2019-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d76a0042e22af7c1559b8b2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray capsized 8\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Golden Ray capsized on Sunday for unknown reasons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Cargo-Ship-Georgia/191bbe8fb5cc41f0ab442a5695f7590f/2/0\" target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/Associated Press</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A cargo ship owned by Hyundai Glovis, Hyundai motor's ocean freight logistics company, capsized and caught fire off the coast of Georgia in September 2019.</li>\n<li>The cargo ship was carrying about 4,300 cars, and all 24 crew members were rescued alive, according to <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-hyundai-glovis-ship/hyundai-glovis-car-carrier-listing-off-coast-of-u-s-state-of-georgia-idUSKCN1VU02E\">Reuters</a> and <a href=\"https://www.caranddriver.com/news/amp34905650/golden-ray-kia-telluride-gm-suvs-on-board/?__twitter_impression=true\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"3220a444ef9e6e47427875e933e44f3c\">Car and Driver</a>.</li>\n<li>The Golden Ray is being sawed into eight pieces and removed segment-by-segment, <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/02/27/810021749/overturned-cargo-ship-soon-to-be-sliced-up-and-removed-from-georgia-sound\">NPR reported</a>.</li>\n<li>After delays from hurricanes and the coronavirus pandemic, the first segment, the bow of the ship, was removed in late November 2020, <a href=\"https://www.caranddriver.com/news/amp34905650/golden-ray-kia-telluride-gm-suvs-on-board/?__twitter_impression=true\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"3220a444ef9e6e47427875e933e44f3c\">Car and Driver</a> reported.</li>\n<li>The wreck may have been the result of replacing subcompact cars with the heavier Kia Telluride SUVs, therefore changing the ship's balance,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.caranddriver.com/news/amp34905650/golden-ray-kia-telluride-gm-suvs-on-board/?__twitter_impression=true\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"3220a444ef9e6e47427875e933e44f3c\">Car and Driver</a> reported.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A cargo ship carrying about 4,000 cars capsized and caught fire in September 2019 in St. Simons Sound off the coast of Brunswick, Georgia, according to <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2019/09/09/759022916/coast-guard-salvage-crews-have-made-contact-with-crew-on-overturned-ship\">NPR</a>.&#160;</p><p>The 656-foot Golden Ray vehicle carrier, owned by Hyundai Glovis, had a capacity of 6,933 cars, <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-hyundai-glovis-ship/hyundai-glovis-car-carrier-listing-off-coast-of-u-s-state-of-georgia-idUSKCN1VU02E\">according to Reuters</a>. At the time of its demise, the ship was carrying about 4,300 Kia, Chevrolet, GMC, GM, Mercedes-Benz, and Ram vehicles, <a href=\"https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a34905650/golden-ray-kia-telluride-gm-suvs-on-board/\">according to a report by Car and Driver</a>.</p><p>There were 24 people on board during the wreck: 23 crew members and one pilot. Of the rescued, 20 were initially safely removed from the boat according to the <a href=\"https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDHSCG/bulletins/25ddebb\">US Coast Guard.</a> The remaining four were later rescued, all alive and in \"relatively good condition,\" according to the <a href=\"https://apnews.com/5a9dfdca5b36459a950432ee18327f34\">Associated Press</a>.</p><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biggest-hiring-mistakes-ceo-hyundai-aptiv-joint-venture-autonomous-vehicles-2020-6?r=bc-sub\">The CEO of Hyundai and Aptiv's autonomous-vehicle joint venture reveals the biggest mistake managers make when hiring new employees</a></em></p><p>The removal company initially had the goal of&#160; removing the ship before the height of the hurricane season, <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/02/27/810021749/overturned-cargo-ship-soon-to-be-sliced-up-and-removed-from-georgia-sound\">NPR reported</a>, by <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0uJIwQDrXPA&feature=youtu.beu.be\">sawing the Golden Ray</a> into eight pieces and taking each segment piece-by-piece out of the water and onto a barge, according to an animated video <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0uJIwQDrXPA&feature=youtu.beu.be\">released by St. Simons Sound Joint Information Center on YouTube</a>.</p><p>However, after delays from hurricanes and the coronavirus pandemic, the first cut was not removed until late November 2020, <a href=\"https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a34905650/golden-ray-kia-telluride-gm-suvs-on-board/\">according to Car and Driver.</a> Shortly after oin December 9, 2020, <a href=\"https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a34905650/golden-ray-kia-telluride-gm-suvs-on-board/\">Car and Driver published a report</a> that found that hundreds of subcompact vehicles were replaced by the heavier Kia Telluride SUV, therefore changing the ship's balance and causing the wreck.</p><p>See the full timeline of the Golden Ray wreck:</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe cargo ship Golden Ray capsized and caught fire in September 2019 in St. Simons Sound off the coast of Brunswick, Georgia, roughly 80 miles south of Savannah, Georgia.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d769fa62e22af053e744696?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray capsized 9\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/APTOPIX-Cargo-Ship-Georgia/c2bc00e896634fd1a0a2a2f880dc30a4/1/0\" target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/Associated Press</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe US Coast Guard called the wreck \"unprecedented,\" according to NPR ...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e593611fee23d58cf2e77aa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray\" height=\"1292\" width=\"1723\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray cargo ship in St. Simons Island, Georgia.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Hennessy/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/02/27/810021749/overturned-cargo-ship-soon-to-be-sliced-up-and-removed-from-georgia-sound\">NPR</a></em></p>\n\t... and the ship listed a full 90 degrees, according to CBS News.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d76aaf62e22af787e13c047?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray Coastal Resources Division - Georgia DNR\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/pg/CoastalGaDNR/photos/?ref=page_internal\" target=\"_blank\">Coastal Resources Division - Georgia DNR</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/live-news/golden-ray-ship-cargo-ship-missing-crew-alive-coast-guard-today-2019-09-09-live-updates/\">CBS News</a></em></p>\n\tThe 656-foot vehicle carrier Golden Ray is owned and operated by Hyundai Glovis, Hyundai Motor's ocean freight logistics division.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d769f9c2e22af74fa0ef78a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray capsized 8\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Cargo-Ship-Georgia/191bbe8fb5cc41f0ab442a5695f7590f/2/0\" target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/Associated Press</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Golden Ray had the capacity to carry 6,933 vehicles.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d769f892e22af7e6500741e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray capsized 6\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Cargo-Ship-Georgia/f673520b401e4a5eaf18f9e1288c86a4/3/0\" target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/Associated Press</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tHowever, at the time of its demise, the ship was carrying about 4,300 Kia, Chevrolet, GMC, GM, Mercedes-Benz, and Ram vehicles when capsized, according to a report by Car and Driver.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d76aada2e22af0d371060f9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray Coastal Resources Division - Georgia DNR\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/pg/CoastalGaDNR/photos/?ref=page_internal\" target=\"_blank\">Coastal Resources Division - Georgia DNR</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a34905650/golden-ray-kia-telluride-gm-suvs-on-board/\">Car and Driver</a></em></p>\n\t\"We are making rescue of crew members as our top priority,\" a Hyundai Glovis official told Reuters at the time of the wreck. \"After that we will investigate any damage on cargo.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d76a6d12e22af62e10beb24?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray capsized 7\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Cargo-Ship-Georgia/360656542dde488aba6fce9506872d74/4/0\" target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/Associated Press</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://fr.reuters.com/article/us-hyundai-glovis-ship-idUSKCN1VU02E\">Reuters</a></em></p>\n\tThe ship was headed to Baltimore up the coast from Jacksonville, Florida.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d769f412e22af7bc0441756?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray capsized 1\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Georgia-Cargo-Ship/637c1d1536c24517b9937ecedccdfabb/9/0\" target=\"_blank\">U.S. Coast Guard/Associated Press</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere were 24 people on board: 23 crew members and one pilot. Everyone was rescued alive.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d769f492e22af7bc0441758?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray capsized 2\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Georgia-Cargo-Ship/479f5cad137e43dcab42c09fe57f50a5/7/0\" target=\"_blank\">U.S. Coast Guard/Associated Press</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBefore being rescued, the rescue team was communicating with the trapped crew members through a hole the rescuers' drilled, according to CBS.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d769f532e22af60b17665c6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray capsized 3\" height=\"1498\" width=\"1998\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Georgia-Cargo-Ship/7c13e96495ec467aa1662a6463014497/8/0\" target=\"_blank\">U.S. Coast Guard/Associated Press</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Georgia Department of Natural Resources had been monitoring the coastal environmental conditions following the capsizing.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d769f5f2e22af75cc16a915?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray capsized 4\" height=\"1335\" width=\"1780\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Georgia-Cargo-Ship/08f7c01a8267479a85d5127fe1a2862e/6/0\" target=\"_blank\">U.S. Coast Guard/Associated Press</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe company thanked the Coast Guard in a statement, and said it would work on \"mitigating damage to property and the environment.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d76aacf2e22af089062031c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray Coastal Resources Division - Georgia DNR\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/pg/CoastalGaDNR/photos/?ref=page_internal\" target=\"_blank\">Coastal Resources Division - Georgia DNR</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tA joint recovery team between the state of Georgia, the Coast Guard, and Hyundai's contractor, Gallagher Marine Systems, was tasked with pumping the approximately 300,000 gallons of fuel and oil out of the ship's tank, NPR reported.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5da8777d4af9091fb639afd4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray rescue\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.reutersconnect.com/all?id=tag%3Areuters.com%2C2019%3Anewsml_RC1F8E6D5860&#38;share=true\" target=\"_blank\">U.S. Coast Guard/Handout via Reuters</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2019/10/14/769523171/overturned-cargo-ship-in-georgia-stuck-on-side-leaking-fuel\">NPR</a></em></p>\n\tDespite these efforts, the Golden Ray was leaking an \"unknown\" amount of fuel, and oil sheens have been found in the surrounding waters on the beaches and marshes.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5da877894af9091fc61dae16?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray rescue\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Georgia-Daily-Life/a2d46cd2d0c84dca996a19ab822479a8/2/0\" target=\"_blank\">Steve Helber/Associated Press</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe crew tried to mitigate the spill spreading by setting up containment booms, spraying oil absorbents onto the marshes, and removing oiled dead grass.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5da87793cc4a0a4873411323?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray rescue\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Georgia-Daily-Life/803499da14d34084b147bb8f125a78be/1/0\" target=\"_blank\">Steve Helber/Associated Press</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tSalvage crew members were also monitoring the air and water quality and toxicity inside the ship to predict possible further contamination.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5da8779bcc4a0a4873411327?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray rescue\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/people-watch-from-jekyll-island-as-emergency-responders-news-photo/1167103830?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">Sean Rayford/Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOn October 25, 2019 the St. Simons Sound Response's Unified Command released 3D-photos of the ship's decks. This is the ninth deck.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5db83f30dee0193ba563e54e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cargo Hold Lidar Imagery_Golden Ray\" height=\"976\" width=\"1952\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://ssi.gallagherresponse.com/photo-release-cargo-hold-lidar-imagery/\" target=\"_blank\">Georgia Department of Natural Resources St. Simons Sound Response</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://ssi.gallagherresponse.com/photo-release-cargo-hold-lidar-imagery/\">St. Simons Sound Response</a></em></p>\n\tThe photos, including this one of the fourth deck, were created using laser technology that analyzed the inaccessible cargo hold filled with damaged cars.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5db83f3ddee0193680208967?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cargo Hold Lidar Imagery_Golden Ray\" height=\"871\" width=\"1743\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://ssi.gallagherresponse.com/photo-release-cargo-hold-lidar-imagery/\" target=\"_blank\">Georgia Department of Natural Resources St. Simons Sound Response</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThree days after the photos were released, the command decided to place rocks next to the hull to slow down the boat's erosion, according to Maritime Executive.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5db83f45dee01936af743215?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cargo Hold Lidar Imagery_Golden Ray\" height=\"976\" width=\"1952\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://ssi.gallagherresponse.com/photo-release-cargo-hold-lidar-imagery/\" target=\"_blank\">Georgia Department of Natural Resources St. Simons Sound Response</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.maritime-executive.com/article/rocks-to-be-placed-around-golden-ray\">Maritime Executive</a></em></p>\n\tThe rocks will be removed after the Golden Ray has been completely dismantled.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd271d07b7e0500191073dc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"AP20337583394198\" height=\"1406\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Golden Ray on December 1, 2020,\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.ap.org/detail/CargoShipGeorgia/390ea40bf9374c109ff184560eba3f9c/photo?Query=golden%20AND%20ray&#38;mediaType=photo&#38;sortBy=arrivaldatetime:desc&#38;dateRange=Anytime&#38;totalCount=177&#38;currentItemNo=8\" target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/AP Photo</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tMarine chemists and salvage operators, pictured below on November 22, 2019, were assessing the oil inside of the wreckage in order to figure out the best way to remove oil without damaging the environment and response crew.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0a5e1e855cc203620b0114?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray\" height=\"1498\" width=\"1998\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://ssiresponse.com/\" target=\"_blank\">St. Simons Sound Response</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWork barges have been deployed to clean up the tank's oil, as announced by St. Simons Sound Response on December 4, 2019. Barges provide better access to crew members and equipment.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0a5e28855cc2034566cc3e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://ssiresponse.com/\" target=\"_blank\">St. Simons Sound Response</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://ssiresponse.com/\">St. Simons Sound Response</a></em></p>\n\tOn December 12, 2019, the St. Simons Sound Incident Response Unified Command finished removing oil from all of the ship's 26 accessible tanks. Some of the tanks were submerged and had to be oil pumped via diving operations.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0a5e12855cc20bb13bab8a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray Prop to Barge 2\" height=\"1364\" width=\"1818\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://ssiresponse.com/\" target=\"_blank\">St. Simons Sound Response</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOver 320,000 gallons of oil and water were removed.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0a5e0d855cc2034330cc89?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray prop removed 1\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://ssiresponse.com/\" target=\"_blank\">St. Simons Sound Response</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t\"This milestone helps ensure the health of the environment and the livelihoods of the people who rely on the St. Simons Sound,\" Georgia Environmental Protection Division's emergency response state on-scene coordinator Jed Hewitt said in a statement. \"The removal of fuel from the vessel has significantly reduced the remaining threat to the environment.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd25f907b7e05001910738a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray on December 1, 2020 wreck\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Golden Ray on December 1, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.ap.org/detail/APTOPIXCargoShipGeorgia/dd0077ea4e564071bf1ff52c83372cff/photo?Query=golden%20AND%20ray&#38;mediaType=photo&#38;sortBy=arrivaldatetime:desc&#38;dateRange=Anytime&#38;totalCount=177&#38;currentItemNo=2\" target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/AP Photo</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.stsimonssoundincidentresponse.com/\">St. Simons Sound Incident Response</a></em></p>\n\tOn December 20, 2019, Golden Ray's rudder and propeller -which weighed a total of 130 tons - were removed to \"help reduce stresses to the hull of the wreck,\" St. Simons Sound Response wrote in a statement.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0a5e06855cc27bc914f534?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray Rudder Removal\" height=\"1495\" width=\"1993\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://ssiresponse.com/\" target=\"_blank\">St. Simons Sound Response</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tA fire was started on board the ship on January 19 when contract welders were working inside the ship. At least one car inside of the Golden Ray caught on fire, but the flames were put out via the contractor's fireboat, local news reported.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e2755fd62fa810e4950f8d6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Cargo-Ship-Georgia/e7a8f35f87c14d609b7a5fb46926527c/27/0\" target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/AP Photo</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.news4jax.com/news/local/2020/01/19/altamaha-riverkeepers-fire-sparks-on-golden-ray/\">First Coast News, News 4 Jax</a></em></p>\n\tDonjon-SMIT, the former Golden Ray salvage company, filed a lawsuit against the US Coast Guard alleging that the Coast Guard violated federal law by dropping Donjon-SMIT to work with a rival company, News 4 Jax reported.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e4d9bbe0438954fed2172a8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://ssiresponse.com/category/news-releases/\" target=\"_blank\">Coast Guard Petty Officer 3rd Class James Himes</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.news4jax.com/news/georgia/2020/02/15/salvage-firm-asks-us-judge-to-halt-removal-of-capsized-ship/\">News 4 Jax</a></em></p>\n\tDonjon-SMIT said the US Coast Guard allegedly violated a 1990 federal law after Donjon-SMIT was dropped as the official salvage response company even though it was already a part of the Golden Ray's response plan, WABE reported.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd271d130f2740018b0f23f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The Golden Ray on December 1, 2020\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Golden Ray on December 1, 2020,\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.ap.org/detail/CargoShipGeorgia/e1bde4ca718b407387d4128df58cc968/photo?Query=golden%20AND%20ray&#38;mediaType=photo&#38;sortBy=arrivaldatetime:desc&#38;dateRange=Anytime&#38;totalCount=177&#38;currentItemNo=6\" target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/AP Photo</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.wabe.org/lawsuit-filed-over-golden-ray-removal-plan/\">WABE</a></em></p>\n\t\"The cars need to be safely removed to avoid environmental disaster,\" Donjon-SMIT said in the legal filing, News 4 Jax reported.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd271cc30f2740018b0f23e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"AP20337583356366\" height=\"1406\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Golden Ray on December 1, 2020,\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.ap.org/detail/CargoShipGeorgia/2ce2118850bc43758643f284440b3acb/photo?Query=golden%20AND%20ray&#38;mediaType=photo&#38;sortBy=arrivaldatetime:desc&#38;dateRange=Anytime&#38;totalCount=177&#38;currentItemNo=7\" target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/AP Photo</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.news4jax.com/news/georgia/2020/02/15/salvage-firm-asks-us-judge-to-halt-removal-of-capsized-ship/\">News 4 Jax</a></em></p>\n\tThe new salvage company was set to start removing the Golden Ray in March, NPR reported.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e5935f1fee23d4a054b7a63?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray\" height=\"1329\" width=\"1771\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray cargo ship in St. Simons Island, Georgia.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Hennessy/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/02/27/810021749/overturned-cargo-ship-soon-to-be-sliced-up-and-removed-from-georgia-sound\">NPR</a></em></p>\n\tSt. Simons Sound Joint Information Center released an animated video on YouTube depicting how the wreck will be removed.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e5935fbfee23d51c0471c04?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray\" height=\"1329\" width=\"1771\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray cargo ship in St. Simons Island, Georgia.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Hennessy/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0uJIwQDrXPA&#38;feature=youtu.be\">YouTube</a>&#160;</em></p>\n\tThe Golden Ray was to be sawed into eight pieces, and the sections will then be individually lifted out of the water and placed onto a barge to be taken away.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e593607fee23d51d72bf994?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray\" height=\"1282\" width=\"1710\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray cargo ship in St. Simons Island, Georgia.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Hennessy/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWorkers from the salvage company placed an environmental barrier around the Golden Ray to stop oil and debris from spreading during the removal process.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e5936ddfee23d5310030334?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray\" height=\"1354\" width=\"1805\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray cargo ship in St. Simons Island, Georgia.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Hennessy/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAfter the coronavirus pandemic and hurricanes caused delays in the removal plan, the team finally lifted the bow, the ship's first cut, towards the end of November 2020, Car and Driver reported.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e5936f9fee23d5351013103?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray\" height=\"1186\" width=\"1581\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golden Ray cargo ship in St. Simons Island, Georgia.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Hennessy/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.caranddriver.com/news/amp34905650/golden-ray-kia-telluride-gm-suvs-on-board/?__twitter_impression=true\">Car and Driver</a></em></p>\n\tOn December 9, 2020, Car and Driver published a report that found that hundreds of subcompact vehicles were replaced by the heavier Kia Telluride SUVs, therefore changing the ship's balance and causing the wreck.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd25f8e7b7e050019107389?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray on December 1, 2020 wreck\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Golden Ray on December 1, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/AP Photo</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.caranddriver.com/news/amp34905650/golden-ray-kia-telluride-gm-suvs-on-board/?__twitter_impression=true\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"3220a444ef9e6e47427875e933e44f3c\">Car and Driver</a></em></p>\n\tAccording to the report, 316 new Tellurides replaced about 285 Kia Fortes and Hyundai Accents after the ship stopped in Brunswick, Georgia for a cargo change.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd25f917b7e05001910738b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray on December 1, 2020 wreck\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Golden Ray on December 1, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.ap.org/detail/APTOPIXCargoShipGeorgia/dd0077ea4e564071bf1ff52c83372cff/photo?Query=golden%20AND%20ray&#38;mediaType=photo&#38;sortBy=arrivaldatetime:desc&#38;dateRange=Anytime&#38;totalCount=177&#38;currentItemNo=2\" target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/AP Photo</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAccording to the Car and Driver report, the weight difference between a subcompact and a Telluride is about 1,200 pounds.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd25f917b7e05001910738c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golden Ray on December 1, 2020 wreck\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Golden Ray on December 1, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.ap.org/detail/APTOPIXCargoShipGeorgia/dd0077ea4e564071bf1ff52c83372cff/photo?Query=golden%20AND%20ray&#38;mediaType=photo&#38;sortBy=arrivaldatetime:desc&#38;dateRange=Anytime&#38;totalCount=177&#38;currentItemNo=2\" target=\"_blank\">Stephen B. Morton/AP Photo</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"US stocks waver as investors digest rising jobless claims and stimulus gridlock","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-news-today-surprise-jobless-continuing-claims-stimulus-gridlock-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fd2879e2dc42e0018f0e477?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Traders NYSE red worried\" height=\"400\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lucas Jackson/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>US stocks closed mixed on Thursday amid disappointing economic data and slowed stimulus progress.</strong></li><li><strong>The <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestm=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">S&#38;P 500</a> and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow_jones?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dow Jones industrial average</a> fell, while tech giants led the <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/nasdaq_composite?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nasdaq composite</a> to a single-day gain.</strong></li><li><strong>New US weekly jobless claims <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-weekly-jobless-claims-853000-unemployment-benefits-labor-market-recovery-2020-12\">jumped to an unadjusted 853,000</a> for the week that ended on Saturday, handily exceeding the 725,000 estimate. It was also the highest total in 11 weeks.</strong></li><li><strong>Democrats and Republicans remain at odds over a new fiscal relief package. The House voted Wednesday night to fund the government for an additional week and buy more time for stimulus negotiations.</strong></li><li><strong>The US Food and Drug Administration convened to evaluate <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/pfe-stock\">Pfizer's</a> coronavirus vaccine and decide whether its benefits outweigh its risks for use in people at least 16 years old.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/indices\">Watch major indexes update live here</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>US stocks closed mixed on Thursday as disappointing jobless claims data and slowed stimulus progress dragged on bullishness.</p><p>The S&#38;P 500 and Dow Jones industrial average fell further from record highs set on Tuesday. Tech giants led the Nasdaq composite to outperform with a single-day gain.</p><p>New filings for unemployment benefits <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-weekly-jobless-claims-853000-unemployment-benefits-labor-market-recovery-2020-12\">climbed to an unadjusted 853,000</a> for the week that ended on Saturday, the Labor Department said Thursday. Economists surveyed by Bloomberg had expected a reading of 725,000 claims. The reading was the highest level in 11 weeks and a sharp increase from the previous week's revised total of 716,000.</p><p>Continuing claims, which track the number of Americans receiving unemployment benefits, jumped to 5.8 million for the week that ended on November 28. That came in above economists' forecasts and marked the first weekly increase since August.</p><p><strong>Here's where US indexes stood at the 4 p.m. ET close on Thursday:</strong></p><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestm=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">S&#38;P 500</a>:</strong> 3,668.10, down 0.1%</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow_jones?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dow Jones industrial average</a>:</strong> 29,999.26, down 0.2% (70 points)</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/nasdaq_composite?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nasdaq composite</a>:</strong> 12,405.81, up 0.5%</li></ul><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/global-investing-strategy-stocks-and-bonds-in-2021-john-hancock-2020-12\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"\">2 investment chiefs at John Hancock's $692 billion investing arm say the post-COVID recovery might disappoint in 2021 - but investors can profit with these 3 strategies</a></em></p><p>\"The jump in weekly unemployment claims was partially due to a rebound from lower claims during Thanksgiving week, but the trend of more Americans losing jobs is clearly rising over the last month,\" said Robert Frick, a corporate economist at Navy Federal Credit Union.</p><p>On the stimulus front, Democratic and Republican leaders remain at odds over key elements of their respective proposals. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has offered a package without pandemic-related liability protections for businesses and aid for state and local governments. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi balked at the proposal, and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer emphasized the need for more state and local relief.</p><p>The House voted Wednesday night to fund the government for another week and buy extra time for stimulus talks. The S&#38;P 500 initially gained after Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and Pelosi said they've made progress in negotiations, but the index swung into a loss soon after.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cathie-wood-market-outlook-tesla-salesforce-slack-merger-bitcoin-webinar-2020-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Cathie Wood is beating 99% of fund managers this year. The ARK CEO and her team share their outlooks for 2021 - including thoughts on Tesla's $5 billion stock sale, the Salesforce-Slack tie-up, and bitcoin's meteoric rise.</a></em></p><p>Energy stocks outperformed in the benchmark index by a wide margin. Industrials and materials tumbled the most.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/airbnb-stock-price-ipo-trading-debut-valuation-past-100-billion-2020-12-1029882956?utm_campaign=browser_notification&utm_source=desktopktop\">Airbnb opened 115% higher</a> Thursday afternoon after raising $3.5 billion in its initial public offering. On Wednesday, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/doordash-stock-price-ipo-public-trading-debut-nyse-dash-offering-2020-12-1029878632?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\">DoorDash shares nearly doubled</a> in the company's first day of public trading. The IPO pops cap a record year for market debuts but signal market optimism may be overextended.</p><p>\"You have speculators rotating out of names and playing the Wall Street casino. This is indicative of that behavior,\" Rich Steinberg, chief investment strategist at The Colony Group, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/airbnb-doordash-ipo-rallies-market-euphoria-greed-strategists-abnb-dash-2020-12-1029883203\">told Business Insider</a>.</p><p>The US Food and Drug Administration convened to evaluate <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/pfe-stock\">Pfizer's</a> coronavirus vaccine. A panel is set to vote on Thursday on whether the benefits of the vaccine outweigh its risks for use in people at least 16 years old.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-advice-economic-recovery-priced-in-cyclical-stocks-mike-wilson-2020-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Morgan Stanley is warning that the stock market's economic recovery trade may soon be over. Here are 4 strategies they recommend for finding the returns that still exist.</a></em></p><p>Blank-check firm <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/silver-spike-spac-merger-weedmaps-cannabis-ecommerce-platform-stock-sspk-2020-12-1029882700\">Silver Spike Acquisition Corp. surged</a> after announcing plans to take cannabis e-commerce platform Weedmaps public. The deal will value the combined entity at roughly $1.5 billion.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/btc-usd\">Bitcoin</a> fell as low as $17,914.56 before bouncing back above the crucial $18,000 support level. The token has steadily trended lower after hitting a record high in early December.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/gold-price\">Gold</a> dropped as much as 0.6%, to $1,828.74 per ounce, after gaining through the morning. The US dollar weakened against a basket of Group-of-20 currencies, and Treasury yields fell.</p><p>Oil prices gained on vaccine hopes. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?type=wti\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">West Texas Intermediate crude</a> rose as much as 4.9%, to $47.74 per barrel. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestarkets&#38;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Brent crude</a>, oil's international benchmark, jumped as much as 4.5% to $51.06 per barrel, its highest level since March.</p><p><em><strong>Now read more markets coverage from Markets Insider and Business Insider:</strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-strategy-hedge-fund-managers-trades-bets-2020-emmet-peppers-2020-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Emmet Peppers grew his accounts from $30,000 in 2010 to over $70 million this year. The newly minted hedge fund manager breaks down how he spotted early opportunities in Tesla, Facebook, and the COVID-19 market crash - and shared one IPO on his radar.</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/tesla-stock-price-overvalued-sp500-inclusion-outlook-jpmorgan-tsla-2020-12-1029878536\" data-analytics-position=\"3\" data-analytics-module=\"\">'Not only overvalued, but dramatically so': Tesla stock should be avoided ahead of the automaker's S&#38;P 500 inclusion, JPMorgan says</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/jeremy-grantham-accidental-millions-profit-quantumscape-spac-blank-check-deal-2020-12-1029877766\" data-analytics-position=\"6\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Legendary investor Jeremy Grantham made an accidental $265 million profit on a SPAC deal after previously criticizing blank-check companies</a></strong></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-news-today-surprise-jobless-continuing-claims-stimulus-gridlock-2020-12'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=02nC-jDIFsM:NgNuRyF1_g8:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=02nC-jDIFsM:NgNuRyF1_g8:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=02nC-jDIFsM:NgNuRyF1_g8:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=02nC-jDIFsM:NgNuRyF1_g8:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=02nC-jDIFsM:NgNuRyF1_g8:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=02nC-jDIFsM:NgNuRyF1_g8:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=02nC-jDIFsM:NgNuRyF1_g8:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=02nC-jDIFsM:NgNuRyF1_g8:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/02nC-jDIFsM\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Dec 2020 21:18:13 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fd287a97b7e05001910746c?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"3cf153000990278f811589dbdb3ef839","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn53@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-20-523_c9db23cff6dfd7ea.webp","destWidth":711,"destHeight":533,"sourceBytes":28228,"destBytes":28228,"author":"bwinck@businessinsider.com (Ben Winck)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fd2879e2dc42e0018f0e477?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn78@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-35-26-677_a477b111c5a46deb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-35-32-215_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=02nC-jDIFsM:NgNuRyF1_g8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn95@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-28-148_361939bf5a6b8460.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=02nC-jDIFsM:NgNuRyF1_g8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn43@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-33-061_36b5d440c46af20f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-26-907_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=02nC-jDIFsM:NgNuRyF1_g8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn24@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-28-483_34ccf89a0a841cb0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/02nC-jDIFsM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn71@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-35-29-222_4007f07bf1df3bcf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607675712057},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:35:12","title":"Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine should be safe for most Americans, but 4 groups have to wait for more data before getting shots","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pfizer-coronavirus-vaccine-kids-pregnant-women-immunocompromised-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fcf3e3eeadd8400183dfb1b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"margaret keenan coronavirus vaccine\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Margaret Keenan, the first person to be given the Pfizer coronavirus vaccine outside clinical trials.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A <a href=\"https://www.fda.gov/media/144245/download\">recent FDA review</a> found there was \"insufficient data\" to conclude whether Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine is safe for kids under 16, pregnant women, and immunocompromised people.</li>\n<li>Experts also worry about <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/do-people-who-got-coronavirus-long-haulers-get-vaccine-2020-11\">vaccinating people who previously got COVID-19</a>, particularly if these people have lingering symptoms.</li>\n<li>Some of these vulnerable groups were included in Pfizer's late-stage clinical trials, which are ongoing.</li>\n<li>An FDA advisory committee is meeting Thursday to decide whether to recommend the shot for emergency use.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>US vaccine regulators provided <a href=\"https://www.fda.gov/media/144245/download\">a detailed look</a> at the side effects of Pfizer's coronavirus shot on Tuesday.&#160;</p><p>Most trial participants reported temporary side effects after being vaccinated, including fatigue, headaches, and pain at the injection site. People under 55 reported more side effects overall, but relatively few participants had severe fatigue or headaches that stopped them from performing normal activities.</p><p>These results were consistent across genders, age groups, ethnic and racial groups, and people with preexisting medical problems. But several populations were excluded from the trials - meaning the vaccine isn't known to be safe for all Americans just yet.</p><p>\"There are currently insufficient data to make conclusions about the safety of the vaccine in subpopulations such as children less than 16 years of age, pregnant and lactating individuals, and immunocompromised individuals,\" a recent Food and Drug Administration review concluded.</p><p>Some public-health experts have also questioned whether <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/do-people-who-got-coronavirus-long-haulers-get-vaccine-2020-11\">individuals who were already infected with the coronavirus</a> should get vaccinated,&#160;particularly if they have lingering symptoms.</p><p>An FDA advisory committee is meeting Thursday to decide whether to recommend the vaccines for emergency use. But even then, these four groups will have to wait for more safety data.</p><h2>Children under 16 are often last to be included in trials</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fcff9d9cee0cf00114fa45c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"face mask kid school covid 19\" height=\"3142\" width=\"4473\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Kindergartner Grace Truax, 5, removes her mask before posing for a portrait during &#34;picture day&#34; at Rogers International School on September 23, 2020 in Stamford, Connecticut.\n<p class=\"copyright\">John Moore/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Research shows that many children clear the coronavirus before it leads to severe disease, resulting in <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/children-weaker-antibody-response-coronavirus-milder-cases-study-2020-11\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"0b78a14d4daa2b69c599e052e45a47af\">mild or asymptomatic</a> cases. Children only represent around 7% of confirmed coronavirus infections in the US - the lowest of any age group, according to <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/69/wr/mm6924e2.htm#F1_down\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"68eec87c82641847d3bf08ee196b19cc\">the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention</a>.</p><p>That means kids aren't a priority group when it comes to vaccinations. They're also difficult to include in trials due to ethical and safety concerns: Some parents may not feel comfortable signing their kids up to participate, and researchers often prefer to test vaccines in a small group of adolescents before enrolling young kids.</p><p>Pfizer's clinical trials, for instance, did not include any participants younger than 12. Even then, the sample size of kids from ages 12 to 15 was too small to weigh the risks.</p><p>But there's little reason to suspect that kids will react poorly to the shots.</p><p>\"Children generally respond well to vaccines,\" Donna Farber, a Columbia University immunologist, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/children-weaker-antibody-response-coronavirus-milder-cases-study-2020-11\">told Business Insider</a>. \"They should respond well or comparably to a young adult - and maybe even better.\"</p><h2>Pregnant women were excluded from trials, too</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed11e35988ee316dd011007?format=jpeg\" alt=\"pregnant woman covid 19.JPG\" height=\"1335\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Nancy Pedroza, 27, experiences contractions while taking a walk with her doula.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Callaghan O&#39;Hare</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Pfizer's phase-one clinical trial included primarily healthy men and women. Its late-stage clinical trials then tested the vaccine among more vulnerable populations, including healthcare workers and people with autoimmune diseases.</p><p>But the company excluded pregnant women. It asked female volunteers to take a pregnancy test before each vaccination, and any with positive results were not allowed to continue.</p><p>That means researchers don't know how the vaccine affects pregnant women yet.</p><p>Pfizer plans to follow up with women who reported pregnancies during the course of the study, or those who choose to get vaccinated anyway once the shots are approved. That's how public-health experts eventually determined it was <a href=\"https://www.who.int/vaccine_safety/publications/safety_pregnancy_nov2014.pdf\">safe for pregnant women to get the flu vaccine</a>, even though these women were never included in flu vaccine trials.</p><p>Pfizer also plans to include pregnant women its vaccine study moving forward.</p><p>It's important to get this data as soon as possible, since <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pregnant-women-at-risk-severe-covid-19-cant-get-vaccine-2020-12\">pregnant women are at high risk for COVID-19 complications</a>. A&#160;<a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/69/wr/mm6944e3.htm#:~:text=Whereas%20increased%20risk%20for%20severe,women%20of%20the%20same%20age.\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"60d3abb869a6d9a208ec8b48df2098b3\">November CDC report</a> found that pregnant women with COVID-19 are more likely to be admitted into the intensive-care unit, put on ventilators, need life support, and die than patients who aren't pregnant.</p><p>Pregnant women of color are particularly vulnerable: The report found that of all symptomatic pregnant women with COVID-19, 30% were Hispanic. But only 24% of women who gave birth in 2019 were Hispanic. White women, on the other hand, represented 51% of women who gave birth in 2019, but only 24% of symptomatic pregnant women with COVID-19.</p><h2>HIV-positive individuals and others with weakened immune systems must also wait for more data</h2><h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fce6464037cbd0018614425?format=jpeg\" alt=\"covid safe hug\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Michelle Grant hugs her mother, Mary Grace Sileo, through a plastic drop cloth in Wantagh, New York. It was the first time they&#39;d physical contact since February.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Al Bello/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></h2><p>Though Pfizer's late-stage trials included people with preexisting health problems, there wasn't enough data to determine whether the vaccine is safe for those with weakened immune systems, according to the FDA review. For example, the trials only included a small number of HIV-positive individuals, and researchers didn't have enough time to follow up with this group before applying for emergency authorization.</p><p>It's a good sign that serious adverse events were only reported in 0.6% of vaccine recipients, but immunocompromised people have to be particularly careful about vaccines. If a patient's immune system isn't working properly, they may require extra doses. Others might want to avoid getting vaccinated while taking immunosuppressants like corticosteroids or chemotherapy drugs.&#160;</p><p>For the most part, doctors recommend that immunocompromised people steer clear of vaccines that use live virus. But Pfizer's vaccine instead relies on a snippet of the virus' genome to trigger an immune response.&#160;</p><p>Dr. Edward Jones-Lopez, an infectious-disease specialist at the University of Southern California, <a href=\"https://www.healthline.com/health-news/why-some-immunocompromised-people-may-not-be-eligible-for-a-covid-19-vaccine#Immunocompromised-not-included-in-initial-vaccine-trials\">told Healthline</a> that he estimates \"we are one or two studies away\" from finding out whether coronavirus vaccines are safe for immunocompromised people.</p><h2>People who previously got COVID-19 are in a grey area&#160;</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d7a6b60bf1f00280799b1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"coronavirus testing\" height=\"3264\" width=\"4896\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Patient Setsuko Smidmore awaits testing at St George Hospital in Sydney, Australia, May 15, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lisa Maree Williams/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Pfizer hasn't specified whether its vaccine is safe for people who previously had COVID-19. Studies suggest these patients may have immunity to the virus that lasts anywhere from several months to several years. But the research is far from conclusive. They're likely to need a vaccine at some point down the line.</p><p>\"We want to look at vaccinating patients who have not been infected with COVID who are susceptible,\" Todd Ellerin, director of infectious diseases at South Shore Health in Massachusetts, told Business Insider. \"The post-COVID patients are not going to be your first, second, third, or fourth tier of groups that you're going to look at to want to vaccinate.\"</p><p>For people with long-lasting symptoms - known as long-haulers - it's possible that a vaccine could intensify an already aggressive immune response that for many has led to fatigue, muscle aches, trouble breathing, heart palpitations, or difficulty concentrating or sleeping.&#160;</p><p>\"It'd be hard to engage a long-hauler in [a vaccine] study if they're having ongoing health problems,\" Natalie Lambert, an associate professor of medicine at Indiana University, told Business Insider. \"Ethically there'd be big problems with having them take a vaccine, if you're worried about those effects.\"</p><p>Pfizer, however, didn't screen participants for evidence of a prior coronavirus infection during its late-stage clinical trial. So it turned out that 3% of participants had been infected before. The data showed that the vaccine was just as effective among this group, but the FDA review said there wasn't enough evidence to know if the vaccine prevented reinfection.</p><p>Ellerin said it's unwise to inoculate previously infected people without more safety data.</p><p>\"We have to keep our eye on the prize right now,\" he said. \"Of course patients can get COVID more than once, so I'm not trying to tell you that they'll be excluded from this down the road, but we have a lot more to learn.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
